"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC(Cl)=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 20 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: NaOH (1.20 g, 0.030 mol) was added to the substituted benzaldehyde (0.010 mol) and the substituted 2’-hydroxyacetophenone (0.010 mol) in EtOH (30 mL) solution at room temperature. This reaction mixture was stirred for 20 h at room temperature. The mixture was poured into conc HCl (10 mL) and crash ice (about 150 g), then the mixture was stirred for 30 min. Most of substituted 2’-hydroxychalcone was displayed as precipitate, and it was filtered using suction filtration. The solid residue was purified with recrystallization afforded pure substituted 2’-hydroxychalcone. On the other hand, when the substituted 2’-hydroxychalcone was an oily substance, the HCl solution was extracted with EtOAc (200 mL), washed with brine, dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and the solvent was removed under reduced pressure. This oily residue was purified with flash column chromatography and afforded pure substituted 2’-hydroxychalcones.",OC1=C(C=C(Cl)C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC(Cl)=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 20 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: NaOH (1.20 g, 0.030 mol) was added to the substituted benzaldehyde (0.010 mol) and the substituted 2’-hydroxyacetophenone (0.010 mol) in EtOH (30 mL) solution at room temperature. This reaction mixture was stirred for 20 h at room temperature. The mixture was poured into conc HCl (10 mL) and crash ice (about 150 g), then the mixture was stirred for 30 min. Most of substituted 2’-hydroxychalcone was displayed as precipitate, and it was filtered using suction filtration. The solid residue was purified with recrystallization afforded pure substituted 2’-hydroxychalcone. On the other hand, when the substituted 2’-hydroxychalcone was an oily substance, the HCl solution was extracted with EtOAc (200 mL), washed with brine, dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and the solvent was removed under reduced pressure. This oily residue was purified with flash column chromatography and afforded pure substituted 2’-hydroxychalcones. The SMILES answer is : OC1=C(C=C(Cl)C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1

"

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All chalcone derivatives (3a-w) were obtained according to proceedings reported by our research group previously,(Mellado et al. 2020, Mellado, Madrid, Martinez, et al. 2018a, Mellado, Madrid, Reyna, et al. 2018a, Mellado et al. 2021) Briefly,250 mg of acetophenone (2.08 mmol) and appropriate benzaldehyde (1.2 equivalents) were solubilized in ethanol (5 mL) and added 10 mL of a saturated NaOH solution. This mixture was stirred for 48 h at room temperature, and, after this time, a 5% HCl solution was added until pH= 7.0 to stop reaction. Finally, mixture was extracted with EtOAc (50 mL x 3) and separated. The organic layer was dried, concentrated and purified using column chromatography in order to obtain the corresponding chalcones.",COC1=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All chalcone derivatives (3a-w) were obtained according to proceedings reported by our research group previously,(Mellado et al. 2020, Mellado, Madrid, Martinez, et al. 2018a, Mellado, Madrid, Reyna, et al. 2018a, Mellado et al. 2021) Briefly,250 mg of acetophenone (2.08 mmol) and appropriate benzaldehyde (1.2 equivalents) were solubilized in ethanol (5 mL) and added 10 mL of a saturated NaOH solution. This mixture was stirred for 48 h at room temperature, and, after this time, a 5% HCl solution was added until pH= 7.0 to stop reaction. Finally, mixture was extracted with EtOAc (50 mL x 3) and separated. The organic layer was dried, concentrated and purified using column chromatography in order to obtain the corresponding chalcones. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C(C)=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: For synthesis of chalcones we have used 2 different methods. Chalcones 1-30 were synthesized by method A and chalcones 31-44 were synthesized by method B. For Method B we used LiOHinstead of usual base NaOH for Claisen-Schmidt synthesis and the reaction was carried out in an ultrasonic bath. The general reaction scheme is depicted in Scheme 1.Method A: 20% NaOH (5 ml) was added dropwise to a previously cooled mixture of 5 mmol of selected acetophenone and 5 mmol of selected benzaldehyde in 25 ml ethanol under vigorous stirring. The mixture was stirred at room temperature for 24-72 h. After completion of the reaction as indicated by TLC, the mixture was poured onto crushed ice and acidified with dilute HCl. Precipitated product was filtered by suction and washed to neutral. The solid was recrystallised from dilute ethanol to get crystalline chalcone.Method B: To a mixture of 5 mmol of selected acetophenone and 5 mmol of selected benzaldehyde in 50 ml round bottom flask, 20 ml methanol and 35 mmol of LiOH was added. The reaction mixture was kept in an ultrasonic bath for 1-5 h, until reaction completion was indicated by TLC. The reaction was worked up as described for method A.",COC1=CC=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(OC)C=C2O)=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C(C)=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCCCC1, second reactant: O=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O, Temperature: 40 - 60°C, Time: 5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: unknown. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of benzaldehyde and cyclohexanone at molar ratio of 1:2 mmol and nanocatalyst(0.1 g) was stirred at 40-60 C; the progress of the condensation reactionwas monitored continuously by thin-layer chromatography (TLC). Ethyl acetate(10 mL) was then added to the reaction mixture, and the nanocatalyst was magneticallyseparated and washed with ethyl acetate and dried for reuse in a new aldolreaction. The remaining liquid was washed with saturated aqueous sodium chloridesolution (5 mL) and water (10 mL). The organic layer, which contains the productof the aldol reaction, was separated and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4,followedby evaporation of the solvent at room temperature. The remaining residue was thenrecrystallized in ethanol to give pure aldol product with 98 % yield. The yields inthis and other similar reactions were measured by GC analysis. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCCCC1, second reactant: O=CC1=CC=CC=C1N(=O)=O, Temperature: 20; 25°C, Time: 0.25; 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: 9-Amino-9-deoxy-epi-cinchonidine (epi-CDNH2) was prepared according to a literature procedure [27]. In a vial (25 mL), the mixture of nanomagnetic solid acid SZF3 (35.0 mg), epi-CDNH2 (11.0 mg, 0.0375 mmol), cyclohexanone (0.98 g, 10.0 mmol, Adamas-beta, 99.5%), and deionized water (2.0 mL) was stirred at room temperature for 15 min. Then, p-nitrobenzaldehyde (76 mg, 0.50 mmol, Adamas-beta, 99%) was added and allowed to react at 25 C for 48 h. After the reaction was complete, the SZF3 catalyst was magnetically separated using an external magnet and directly reused in the next experiment. The resulting reaction mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL). The combined organic phases were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated under reduced pressure to give the crude product, which was purified by flash column chromatography eluted with petroleum ether/ethyl acetate (v/v = 10/1 to 2/1) to give pure 2-(hydroxy(4-methoxyphenyl)methyl)cyclohexanone. The anti/syn (Dr) ratio was determined by 1H NMR in CDCl3, in which the chemical shifts of syn- and anti-CHOH protons were at δ = 5.32 ppm (d) with 3J =1.3 Hz and δ = 4.74 ppm (d) with 3J = 8.8 Hz, respectively. The enantiomeric excess (ee) was determined by high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) (Agilent Technologies 1200 Series) with a 254 nm UV-vis detector using a Daicel chiralpak Chiral OD column (4.6 mm × 250 mm), eluting with n-hexane/iso-propanol (95/5) with a flow rate of 0.5 mL/min at 20 C.",[H][C@@]1(CCCCC1=O)[C@H](O)C1=C(C=CC=C1)N(=O)=O,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCCCC1, second reactant: O=CC1=CC=CC=C1N(=O)=O, Temperature: 20; 25°C, Time: 0.25; 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: 9-Amino-9-deoxy-epi-cinchonidine (epi-CDNH2) was prepared according to a literature procedure [27]. In a vial (25 mL), the mixture of nanomagnetic solid acid SZF3 (35.0 mg), epi-CDNH2 (11.0 mg, 0.0375 mmol), cyclohexanone (0.98 g, 10.0 mmol, Adamas-beta, 99.5%), and deionized water (2.0 mL) was stirred at room temperature for 15 min. Then, p-nitrobenzaldehyde (76 mg, 0.50 mmol, Adamas-beta, 99%) was added and allowed to react at 25 C for 48 h. After the reaction was complete, the SZF3 catalyst was magnetically separated using an external magnet and directly reused in the next experiment. The resulting reaction mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL). The combined organic phases were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated under reduced pressure to give the crude product, which was purified by flash column chromatography eluted with petroleum ether/ethyl acetate (v/v = 10/1 to 2/1) to give pure 2-(hydroxy(4-methoxyphenyl)methyl)cyclohexanone. The anti/syn (Dr) ratio was determined by 1H NMR in CDCl3, in which the chemical shifts of syn- and anti-CHOH protons were at δ = 5.32 ppm (d) with 3J =1.3 Hz and δ = 4.74 ppm (d) with 3J = 8.8 Hz, respectively. The enantiomeric excess (ee) was determined by high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) (Agilent Technologies 1200 Series) with a 254 nm UV-vis detector using a Daicel chiralpak Chiral OD column (4.6 mm × 250 mm), eluting with n-hexane/iso-propanol (95/5) with a flow rate of 0.5 mL/min at 20 C. The SMILES answer is : [H][C@@]1(CCCCC1=O)[C@H](O)C1=C(C=CC=C1)N(=O)=O

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 8 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a mixture of substituted benzaldehyde (1.0 mmol), aniline(1.5 mmol), 2-hydroxyacetophenone (1.2 mmol) inethanol (1.0 mL), fused calcium chloride (CaCl2 2 mmol)was added, and the reaction mixture was subjected to refluxfor 7-12 h. The progress of the reaction was monitored byTLC. After completion of the reaction (monitored by TLC),water work-up followed by extraction with methylenechloride and concentration of the extracts dried over sodiumsulphate afforded the crude product. The products werepurified either by recrystallization from hexane:ethyl acetateor by short flash chromatography on silica gel using petroleumether: ethyl acetate (9:1) as eluent.",COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C1CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 8 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. The progress of the reaction was monitored byTLC. After completion of the reaction (monitored by TLC),water work-up followed by extraction with methylenechloride and concentration of the extracts dried over sodiumsulphate afforded the crude product. The products werepurified either by recrystallization from hexane:ethyl acetateor by short flash chromatography on silica gel using petroleumether: ethyl acetate (9:1) as eluent. After completion of the reaction (monitored by TLC), the solution was washed with an ice cold saturated Na2S2O3(aq) solution (2×10 mL) and then extracted with CH2Cl2 (3×20 mL). The combined organic phases were washed sequentially with brine and ice water and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4. Evaporation of the organic solvent afforded the crude products, which were purified by recrystallization from hexane and ethyl acetate or by short flash column chromatography. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 60°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: According to the analytical procedure, preparative biotransformationswere conducted by adding BSA (540 mg) to a solutionof the corresponding 2-hydroxyacetophenone (1, 2.0 mmol) andbenzaldehyde (2, 1.0 mmol) in methanol (10 ml). The resulting mixtureswere shaken at 60 C and 200 rpm during 72 h, then aμbumin wasfiltered off and washed with dichloromethane (2 ×4 ml). The filtrateswere evaporated under reduced pressure, the residue was dissolved indichloromethane (10 ml) and the solution extracted with cold 5% sodiumhydroxide (2 ×2 ml) in order to remove 2-hydroxyacetophenoneexcess. The organic phases were dried over sodium carbonate, filteredoff and the solvent removed under reduced pressure. In 250 mL round bottom flask, a solution of 2.3 g (0.02 M) of 2,4-thiazolidinedione (B) with 3.1 g (0.02 M) of vanillin in 150 mL ethanol, 1.2 g (0.15 M) piperidine, was refluxed for ten h. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=NC2=C(N1)C=CC=C2, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Various o-substituted anilines (0.05 mol) and lactic acids (3.75 mL, 0.05 mol) were dissolved in 20 mL of HCl (4 M). The mixture was heated under reflux for 1.5 h. After cooling to room temperature, the reaction mixture was poured into water. Next, the pH was adjusted to 10-11 with ammonia. The mixture was filtered, and the residue was recrystallized from water to give intermediates 1b-3b. Next, 1b-3b (0.02 mol) were each dissolved in 15 mL of acetic acid. When the mixture was heated to 90 C, chromium trioxide solution was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 105C for 30 min. After cooling to room temperature, the reaction mixture was poured into water (1 L) and then extracted by ethyl acetate (EtOAc). The organic layers were combined, dried with MgSO4, filtered and then concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was recrystallized from toluene to give the intermediates 1c-3c. Last, 1c-3c (0.02 mol) and 8 mL of a 10% NaOH aqueous solution were dissolved in 20 mL of ethanol. The reaction mixture became a clear red solution. Next, various substituted aromatic aldehydes (0.02 mol) were added. After stirring for 5 h, the mixture was filtered, and the residue was purified by column chromatography (EtOAc: hexane = 1:5) to give the target compounds A1-A13, B1-B3 and C1-C3.",COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=NC3=CC=CC=C3N2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=NC2=C(N1)C=CC=C2, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Various o-substituted anilines (0.05 mol) and lactic acids (3.75 mL, 0.05 mol) were dissolved in 20 mL of HCl (4 M). The mixture was heated under reflux for 1.5 h. After cooling to room temperature, the reaction mixture was poured into water. Next, the pH was adjusted to 10-11 with ammonia. The mixture was filtered, and the residue was recrystallized from water to give intermediates 1b-3b. Next, 1b-3b (0.02 mol) were each dissolved in 15 mL of acetic acid. When the mixture was heated to 90 C, chromium trioxide solution was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 105C for 30 min. After cooling to room temperature, the reaction mixture was poured into water (1 L) and then extracted by ethyl acetate (EtOAc). The organic layers were combined, dried with MgSO4, filtered and then concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was recrystallized from toluene to give the intermediates 1c-3c. Last, 1c-3c (0.02 mol) and 8 mL of a 10% NaOH aqueous solution were dissolved in 20 mL of ethanol. The reaction mixture became a clear red solution. Next, various substituted aromatic aldehydes (0.02 mol) were added. After stirring for 5 h, the mixture was filtered, and the residue was purified by column chromatography (EtOAc: hexane = 1:5) to give the target compounds A1-A13, B1-B3 and C1-C3. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=NC3=CC=CC=C3N2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCCCC1, second reactant: O=CC1=CC(=CC=C1)N(=O)=O, Temperature: 25°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a mixture of the corresponding aromatic aldehyde (0.3 mmol), catalyst 3 (0.03 mmol, 100 mg) and benzoic acid (0.015 mmol, 2.0 mg) at 25 C was added the corresponding ketone (0.6 mmol) and H2O (3.6 mmol, 64 μL). The reaction was stirred until the aldehyde was consumed (monitored by TLC). Then, the mixture was filtered and washed with EtOAc (10-15 mL). The solvents were removed under reduced pressure and the residue was purified by flash chromatography (with 25-30 mL of hexanes/EtOAc) to yield the pure aldol product. After the filtration, the catalyst was dried under vacuum and reused for the next reaction cycle using the same reaction conditions and amount of reagents and catalysts in each cycle.",[H][C@@]1(CCCCC1=O)[C@H](O)C1=CC(=CC=C1)N(=O)=O,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCCCC1, second reactant: O=CC1=CC(=CC=C1)N(=O)=O, Temperature: 25°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a mixture of the corresponding aromatic aldehyde (0.3 mmol), catalyst 3 (0.03 mmol, 100 mg) and benzoic acid (0.015 mmol, 2.0 mg) at 25 C was added the corresponding ketone (0.6 mmol) and H2O (3.6 mmol, 64 μL). The reaction was stirred until the aldehyde was consumed (monitored by TLC). Then, the mixture was filtered and washed with EtOAc (10-15 mL). The solvents were removed under reduced pressure and the residue was purified by flash chromatography (with 25-30 mL of hexanes/EtOAc) to yield the pure aldol product. After the filtration, the catalyst was dried under vacuum and reused for the next reaction cycle using the same reaction conditions and amount of reagents and catalysts in each cycle. The SMILES answer is : [H][C@@]1(CCCCC1=O)[C@H](O)C1=CC(=CC=C1)N(=O)=O

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCCCC1, second reactant: O=CC1=CC(=CC=C1)N(=O)=O, Temperature: -20; 20°C, Time: 0.5; 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: chloroform; chloroform. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The chiral catalyst 11 (0.1 mmol), acetic acid (0.1 mmol), and ketone (2 mL) were stirred in trichloromethane (2 mL) for 30 min at -20C before the corresponding aldehyde (0.5 mmol) was added. The reaction solution was stirred for 48 h at 20C, saturated aqueous solution of ammonium chloride (10 mL) was added, and the mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (20 mL×2). The combined organic extracts were washed with brine (30 mL×2), dried (Na2SO4), and concentrated in vacuum. The residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel using ethyl acetate/hexanes (1:3) as the eluant to give the product alcohol. 4.2.9.3. 2-[Hydroxy-(3-nitro-phenyl)-methyl]-cyclohexanone (12c). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The chiral catalyst 11 (0.1 mmol), acetic acid (0.1 mmol), and ketone (2 mL) were stirred in trichloromethane (2 mL) for 30 min at -20C before the corresponding aldehyde (0.5 mmol) was added. The reaction solution was stirred for 48 h at 20C, saturated aqueous solution of ammonium chloride (10 mL) was added, and the mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (20 mL×2). The combined organic extracts were washed with brine (30 mL×2), dried (Na2SO4), and concentrated in vacuum. The residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel using ethyl acetate/hexanes (1:3) as the eluant to give the product alcohol. 4.2.9.3. 2-[Hydroxy-(3-nitro-phenyl)-methyl]-cyclohexanone (12c). Yield 90%, 96% ee, anti/syn=96:4, by HPLC analysis (Daicel Chiralcel AD column, hexane/ethanol=95:5, 1.0mL/min, 254nm UV detector), anti-diastereomer, tR=24.7min for (minor) and tR=30.4min for (major). 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ (ppm) 1.36-1.45 (m, 1H, -CH2-), 1.55-1.71 (m, 3H, -CH2-), 1.82-1.85 (m, 1H, -CH2-), 2.09-2.16 (m, 1H, -CH2-), 2.32-2.43 (m, 1H, -CH2-), 2.48-2.53 (m, 1H, -CH2-), 2.58-2.67 (m, 1H, -CH2-), 4.11 (br, 1H, OH), 4.90 (d, J=7.8Hz, 1H, -CHOH), 7.52 (t, J=7.8Hz, 1H, -Ph), 7.67 (d, J=7.5Hz, 1H, -Ph), 8.11-8.21 (m, 2H, -Ph). The SMILES answer is : [H][C@@]1(CCCCC1=O)[C@H](O)C1=CC(=CC=C1)N(=O)=O

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCCCC1, second reactant: O=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)C#N, Temperature: -20; 20°C, Time: 0.5; 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: chloroform; chloroform. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The chiral catalyst 11 (0.1 mmol), acetic acid (0.1 mmol), and ketone (2 mL) were stirred in trichloromethane (2 mL) for 30 min at -20C before the corresponding aldehyde (0.5 mmol) was added. The reaction solution was stirred for 48 h at 20C, saturated aqueous solution of ammonium chloride (10 mL) was added, and the mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (20 mL×2). The mixture was treated with 10mL of saturated ammonium chloride solution and extracted with ethyl acetate. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=C2OCOC2=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a stirred solution of 1-(3-ethoxyphenyl) ethanone (1 mmol) and 1,3-benzodioxole-5-carbaldehyde (12, 1 mmol) in ethanol (30 mL), 6 mol KOH (4 mL) was added and the reaction mixture was stirred until the solids fully formed. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC(OC)=C(C=O)C=C1OC, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 15 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A solution of the acetophenone (10 mmol) and LiOH.H2O (10 mol %) in 10 mL of absolute ethanol is stirred at the appropriate temperature for 10 min (for reactions at 40 C., the bulb is equipped with a reflux condenser). Then, the benzaldehyde (10 mmol, 1 equiv.) is added and the system is protected from the atmosphere with a cork stopper. Reaction progress is monitored by TLC or LCMS-analysis; during the course of the reaction, the chalcone may precipitate. Upon attaining maximum conversion grade, the reaction mixture is quenched with 15 mL of 1% hydrochloric acid. [0362] If the chalcone has precipitated, it is isolated by means of filtration. In order to remove residual amounts of benzaldehyde, the residue is washed thoroughly with water until the filtrate turns clear. The obtained solid is the chalcone, which can be dried in a dessicator. Subsequently, the chalcone can be recrystallized in absolute ethanol so as to obtain high purity crystals. [0363] If the chalcone has formed a separate oily liquor at the bottom of the bulb, it can be extracted from the mixture with diethyl ether. The organic phase is subsequently washed with brine (2×) and dried over MgSO4, upon which the solution is concentrated in vacuo. Again, purification of the thus obtained residue can be performed through recrystallization in absolute ethanol. [0369] The synthesis of compounds 37-51 was conducted via a Claisen-Schmidt condensation of suitably functionalized acetophenones and benzaldehydes. Whilst other syntheses have been proposed to prepare chalcones (e.g. via 1,3-diaryl-1-siloxy allenes or by Suzuki or Heck coupling reactions), this crossed aldol condensation remains the method of choice, given its simplicity and the ready availability of the required acetophenones 35 and benzaldehydes 36. Wherein R and R′ are as represented in table 3 Scheme: [0370] Chalcone synthesis. a) 1 equiv. benzaldehyde 36, 5 mol % LiOH.H2O, abs. EtOH., conditions see table 3. [0371] Over the years, numerous basic (e.g. NaOH, Ba(OH)2 and Al2O3) and acid (e.g. dry HCl and BF3) catalysts have been proposed for this transformation. We considered the LiOH.H2O catalyzed protocol as proposed by Bhagat and co-workers to be the most elegant, because of its high catalyst turnover and yields, short reaction times and easy work-up. Nevertheless, as we could only obtain the high yields reported by these researchers after prolonged reaction times, we evaluated the influence of the reaction temperature on its outcome. As such, by rising the temperature to 40 or 70 C., and by optimizing the work-up procedure, we were able to obtain the pure chalcones 37-51 in reasonable to excellent yield after crystallization in ethanol (see table 3). Then, the benzaldehyde (10 mmol, 1 equiv.) is added and the system is protected from the atmosphere with a cork stopper. Reaction progress is monitored by TLC or LCMS-analysis; during the course of the reaction, the chalcone may precipitate. Upon attaining maximum conversion grade, the reaction mixture is quenched with 15 mL of 1% hydrochloric acid. [0362] If the chalcone has precipitated, it is isolated by means of filtration. In order to remove residual amounts of benzaldehyde, the residue is washed thoroughly with water until the filtrate turns clear. The obtained solid is the chalcone, which can be dried in a dessicator. Subsequently, the chalcone can be recrystallized in absolute ethanol so as to obtain high purity crystals. The organic phase is subsequently washed with brine (2×) and dried over MgSO4, upon which the solution is concentrated in vacuo. Again, purification of the thus obtained residue can be performed through recrystallization in absolute ethanol. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CS1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 10 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: unknown. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An equivalent mixture of appropriate aryl/heteroaryl ketone (1mmol) and an appropriate aryl/heteroaryl aldehyde was dissolved in 1mL of acetic acid in a 10mL RBF. The mixture was further charged with sulfuric acid (1-3 drops) and continuously stirred for next 10h at room temperature. The reaction mixture was quenched at its completion (TLC) by pouring cold water. The resulting precipitates were washed with excess water and dried to obtain the crude product that was further purified by recrystallization in methanol. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CS1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, Temperature: 0 - 5°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In accordance with Scheme 1, selected 4-substituted acetophenone (10 mmol) was dissolved in anhydrous ethanol (10 mL). NaOH anhydrous ethanol solution (10%, 5 mL) was added to the solution. The mixture of selected aldehyde (10 mmol) and anhydrous ethanol (10 mL) was slowly added to the above solution in an ice box under stirring. The reaction was kept at 0-5 C for 3-5 h and monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC). After completion, the reaction mixture was poured into ice water and neutralized by HCl (10%) till the solution became neutral. The solid that precipitated was filtered and washed with distilled water. The crude products were recrystallized from anhydrous ethanol/dichloromethane (v/v = 1:1) to give intermediate 1 in the yield exceeding 90%. In order to obtain enough intermediate 1 (from 10 mmol to 30 mmol) for the subsequent synthesis of compounds 2 and 3, the synthesis of intermediate 1 was repeated several times.",BrC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=CS1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CS1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, Temperature: 0 - 5°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In accordance with Scheme 1, selected 4-substituted acetophenone (10 mmol) was dissolved in anhydrous ethanol (10 mL). NaOH anhydrous ethanol solution (10%, 5 mL) was added to the solution. The mixture of selected aldehyde (10 mmol) and anhydrous ethanol (10 mL) was slowly added to the above solution in an ice box under stirring. The reaction was kept at 0-5 C for 3-5 h and monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC). After completion, the reaction mixture was poured into ice water and neutralized by HCl (10%) till the solution became neutral. The solid that precipitated was filtered and washed with distilled water. The crude products were recrystallized from anhydrous ethanol/dichloromethane (v/v = 1:1) to give intermediate 1 in the yield exceeding 90%. In order to obtain enough intermediate 1 (from 10 mmol to 30 mmol) for the subsequent synthesis of compounds 2 and 3, the synthesis of intermediate 1 was repeated several times. The SMILES answer is : BrC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=CS1

"

The resulting mixture wascooled at 0 C and 8 mL of 5% NaOH water solution was added drop wise. After reaction for24 h, the resulting solution was poured into ice water (50 g) and stirred. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCN(CC)C1=CC=C(C=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: 90°C, Time: 6 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: unknown. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: (1) Add 4-aminoacetophenone (13.5g, 0.1mol) and 4-(diethylamino) salicylaldehyde (19.3g, 0.1mol) into the round bottom flask, add 50mL analytical pure sulfuric acid at 400-450rpm Stir at the rotating speed, heat up to 90C and react for 6 hours. At the end of the reaction, the reaction solution was poured into ice water, and a 70% perchloric acid solution of 0.3 times the volume of the reaction solution was added. After stirring for 15 minutes, the precipitate is separated out and filtered by suction, the filter cake is washed with water, and a purple-black solid is obtained after drying, which is purified by silica gel column chromatography (200 mesh silica gel) with eluent (methanol: dichloromethane = 1:100, volume ratio) After elution, compound YL (14.5 g, yield 49.5%) was obtained.",CCN(CC)C1=CC=C2C=CC(=[O+]C2=C1)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCN(CC)C1=CC=C(C=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: 90°C, Time: 6 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: unknown. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: (1) Add 4-aminoacetophenone (13.5g, 0.1mol) and 4-(diethylamino) salicylaldehyde (19.3g, 0.1mol) into the round bottom flask, add 50mL analytical pure sulfuric acid at 400-450rpm Stir at the rotating speed, heat up to 90C and react for 6 hours. At the end of the reaction, the reaction solution was poured into ice water, and a 70% perchloric acid solution of 0.3 times the volume of the reaction solution was added. After stirring for 15 minutes, the precipitate is separated out and filtered by suction, the filter cake is washed with water, and a purple-black solid is obtained after drying, which is purified by silica gel column chromatography (200 mesh silica gel) with eluent (methanol: dichloromethane = 1:100, volume ratio) After elution, compound YL (14.5 g, yield 49.5%) was obtained. The SMILES answer is : CCN(CC)C1=CC=C2C=CC(=[O+]C2=C1)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCN(CC)C1=CC=C(C=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; ethyl acetate. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Amino-based flavylium compounds used in this study were synthesizedaccording to previously described protocols [14,43]. Succinctly,7NEt24′NMe2 was obtained from the acidic aldol condensation between4-diethylaminosalicylaldehyde (1.3 × 10 3 mol, 250 mg) and 4′-dimethylaminoacetophenone(2.5 × 10 3 mol, 410 mg). Both reagents wereweighted in a round bottom flask and dissolved in ethyl acetate: methanolmixture (2:1). Chlorotrimethylsilane (3.287 mL; 20 equiv) was thenadded and the reaction was kept under stirring at room temperature for4 h. A mixture between 4-diethylaminosalicylaldehyde (1.0 × 10 3 mol,200 mg) with 4′-dimethylaminoacetophenone (1.0 × 10 3 mol, 200 mg)in 2 mL of acetic acid, followed by the addition of chlorotrimethylsilane(TMSCl; 20 equiv), yielded 7NEt2st4′NMe2, after an overnight reactionkept at room temperature and under stirring. 5,7OH2st4′NMe2 resultedfrom the condensation between 2,4,6-trihydroxybenzaldehyde (1.3 ×10 4 mol, 20 mg) and p-dimethylaminostyrylmethylketone (1.6 × 10 4 mol, 30 mg) in 259 μL (2 mL/1 mmol) of acetic acid, in the presence ofhexafluorphosphoric acid (0.5 mL/1 mmol). The mixture was left toreact at room temperature during 24 h under stirring. The synthesis of7NEt24′NH2 resulted from the condensation between 4-diethylaminosalicylaldehyde(5.1 × 10 4 mol, 100 mg) and 4′-aminoacetophenone (1.0× 10 3 mol, 140 mg) in 5 mL of an ethyl acetate: methanol mixture(2:1), in the presence of chlorotrimethylsilane (TMSCl; 20 equiv), performedat room temperature under stirring, for 4 h. Purity of all compounds(>95 % pure) was confirmed by HPLC-MS (Fig. S1) and NMR(Fig. S2). A more detailed description of the synthesis procedure,structural characterization and chromatic features of these dyes is providedin the literature [14].",CCN(CC)C1=CC=C2C=CC(=[O+]C2=C1)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCN(CC)C1=CC=C(C=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; ethyl acetate. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Amino-based flavylium compounds used in this study were synthesizedaccording to previously described protocols [14,43]. Succinctly,7NEt24′NMe2 was obtained from the acidic aldol condensation between4-diethylaminosalicylaldehyde (1.3 × 10 3 mol, 250 mg) and 4′-dimethylaminoacetophenone(2.5 × 10 3 mol, 410 mg). Both reagents wereweighted in a round bottom flask and dissolved in ethyl acetate: methanolmixture (2:1). Chlorotrimethylsilane (3.287 mL; 20 equiv) was thenadded and the reaction was kept under stirring at room temperature for4 h. A mixture between 4-diethylaminosalicylaldehyde (1.0 × 10 3 mol,200 mg) with 4′-dimethylaminoacetophenone (1.0 × 10 3 mol, 200 mg)in 2 mL of acetic acid, followed by the addition of chlorotrimethylsilane(TMSCl; 20 equiv), yielded 7NEt2st4′NMe2, after an overnight reactionkept at room temperature and under stirring. 5,7OH2st4′NMe2 resultedfrom the condensation between 2,4,6-trihydroxybenzaldehyde (1.3 ×10 4 mol, 20 mg) and p-dimethylaminostyrylmethylketone (1.6 × 10 4 mol, 30 mg) in 259 μL (2 mL/1 mmol) of acetic acid, in the presence ofhexafluorphosphoric acid (0.5 mL/1 mmol). The mixture was left toreact at room temperature during 24 h under stirring. The synthesis of7NEt24′NH2 resulted from the condensation between 4-diethylaminosalicylaldehyde(5.1 × 10 4 mol, 100 mg) and 4′-aminoacetophenone (1.0× 10 3 mol, 140 mg) in 5 mL of an ethyl acetate: methanol mixture(2:1), in the presence of chlorotrimethylsilane (TMSCl; 20 equiv), performedat room temperature under stirring, for 4 h. Purity of all compounds(>95 % pure) was confirmed by HPLC-MS (Fig. S1) and NMR(Fig. S2). A more detailed description of the synthesis procedure,structural characterization and chromatic features of these dyes is providedin the literature [14]. The SMILES answer is : CCN(CC)C1=CC=C2C=CC(=[O+]C2=C1)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CO1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(O)C=C1, Temperature: 5 - 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An aqueous solution of NaOH (20%, 5mL) was added dropwise to a previously cooled mixture of selected acetophenone (5mmol) and selected (hetero)aryl aldehydes (5mmol) in EtOH (25mL) under vigorous stirring. The mixture was stirred at RT for 24-72h. After completion of the reaction (as indicated by TLC), the mixture was poured onto crushed ice and acidified with dilute HCl. The precipitated product was filtered at suction and washed to neutral filtrate. The solid was recrystallized from EtOH to get crystalline product.",OC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CO1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CO1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(O)C=C1, Temperature: 5 - 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An aqueous solution of NaOH (20%, 5mL) was added dropwise to a previously cooled mixture of selected acetophenone (5mmol) and selected (hetero)aryl aldehydes (5mmol) in EtOH (25mL) under vigorous stirring. The mixture was stirred at RT for 24-72h. After completion of the reaction (as indicated by TLC), the mixture was poured onto crushed ice and acidified with dilute HCl. The precipitated product was filtered at suction and washed to neutral filtrate. The solid was recrystallized from EtOH to get crystalline product. The SMILES answer is : OC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CO1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CO1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Series of chalcones was synthesized by Claisen-Schmidt reaction,according to procedures described by Santos and coauthors, with minormodifications [37,38]. Reactions were carried out at room temperatureusing 5.0 mmol of aryl ketones and 5.0 mmol of aryl aldehydes, whichwere dissolved in ethanol (10 mL). Aliquots of an aqueous sodium hydroxidesolution (1 mol/L) was added as basis. Reactions were monitoredby TLC plates and after appreciable reagent conversions, thereaction medium was quenched in ice-cold deionized water and acidifiedwith an aqueous solution of hydrochloric acid (1 mol/L). The crudeproduct was extracted with ethyl acetate (3 × 50 mL), washed with brinesolution and the combined organic phases were concentrated underreduced pressure [20]. The purification of compounds was performed bycolumn chromatography.",OC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CO1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CO1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Series of chalcones was synthesized by Claisen-Schmidt reaction,according to procedures described by Santos and coauthors, with minormodifications [37,38]. Reactions were carried out at room temperatureusing 5.0 mmol of aryl ketones and 5.0 mmol of aryl aldehydes, whichwere dissolved in ethanol (10 mL). Aliquots of an aqueous sodium hydroxidesolution (1 mol/L) was added as basis. Reactions were monitoredby TLC plates and after appreciable reagent conversions, thereaction medium was quenched in ice-cold deionized water and acidifiedwith an aqueous solution of hydrochloric acid (1 mol/L). The crudeproduct was extracted with ethyl acetate (3 × 50 mL), washed with brinesolution and the combined organic phases were concentrated underreduced pressure [20]. The purification of compounds was performed bycolumn chromatography. The SMILES answer is : OC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CO1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CS1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 0°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In a 10 mL flask at 0 C was added a 5:1 MeOH-H2O mixture (6 mL), 85% KOH aqueous solution and benzaldehyde (6 mmol, 1.2 eq). Then acetophenone (5 mmol) was added dropwise over a period of 10 min. The reaction mixture was stirred for 5-48 hours at 0 C and then quenched with an aqueous solution of NH4Cl (20 mL), extracted with AcOEt (4 x 30 mL). Then acetophenone (5 mmol) was added dropwise over a period of 10 min. The reaction mixture was stirred for 5-48 hours at 0 C and then quenched with an aqueous solution of NH4Cl (20 mL), extracted with AcOEt (4 x 30 mL). To the stirring solution was added dropwise trimethylsilyl trifluoromethanesulfonate (362 μL, 445 mg, 2.0 mmol) and the reaction was stirred 1 h. To the stirring solution was added dropwise trimethylsilyl trifluoromethanesulfonate (362 μL, 445 mg, 2.0 mmol) and the reaction was stirred 1 h. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CS1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 150°C, Time: 1 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the suitable aldehyde (1.0 mmol), acetophenone (1.0 mmol) and clay catalyst(240 mg) was warmed at 150 C in a sealed tube under microwave irradiation, for 1 h. In the reactions involving solid starting materials, they were thoroughly mixed by grinding in a mortar before irradiation. The reaction mixture was diluted with hot ethanol (20 mL), the catalyst was filtered off, the solvent was evaporated and the residue was purified by crystallization (EtOH) for solid chalcones(compounds 3a-3d, 3f-3m, 3p-3ar) or by column chromatography (silica gel, ethyl acetate/hexanes) for oily chalcones (compounds 3e, 3o), to afford the pure final products. All yields were calculated from isolated products. Characterization data for previously unknown compounds are given below. For full characterization data, see the Supporting Information.",O=C(\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC=CS1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CS1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 150°C, Time: 1 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the suitable aldehyde (1.0 mmol), acetophenone (1.0 mmol) and clay catalyst(240 mg) was warmed at 150 C in a sealed tube under microwave irradiation, for 1 h. In the reactions involving solid starting materials, they were thoroughly mixed by grinding in a mortar before irradiation. The reaction mixture was diluted with hot ethanol (20 mL), the catalyst was filtered off, the solvent was evaporated and the residue was purified by crystallization (EtOH) for solid chalcones(compounds 3a-3d, 3f-3m, 3p-3ar) or by column chromatography (silica gel, ethyl acetate/hexanes) for oily chalcones (compounds 3e, 3o), to afford the pure final products. All yields were calculated from isolated products. Characterization data for previously unknown compounds are given below. For full characterization data, see the Supporting Information. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: 50°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The Aldol condensation reaction was carried out in a 50 mL threeneckedround bottom flask equipped with a magnetic stirrer. The generalprocedure is as follows: 20 mg of catalyst, a mixture of 5 mmol ofbenzaldehyde and 5 mmol of acetone were added into the reactionvessel. The mixture was stirred at 50 C for 2 h under a nitrogen atmosphere.The organic aliquot was confirmed by a Chemito 8610 gaschromatograph (GC) equipped with a DB-5 capillary column (30 m,0.32 mm id, 0.25 mm film thickness). The catalyst was recovered aftereach run, washed with ethanol followed by distilled water, and later ondried in an air oven at 80 C for 6 h..",CC(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(C)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: 50°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The Aldol condensation reaction was carried out in a 50 mL threeneckedround bottom flask equipped with a magnetic stirrer. The generalprocedure is as follows: 20 mg of catalyst, a mixture of 5 mmol ofbenzaldehyde and 5 mmol of acetone were added into the reactionvessel. The mixture was stirred at 50 C for 2 h under a nitrogen atmosphere.The organic aliquot was confirmed by a Chemito 8610 gaschromatograph (GC) equipped with a DB-5 capillary column (30 m,0.32 mm id, 0.25 mm film thickness). The catalyst was recovered aftereach run, washed with ethanol followed by distilled water, and later ondried in an air oven at 80 C for 6 h.. The SMILES answer is : CC(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(C)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Claisen-Schmidt condensation. To a solution of substituted acetophenone (100 mg) and substituted benzaldehyde (1.2 eq) in a mixed solvent of EtOH and H2O (v/v, 2:1, 5 mL) at room temperature, NaOH aqueous solution (1 mol/L, 0.5 mL) was added dropwise. The result mixture was stirred overnight and the reaction process was monitored by TLC (5:1, PE/EA). Then, the reaction was quenched with 20 mL water, and extracted with DCM (2×10 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel to afford chalcone derivatives.",COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=C(C)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Claisen-Schmidt condensation. To a solution of substituted acetophenone (100 mg) and substituted benzaldehyde (1.2 eq) in a mixed solvent of EtOH and H2O (v/v, 2:1, 5 mL) at room temperature, NaOH aqueous solution (1 mol/L, 0.5 mL) was added dropwise. The result mixture was stirred overnight and the reaction process was monitored by TLC (5:1, PE/EA). Then, the reaction was quenched with 20 mL water, and extracted with DCM (2×10 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel to afford chalcone derivatives. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Hydroxychalcones 1 and 2 were synthesized byClaisen-Schmidt condensation as previously describedby Kumar et al.26 with slight modifications. Equimolarportions of 4-hydroxyacetophenone (10 mmol) and4-chlorobenzaldehyde (10 mmol) or 3-methoxybenzaldehyde(10 mmol) were added to 15 mL of 40% NaOH methanolicsolution. The reaction mixtures were stirred at roomtemperature for 24 h, when TLC indicated the end of thereactions. Then, cold water (5 mL) was added to the mediaand acidified with 10% hydrocloric acid until pH 3. Theresulting yellow solids were crystallized from methanol toobtain the expected hydroxychalcones 1 and 2 in 87 and63% yields, respectively. Equimolarportions of 4-hydroxyacetophenone (10 mmol) and4-chlorobenzaldehyde (10 mmol) or 3-methoxybenzaldehyde(10 mmol) were added to 15 mL of 40% NaOH methanolicsolution. The reaction mixtures were stirred at roomtemperature for 24 h, when TLC indicated the end of thereactions. Then, cold water (5 mL) was added to the mediaand acidified with 10% hydrocloric acid until pH 3. Theresulting yellow solids were crystallized from methanol toobtain the expected hydroxychalcones 1 and 2 in 87 and63% yields, respectively. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=CC=C1C=O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 0 - 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The Claisen-Schmidt condensation of acetophenone with substituted aldehydes was carried out for the synthesis of compounds 1a-1g, 2a-2e and 3a-3b by combining 0.1M of acetophenone and 0.1M of aldehyde in 10ml of 95% ethanol (CAS No. 64-17-5) (Bhagat et al., 2006). To the above mixture, a 6ml solution of 0.2M sodium hydroxide (NaOH, CAS No. 1310-73-2) or potassium hydroxide (KOH, CAS No. 1310- 58-3) was added slowly at room temperature. The mixture was then subjected to overnight continuous stirring. A solvent system consisting of petroleum ether and ethyl acetate in a 7:3 ratio was used to monitor the reaction’s progress using TLC. Hydrochloric acid (1M) (CAS No. CAS 7647-01-0) was used to neutralize the resultant solution, and ethyl acetate (350ml) was used to extract it. Finally, column chromatography was used to separate the obtained crude product into its pure components (1a-1g, 2a-2e and 3a-3b).2.6.2.",ClC1=CC=CC=C1\C=C\C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=CC=C1C=O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 0 - 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The Claisen-Schmidt condensation of acetophenone with substituted aldehydes was carried out for the synthesis of compounds 1a-1g, 2a-2e and 3a-3b by combining 0.1M of acetophenone and 0.1M of aldehyde in 10ml of 95% ethanol (CAS No. 64-17-5) (Bhagat et al., 2006). To the above mixture, a 6ml solution of 0.2M sodium hydroxide (NaOH, CAS No. 1310-73-2) or potassium hydroxide (KOH, CAS No. 1310- 58-3) was added slowly at room temperature. The mixture was then subjected to overnight continuous stirring. A solvent system consisting of petroleum ether and ethyl acetate in a 7:3 ratio was used to monitor the reaction’s progress using TLC. Hydrochloric acid (1M) (CAS No. CAS 7647-01-0) was used to neutralize the resultant solution, and ethyl acetate (350ml) was used to extract it. To the above mixture, a 6ml solution of 0.2M sodium hydroxide (NaOH, CAS No. 1310-73-2) or potassium hydroxide (KOH, CAS No. 1310- 58-3) was added slowly at room temperature. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The Claisen-Schmidt condensation of acetophenone with substituted aldehydes was carried out for the synthesis of compounds 1a-1g, 2a-2e and 3a-3b by combining 0.1M of acetophenone and 0.1M of aldehyde in 10ml of 95% ethanol (CAS No. 64-17-5) (Bhagat et al., 2006). "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCOC(=O)C(F)(F)F, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(F)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 2 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Referring to Scheme 1, to the appropriate acetophenone derivative (0.05 mol) and ethyltrifluoroacetate (0.075 mol) in methanol (20 mL), sodium methoxide solution (0.1 mol of Na + 15 mL ofCH3OH) was added dropwise at room temperature, and the mixture was refluxed for 2 h. After themethanol was evaporated under vacuum, the residue was dissolved in ethyl acetate (50 mL), washedwith 5% HCl (25 mL) and water (25 mL), and dried over sodium sulfate. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(N)C=CC=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Reagents and solvents were purchased from Merck. Series of 17 chalcones was synthesized by Claisen-Schmidt aldol condensation, according to protocol reported by Santos and coauthors with minor modifications [15]. Reactions were carried out at room temperature using 5.0mmol of respective benzaldehyde derivatives and 5.0mmol of respective aminoacetophenones, which were dissolved in ethanol (50mL). Sodium hydroxide in ethanol (1mol L-1) was added as catalyst solution. Reagents conversion was monitored by thin layer chromatography. Crude products were poured onto ice from distilled and deionized water and filtered. All compounds were purified over silica gel chromatography column eluted with mixtures of hexane and ethyl acetate. Melting point of chalcones was measured on open capillaries on Melt Temperature apparatus MS Tecnopon PFM-II. UV-Vis spectra and chromatograms were obtained in High Performance Liquid Chromatography with Diode Array Detector (HPLC-DAD) Agilent Technologies 1220 Infinity equipment, photodiode array system (Agilent Technologies Model 1260 Infinity) and Agilent Zorbax Eclipse Plus C-18 column (250mm×4.6mm, 5µL) using methanol:water (3:1) as mobile phase (1.0mL/min). NMR spectra were obtained in two spectrometers: Bruker Avance III (600MHz) and Bruker Avance III (400MHz), using deuterated dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO- d6) as internal reference. Low mass spectrometry by electrospray ionization spectra were performed on Bruker Amazon ESI-IT.",NC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(N)C=CC=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Reagents and solvents were purchased from Merck. Series of 17 chalcones was synthesized by Claisen-Schmidt aldol condensation, according to protocol reported by Santos and coauthors with minor modifications [15]. Reactions were carried out at room temperature using 5.0mmol of respective benzaldehyde derivatives and 5.0mmol of respective aminoacetophenones, which were dissolved in ethanol (50mL). Sodium hydroxide in ethanol (1mol L-1) was added as catalyst solution. Reagents conversion was monitored by thin layer chromatography. Crude products were poured onto ice from distilled and deionized water and filtered. All compounds were purified over silica gel chromatography column eluted with mixtures of hexane and ethyl acetate. Melting point of chalcones was measured on open capillaries on Melt Temperature apparatus MS Tecnopon PFM-II. UV-Vis spectra and chromatograms were obtained in High Performance Liquid Chromatography with Diode Array Detector (HPLC-DAD) Agilent Technologies 1220 Infinity equipment, photodiode array system (Agilent Technologies Model 1260 Infinity) and Agilent Zorbax Eclipse Plus C-18 column (250mm×4.6mm, 5µL) using methanol:water (3:1) as mobile phase (1.0mL/min). NMR spectra were obtained in two spectrometers: Bruker Avance III (600MHz) and Bruker Avance III (400MHz), using deuterated dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO- d6) as internal reference. Low mass spectrometry by electrospray ionization spectra were performed on Bruker Amazon ESI-IT. The SMILES answer is : NC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(N)C=CC=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: 0.166667 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A total of 46 chalcones with different electron-donating and electron-withdrawing substituents (chalcones1-46, Table 1) were synthesisedby following a Claisen-Schmidt condensation reaction. All solvents and reagents were purchased from Merck and Sigma-Aldrich, MO, USA and used without further purification. Briefly, sodium hydroxide (3 eq) was added to a solution of substituted acetophenone (1.0eq) in ethanol followed by the addition of the substituted benzaldehydes (1.2 eq) after 10 minutes and stirred at room temperature overnight under nitrogen. The reaction mixture was then cooled in an ice bath and neutralisedwith 1M hydrochloric acid. The neutralised mixture was then extracted using ethyl acetate. The organic layer was washed with distilled water, dried with anhydrous sodium sulphate, concentrated and the resultant mixture was purified through a column of silica gel to obtain the pure compounds.Column chromatography was performed on silica gel (Merck, Kieselgel 60, 230-400mesh) with hexane:ethyl acetate as the mobile phase. The thin layer chromatography was performed on silica gel plates (Merck, Kieselgel 60, 0.25mm thickness) with F254 as the indicator. The plate was observed under UV light (254nm and 366nm). Melting points of the chalcones were determined using Mel-Temp II melting point instrument. NMR spectra were recorded using a Jeol ECA 400 (400MHz) and/or Lambda 400 (400MHz) spectrometers with trimethylsilane (TMS) esters as the internal standard. All chemical shifts are reported in ppm.",NC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(N)C=CC=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: 0.166667 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A total of 46 chalcones with different electron-donating and electron-withdrawing substituents (chalcones1-46, Table 1) were synthesisedby following a Claisen-Schmidt condensation reaction. All solvents and reagents were purchased from Merck and Sigma-Aldrich, MO, USA and used without further purification. Briefly, sodium hydroxide (3 eq) was added to a solution of substituted acetophenone (1.0eq) in ethanol followed by the addition of the substituted benzaldehydes (1.2 eq) after 10 minutes and stirred at room temperature overnight under nitrogen. The reaction mixture was then cooled in an ice bath and neutralisedwith 1M hydrochloric acid. The neutralised mixture was then extracted using ethyl acetate. The organic layer was washed with distilled water, dried with anhydrous sodium sulphate, concentrated and the resultant mixture was purified through a column of silica gel to obtain the pure compounds.Column chromatography was performed on silica gel (Merck, Kieselgel 60, 230-400mesh) with hexane:ethyl acetate as the mobile phase. The thin layer chromatography was performed on silica gel plates (Merck, Kieselgel 60, 0.25mm thickness) with F254 as the indicator. The plate was observed under UV light (254nm and 366nm). Melting points of the chalcones were determined using Mel-Temp II melting point instrument. NMR spectra were recorded using a Jeol ECA 400 (400MHz) and/or Lambda 400 (400MHz) spectrometers with trimethylsilane (TMS) esters as the internal standard. All chemical shifts are reported in ppm. The SMILES answer is : NC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A solution of acetophenone (0.50 g, 4.16 mmol) and benzaldehyde (0.44 g, 4.16 mmol) in EtOH (5 mL) was mechanically stirred at room temperature for approximately 5 min before the dropwise addition of KOH (10% (w/v) aqueous solution, 5 mL). The subsequent reaction mixture was mechanically stirred at room temperature and continuously monitored by TLC. Upon completion, the reaction mixture was quenched with crushed ice (15 g) and acidified to pH 2 with HCl (32 wt. % in H2O, FCC). The subsequent precipitate was collected by vacuum filtration, dried (30 C) and recrystallized from EtOH to yield the title compound 15 as light yellow crystals (0.43 g, 49%).",OC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A solution of acetophenone (0.50 g, 4.16 mmol) and benzaldehyde (0.44 g, 4.16 mmol) in EtOH (5 mL) was mechanically stirred at room temperature for approximately 5 min before the dropwise addition of KOH (10% (w/v) aqueous solution, 5 mL). The subsequent reaction mixture was mechanically stirred at room temperature and continuously monitored by TLC. Upon completion, the reaction mixture was quenched with crushed ice (15 g) and acidified to pH 2 with HCl (32 wt. % in H2O, FCC). The subsequent precipitate was collected by vacuum filtration, dried (30 C) and recrystallized from EtOH to yield the title compound 15 as light yellow crystals (0.43 g, 49%). "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 0; 23°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: 2′-Hydroxychalcones were prepared using a modified literature procedure. (L. D. Chiaradia, A. Mascarello, M. Purificacao, J. Vernal, M. N. S. Cordeiro, M. E. Zenteno, A. Villarino, R. J. Nunes, R. A. Yunes, and H. Terenzi, Bioorg. Med. Chem. Lett., 2008, 18, 6227-6230.) Into a round bottom flask equipped with magnetic stirring bar was dissolved acetophenone derivative (15 mmol, 1 equiv) in methanol (100 mL) and 50% w/v KOH (17 mL). The reaction was stirred at 0 C. for 30 min. The aldehyde (18 mmol, 1.2 equiv) was added in one portion, and the mixture was stirred at 23 C. for 12-24 h. The solution was neutralized with 12 M HCl. The precipitate was removed by vacuum filtration, washed with water, dried, and recrystallized from methanol or dichloromethane/hexanes. When no precipitate was formed upon neutralization, the solution was extracted with EtOAc, and the combined organics were dried over sodium sulfate and concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by flash chromatography using 10% EtOAc/hexanes or recrystallization with hot methanol to afford the chalcones as a yellow solid.",OC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 0; 23°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: 2′-Hydroxychalcones were prepared using a modified literature procedure. (L. D. Chiaradia, A. Mascarello, M. Purificacao, J. Vernal, M. N. S. Cordeiro, M. E. Zenteno, A. Villarino, R. J. Nunes, R. A. Yunes, and H. Terenzi, Bioorg. Med. Chem. Lett., 2008, 18, 6227-6230.) Into a round bottom flask equipped with magnetic stirring bar was dissolved acetophenone derivative (15 mmol, 1 equiv) in methanol (100 mL) and 50% w/v KOH (17 mL). The reaction was stirred at 0 C. for 30 min. The aldehyde (18 mmol, 1.2 equiv) was added in one portion, and the mixture was stirred at 23 C. for 12-24 h. The solution was neutralized with 12 M HCl. The precipitate was removed by vacuum filtration, washed with water, dried, and recrystallized from methanol or dichloromethane/hexanes. When no precipitate was formed upon neutralization, the solution was extracted with EtOAc, and the combined organics were dried over sodium sulfate and concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by flash chromatography using 10% EtOAc/hexanes or recrystallization with hot methanol to afford the chalcones as a yellow solid. The SMILES answer is : OC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1

"

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 0 - 5°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In step 1, a simple acetophenone (1.0 mmol) and an aromaticaldehyde (1.0 mmol) were mixed in ethanol (EtOH) (15 mL)and stirred for 30 min in an ice bath followed by the dropwiseaddition of aqueous sodium hydroxide (NaOH) solution(10 mL, 30%). Whereas, in the case of substituted acetophenone(p-fluorocetophenone), instead of NaOH, an aqueouspotassium hydroxide (KOH) solution (10 mL, 20%) was used.Then, the reaction mixture was stirred for 3-4 h at the sametemperature (0-5 C). The formation of intermediate chalconeswas examined by TLC using n-hexane: ethyl acetate(3:1) as the mobile phase. Once the reaction was completed,the mixture was refrigerated overnight. It was diluted withice-cold distilled water (40 mL), filtered the precipitates,washed well with cold water, and the dried product wasrecrystallized from ethanol to obtain the purified chalcones. In step 2, a chalcone (1.0 mmol) and guanidine hydrochloride(2.0 mmol) were mixed in an aqueous KOH solution(2-3 mL, 50%), and then refluxed for 2-3 h in ethanol (10-15 mL). After the reaction completion, indicated by TLC, thereaction mixture was cooled and then evaporate the solventunder vacuum to obtain the crude product., which was thenpurified through recrystallization with methanol to furnishthe purified 2-amino-4,6-diarylpyrimidines 1p-15p.",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1OC,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 0 - 5°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In step 1, a simple acetophenone (1.0 mmol) and an aromaticaldehyde (1.0 mmol) were mixed in ethanol (EtOH) (15 mL)and stirred for 30 min in an ice bath followed by the dropwiseaddition of aqueous sodium hydroxide (NaOH) solution(10 mL, 30%). Whereas, in the case of substituted acetophenone(p-fluorocetophenone), instead of NaOH, an aqueouspotassium hydroxide (KOH) solution (10 mL, 20%) was used.Then, the reaction mixture was stirred for 3-4 h at the sametemperature (0-5 C). The formation of intermediate chalconeswas examined by TLC using n-hexane: ethyl acetate(3:1) as the mobile phase. Once the reaction was completed,the mixture was refrigerated overnight. It was diluted withice-cold distilled water (40 mL), filtered the precipitates,washed well with cold water, and the dried product wasrecrystallized from ethanol to obtain the purified chalcones. In step 2, a chalcone (1.0 mmol) and guanidine hydrochloride(2.0 mmol) were mixed in an aqueous KOH solution(2-3 mL, 50%), and then refluxed for 2-3 h in ethanol (10-15 mL). After the reaction completion, indicated by TLC, thereaction mixture was cooled and then evaporate the solventunder vacuum to obtain the crude product., which was thenpurified through recrystallization with methanol to furnishthe purified 2-amino-4,6-diarylpyrimidines 1p-15p. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1OC

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 5 - 10°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All the chalconederivatives were synthesized through a base-catalyzed ClaisenSchmidt condensation reaction [22]. A mixture consisting ofacetophenone (1, 0.01 mol) and aromatic aldehydes (2, 0.01mol) in 50 mL of ethanol was cooled to 5-10 C. Aqueous NaOH(70%, 5 mL) was added dropwise with continuous stirring.The resulting reaction mixture underwent magnetic stirringfor 2 h and left undisturbed overnight. Subsequently, neutralizationwas achieved using conc. HCl. The resulting solid productwas collected and subjected to additional purification throughthe crystallization process using ethanol. A mixture consisting ofacetophenone (1, 0.01 mol) and aromatic aldehydes (2, 0.01mol) in 50 mL of ethanol was cooled to 5-10 C. Aqueous NaOH(70%, 5 mL) was added dropwise with continuous stirring.The resulting reaction mixture underwent magnetic stirringfor 2 h and left undisturbed overnight. Subsequently, neutralizationwas achieved using conc. HCl. The resulting solid productwas collected and subjected to additional purification throughthe crystallization process using ethanol. The confirmation ofthe purity of all synthesized compounds was carried out throughthin-layer chromatography (TLC), utilizing a mobile phasecomprising n-hexane and ethyl acetate. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCC2=C1C=CC=C2, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 65°C, Time: 1.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The SSA (0.02 g) was added to a well stirred suspension of PhAc (1 mL, 0.90 g, 7.53 mmol, 1 eq.) and PhCHO (0.84 g, 7.91 mmol, 1.05 eq.) and the resulting mixture was heated at 65 C for 1.5 h. The reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature and partitioned between brine (25 mL) and CH2Cl2 (3 × 15 mL) and solid SSA was filtered off. The SSA was washed with acetone (25 mL) to ensure desorption of product on SSA surface. The combined organic extract was washed with brine (3 × 25 mL) and the organic extract was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered and concentrated under reduced pressure to afford the chalcone as colorless solid (1.48 g, 91%).",CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=C2CC3=C(C=CC=C3)C2=O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCC2=C1C=CC=C2, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 65°C, Time: 1.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). The reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature and partitioned between brine (25 mL) and CH2Cl2 (3 × 15 mL) and solid SSA was filtered off. The SSA was washed with acetone (25 mL) to ensure desorption of product on SSA surface. The combined organic extract was washed with brine (3 × 25 mL) and the organic extract was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered and concentrated under reduced pressure to afford the chalcone as colorless solid (1.48 g, 91%). The mixture was stirred under an ice bath condition, and then 10% NaOH solution was added dropwise. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCCC1, second reactant: O=CC=CC1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 80°C, Time: 2 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Cyclohexanone (0.115 g, 1.2 mmol), benzaldehyde (0.21g, 2 mmol) were mixed with PEG-SO3H (0.18 g, equal to 0.03 mmol of H+) and the obtained mixture was stirred magnetically at 80 C for 2 h. After completion of the reaction, warm water (5 ml) was added and the mixture stirred for 5 min. The insoluble crude product was filtered and recrystallized from EtOH. In order to recover the catalyst, H2O was evaporated under reduced pressure. The obtained solid was washed with diethyl ether (3-4 ml) and dried. The recovered PEG-SO3H was reused for another time without loss of its activity.",O=C1C(CCC1=CC=CC1=CC=CC=C1)=CC=CC1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CCCC1, second reactant: O=CC=CC1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 80°C, Time: 2 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Cyclohexanone (0.115 g, 1.2 mmol), benzaldehyde (0.21g, 2 mmol) were mixed with PEG-SO3H (0.18 g, equal to 0.03 mmol of H+) and the obtained mixture was stirred magnetically at 80 C for 2 h. After completion of the reaction, warm water (5 ml) was added and the mixture stirred for 5 min. The insoluble crude product was filtered and recrystallized from EtOH. In order to recover the catalyst, H2O was evaporated under reduced pressure. The obtained solid was washed with diethyl ether (3-4 ml) and dried. The recovered PEG-SO3H was reused for another time without loss of its activity. The SMILES answer is : O=C1C(CCC1=CC=CC1=CC=CC=C1)=CC=CC1=CC=CC=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20 - 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An equimolar mixture of substituted benzaldehyde (1mmol) and acetophenone (1mmol) were dissolved in 15 ml ethanol. Then 10ml NaOH solution (6g in 10ml H2O) was added drop wise to the reaction mixture with continuous stirring. The reaction temperature was maintained between 20-25 C using a cold water bath. The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC. After vigorous stirring for 4-5 hours the reaction mixture was kept overnight. It was then neutralized by acidified cold water to precipitate the solid product. Then 10ml NaOH solution (6g in 10ml H2O) was added drop wise to the reaction mixture with continuous stirring. The reaction temperature was maintained between 20-25 C using a cold water bath. The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC. After vigorous stirring for 4-5 hours the reaction mixture was kept overnight. It was then neutralized by acidified cold water to precipitate the solid product. On filtering off, the crude product was dried in air and recrystallized using ethanol. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a solution of 1′-acetonaphthone (120 mg, 0.70 mmol) and 3,4-difluorobenzaldehyde(100 mg, 0.70 mmol) in EtOH (1.0 mL) was added 40% aqueous KOH (0.5 mL), and the mixture was stirred at room temperature. After the reaction was complete, ice-water was added to the reaction mixture, which was then neutralized with 1N HCl. The mixture was extracted with EtOAc and the resultant organic phase was washed with brine, dried over MgSO4, and concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified by column chromatography on SiO2, eluting with hexane-EtOAc (15:1) to give (E)-3-(3,4-difluorophenyl)-1-(naphthalen-1-yl)prop-2-en-1-one (172 mg, 0.58 mmol) in 83% yield as a colorless solid. All chalcones were produced by the same procedure.",CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. After the reaction was complete, ice-water was added to the reaction mixture, which was then neutralized with 1N HCl. The residue was purified by column chromatography on SiO2, eluting with hexane-EtOAc (15:1) to give (E)-3-(3,4-difluorophenyl)-1-(naphthalen-1-yl)prop-2-en-1-one (172 mg, 0.58 mmol) in 83% yield as a colorless solid. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: OC1=C(C=O)C=C(Br)C=C1, Temperature: 0 - 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a cold (0 C) well-stirred solution of 5-bromo-2-hydroxybenzaldehyde (1.0 equiv.) and the corresponding ketone (1.2 equiv.) in MeOH (1.5mL/mmol; for 1a-c, f) or in EtOH-H2O (1:1 v/v, 1.25 mL/mmol; 1d, e) 40% aqueous solution of NaOH (3.5 equiv.) (1a-c,f) or 40% aqueous solution of KOH (3.5 equiv.) (1d, e) was added dropwise. The reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature for 18 h (1a), 48 h (1d-f), or heated at 90 C for 3-4 h (1b, c) with monitoring of the reaction progress by TLC. After completion of the reaction, an ice-cold water was poured, and the resulted mixture was acidified with 1M HCl to pH 2-3. The resulted precipitate was collected by filtration, washed with cold EtOH, and dried in vacuum. In the case of 1f, after completion of the reaction MeOH was distilled off in vacuum, the residue was acidified to pH 3 with 1M HCl and extracted three times with EtOAc. The combined organic extract was dried over Na2SO4, filtered and evaporated. The chalcone 1f was isolated by FC using gradient elution with hexane-EtOAc. E-3-(5-Bromo-2-hydroxyphenyl)-1-phenylprop-2-en-1-one (1a). (1a-c,f) or 40% aqueous solution of KOH (3.5 equiv.) (1d, e) was added dropwise. The reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature for 18 h (1a), 48 h (1d-f), or heated at 90 C for 3-4 h (1b, c) with monitoring of the reaction progress by TLC. After completion of the reaction, an ice-cold water was poured, and the resulted mixture was acidified with 1M HCl to pH 2-3. The resulted precipitate was collected by filtration, washed with cold EtOH, and dried in vacuum. In the case of 1f, after completion of the reaction MeOH was distilled off in vacuum, the residue was acidified to pH 3 with 1M HCl and extracted three times with EtOAc. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a cold (0 C) well-stirred solution of 5-bromo-2-hydroxybenzaldehyde (1.0 equiv.) and the corresponding ketone (1.2 equiv.) in MeOH (1.5mL/mmol; for 1a-c, f) or in EtOH-H2O (1:1 v/v, 1.25 mL/mmol; 1d, e) 40% aqueous solution of NaOH (3.5 equiv.) (1a-c,f) or 40% aqueous solution of KOH (3.5 equiv.) (1d, e) was added dropwise. The reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature for 18 h (1a), 48 h (1d-f), or heated at 90 C for 3-4 h (1b, c) with monitoring of the reaction progress by TLC. After completion of the reaction, an ice-cold water was poured, and the resulted mixture was acidified with 1M HCl to pH 2-3. The resulted precipitate was collected by filtration, washed with cold EtOH, and dried in vacuum. In the case of 1f, after completion of the reaction MeOH was distilled off in vacuum, the residue was acidified to pH 3 with 1M HCl and extracted three times with EtOAc. The combined organic extract was dried over Na2SO4, filtered and evaporated. The chalcone 1f was isolated by FC using gradient elution with hexane-EtOAc.
