"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 0°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The unsubstituted/substituted acetophenone (1a-1b, 1 mmol) was dissolved in approximately 10 mL of absolute ethyl alcohol and stirred for 5 minutes in an ice bath, as shown in Scheme 1. The sodium hydroxide (1.1 mmol) was then added portion-wise to the reaction flask. Following that, various substituted aromatic aldehydes (2a-2f, 1 mmol) were slowly added to the reaction mixture and stirred for 24 hours in an ice bath. When the reaction was completed (determined by thin layer chromatography) the reaction mixture was poured into crushed ice and neutralized with hydrochloric acid. The obtained precipitate was stirred for 30 minutes at room temperature and then filtered, washed with cold water/ethanol, and dried to afford the desired chalcones (3a-3k).",COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(C)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 0°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The unsubstituted/substituted acetophenone (1a-1b, 1 mmol) was dissolved in approximately 10 mL of absolute ethyl alcohol and stirred for 5 minutes in an ice bath, as shown in Scheme 1. The sodium hydroxide (1.1 mmol) was then added portion-wise to the reaction flask. Following that, various substituted aromatic aldehydes (2a-2f, 1 mmol) were slowly added to the reaction mixture and stirred for 24 hours in an ice bath. When the reaction was completed (determined by thin layer chromatography) the reaction mixture was poured into crushed ice and neutralized with hydrochloric acid. The obtained precipitate was stirred for 30 minutes at room temperature and then filtered, washed with cold water/ethanol, and dried to afford the desired chalcones (3a-3k). The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(C)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=CC=C1C=O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 0.0194444 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The air-dried paste of 2′-hydroxyacetophenone, benzaldehyde and anhydrous KOH was subjected to microwave irradiation to produce 2′-hydroxychalcones.At first 2-hydroxy-acetophenone (0.72mL, 6mmol) and 4-methoxybenzaldehyde (0.73mL, 6mmol) were placed in a porcelain dish. Then 10mL of ethanolic KOH (10%) solution was added and mixed with them. The porcelain dish was put in the microwave oven. The mixture was irradiated under 320W microwave irradiation for up to 1 min 10s. The progress of the reaction was checked by TLC (n-hexane: ethylacetate, 6:1). Ice cold water was added to dilute the reaction mixture and products were extracted with ether after acidifing with dilute HCl. The ether layer was washed with water and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and the solvent was evaporated. The product was obtained as a yellow crystal. The yellow crude solid was recrystallized from ethylacetate and n-hexane to give compounds of high purity. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Concentrated sulphuric acid (2.5 ml) was added slowly to the stirring solution of various substituted benzaldehydes (1 mmol) and acetophenones (1 mmol) in glacial acetic acid in a 500 ml round-bottom flask. The stirring was continued for 48 h keeping the temperature of reaction mixture below 5 C. The completion of the reaction was monitored by TLC. After the completion, the reaction mixture was poured over crushed ice and extracted thrice with ethyl acetate. The organic layer was pooled and concentrated under reduced pressure. The stirring was continued for 48 h keeping the temperature of reaction mixture below 5 C. The completion of the reaction was monitored by TLC. After the completion, the reaction mixture was poured over crushed ice and extracted thrice with ethyl acetate. The organic layer was pooled and concentrated under reduced pressure. The concentrated residue was adsorbed on silica gel (60-120 mesh), and the desired product was isolated by column chromatography employing increasing % age of ethyl acetate in hexane. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: BrC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: 75°C, Time: 10 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: unknown. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a solution of aldehyde 6 (5 mmol) in acetone (12.5 mL) was added amine salt 7 (1 mmol, 201.14 mg). The reaction mixture was stirred at 75 C in a sealed vial. After stirring at this temperature for 10 h, the reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature, saturated NaHCO3 solution and ethyl acetate was added. After phase separation the aqueous phase was extracted three times with ethyl acetate and the organic layer was dried over sodium sulfate and concentrated in vacuo to give mostly analytical pure products. If necessary the crude product was purified by column chromatography (ethyl acetate/hexane).",CC(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(Br)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: BrC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: 75°C, Time: 10 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: unknown. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a solution of aldehyde 6 (5 mmol) in acetone (12.5 mL) was added amine salt 7 (1 mmol, 201.14 mg). The reaction mixture was stirred at 75 C in a sealed vial. After stirring at this temperature for 10 h, the reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature, saturated NaHCO3 solution and ethyl acetate was added. After phase separation the aqueous phase was extracted three times with ethyl acetate and the organic layer was dried over sodium sulfate and concentrated in vacuo to give mostly analytical pure products. If necessary the crude product was purified by column chromatography (ethyl acetate/hexane). The SMILES answer is : CC(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(Br)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: unknown. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Compounds 12a-f and 12h were synthesized in alkaline media using a NaOH saturated solution according previous report of Mellado, et al. [4-7] To a dry, 100-mL round-bottomed flask, commercial (10a-f or 10h) and hemisinthetic acetophenones (9)(250 mg, between 1.23 and 2.08 mmol) and 4-dimethylaminobenzaldehyde (11, 1.2 molar equivalents) were added. Both reagents were solubilized in ethanol (10 mL), and the NaOH-saturated solution was added drop by drop and stirred for 48 h, after which 5% HCl solution was added until the pH ~ 7 to end the reaction. The mixture was extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 x 20 mL). The organic layer was dried with Na2SO4, filtered and separated using column chromatography with a hexane/EtOAc as eluent. This mixture increased polarity, allowing the obtention of compounds 12a-f and 12h in yields between 47 and 96%. Compounds 12i and 12j were obtained in acidic media.[8, 9] Briefly, in a 100-mL round-bottomed flask benzofuran-3(2H)-one (10i) or chroman-4-one (10j) (250 mg, between 1.69 to 1.69 mmol) and 4-dimethylaminobenzaldehyde (11, 1.0 molar equivalent) were added. Both reagents were solubilized in methanol (10 mL), and then concentrated H2SO4 was added drop by drop (10mL in total). The mixture was stirred for 48 h at room temperature. After this, 5% Na2CO3 solution was added until the pH ~ 7 to end the reaction, and the mixture was extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 x 20 mL). The organic layer was dried with Na2SO4, filtered, and separated with column chromatography using a hexane/EtOAc as eluent. This mixture increased polarity, allowing the obtention of compounds 12i and 12j (54 and 66% of yield). 1.1.2.1. (E)-3-(4-(dimethylamino)phenyl)-1-phenylprop-2-en-1-one (12a) Orange solid (80% yield) with 96% of purity by GC-MS. MP: 109-111 C. IR: υmax/cm-1 2911, 1651, 1596, 1561, 1528, 1378, 1168; 1H-NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.99 (2H, d, J= 7.6 Hz, H2 + H6), 7.79 (1H, d, J= 15.5 Hz, Hβ), 7.55 (2H, d, J= 8.6 Hz, H2′ + H6′), 7.54 (1H, m, H4), 7.48 (2H, d, J= 7.5 Hz, H3 + H5), 7.34 (1H, d, J= 15.5 Hz, Hα), 6.73 (2H, d, J= 8.6 Hz, H3′ + H5′), 3.03 (6H, s, (CH3)2N-C4′); 13C-NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ 190.7 (C=O), 145.7 (Cβ), 138.9 (C1), 132.2 (C2′ + C6′), 130.4 (C4), 128.4 (C2 + C6), 128.3 (C3 + C5), 117.2 (Cα), 112.3 (C3′ + C5′), 110.9 (C1′), 40.4 ((CH3)2N-C4′). The spectroscopic information of 1H-NMR and 13C-NMR were consistent with our previous report. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An aqueous solution of sodium hydroxide (30%, 25 mL) was slowly added to amethanol solution (30 mL) of the appropriate acetophenone (5.0 mmol). After the solutionhad been cooled to room temperature, the appropriate benzaldehyde (6.0 mmol) was added,and the solution was stirred overnight at the same temperature. After the completion ofthe reaction (12 h), the precipitated solid was removed by filtration, washed with H2O,and recrystallized from ethanol. If precipitation did not occur, the solvent was evaporatedin vacuum. EtOAc was added, and the organic phase was washed with water and brine,dried with Na2SO4, filtered, and evaporated. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An aqueous solution of sodium hydroxide (30%, 25 mL) was slowly added to amethanol solution (30 mL) of the appropriate acetophenone (5.0 mmol). After the solutionhad been cooled to room temperature, the appropriate benzaldehyde (6.0 mmol) was added,and the solution was stirred overnight at the same temperature. After the completion ofthe reaction (12 h), the precipitated solid was removed by filtration, washed with H2O,and recrystallized from ethanol. If precipitation did not occur, the solvent was evaporatedin vacuum. EtOAc was added, and the organic phase was washed with water and brine,dried with Na2SO4, filtered, and evaporated. The desired product was obtained afterpurification by flash column chromatography. For compounds 3d, 3g, and 3h, the analyticalcharacterization was in accordance with the literature. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The Claisen-Schmidt condensation of acetophenone with substituted aldehydes was carried out for the synthesis of compounds 1a-1g, 2a-2e and 3a-3b by combining 0.1M of acetophenone and 0.1M of aldehyde in 10ml of 95% ethanol (CAS No. 64-17-5) (Bhagat et al., 2006). To the above mixture, a 6ml solution of 0.2M sodium hydroxide (NaOH, CAS No. 1310-73-2) or potassium hydroxide (KOH, CAS No. 1310- 58-3) was added slowly at room temperature. The mixture was then subjected to overnight continuous stirring. A solvent system consisting of petroleum ether and ethyl acetate in a 7:3 ratio was used to monitor the reaction’s progress using TLC. Hydrochloric acid (1M) (CAS No. CAS 7647-01-0) was used to neutralize the resultant solution, and ethyl acetate (350ml) was used to extract it. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: As a therapeutic approach for type 2 diabetes, chalcones are renowned for their antidiabetic properties. To this end, 29 chalcones were designed, synthesized, and tested in-vitro for their ability to inhibit GP. An equimolar mixture of substituted acetophenone (1 mmol) and substituted benzaldehyde (1 mmol) in ethanol (20 mL) were stirred in ice bath, and then 10% of sodium hydroxide (1 mmol, 2.5 mL) was added dropwise. Stirring was continued for 30 min to 1 h. The mixture was kept for overnight in fridge; the solid substance was filtered off, and washed with ice cold water, followed by cold ethanol. The product was recrystallized from ethanol or methanol (Hannaford et al., 1978). For hydroxylated chalcones the amount of sodium hydroxide was doubled and stirring was continued for 24-48 h, the reaction mixture was quenched with 1% aqueous hydrochloric acid, the solid substance was filtered off and washed with ice cold water and purified by column chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate, 8:2). Details mentioned in supplementary information.",CN(C)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: As a therapeutic approach for type 2 diabetes, chalcones are renowned for their antidiabetic properties. To this end, 29 chalcones were designed, synthesized, and tested in-vitro for their ability to inhibit GP. An equimolar mixture of substituted acetophenone (1 mmol) and substituted benzaldehyde (1 mmol) in ethanol (20 mL) were stirred in ice bath, and then 10% of sodium hydroxide (1 mmol, 2.5 mL) was added dropwise. Stirring was continued for 30 min to 1 h. The mixture was kept for overnight in fridge; the solid substance was filtered off, and washed with ice cold water, followed by cold ethanol. The product was recrystallized from ethanol or methanol (Hannaford et al., 1978). For hydroxylated chalcones the amount of sodium hydroxide was doubled and stirring was continued for 24-48 h, the reaction mixture was quenched with 1% aqueous hydrochloric acid, the solid substance was filtered off and washed with ice cold water and purified by column chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate, 8:2). Details mentioned in supplementary information. The SMILES answer is : CN(C)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC(OC)=C(C(C)=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1, Temperature: 0°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Under N2 atmosphereand 0 OC, 1-(2-hydroxy-4,6-dimethoxyphenyl)ethanone (1mmol, 1 eq) or1-(2-hydroxy-4,6-dimethoxyphenyl)propan-1-one (1mmol, 1 eq) was dissolved into10 ml MeOH, followed by the addition of 10 ml aq. 40% NaOH solution, themixture was stirred for about 30 min, then benzaldehydes (1.2 mmol, 1.2eq.)were added respectively. The mixture was stirred for overnight and monitored byTLC. After the starting material 1-(2-hydroxy-4,6-dimethoxyphenyl)ethanone or 1-(2-hydroxy-4,6-dimethoxyphenyl)propan-1-onewas consumed completely, the pH value was adjusted to 3 with aq. 3 N HClsolution, a large amount of yellowish solid formed. The crude product was filtrated,recrystallized from MeOH or purified by si-gel column chromatography to affordfine desired products.",COC1=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=C(OC)C=C(OC)C=C2O)=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC(OC)=C(C(C)=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1, Temperature: 0°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; methanol. The mixture was stirred for overnight and monitored byTLC. The crude product was filtrated,recrystallized from MeOH or purified by si-gel column chromatography to affordfine desired products. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A 100 mL round-bottom flask was charged with a mixture of substituted aromatic aldehyde 2a-2f (5 mmol) and substituted acetophenone 1a-1c (5 mmol) in 10 mL of ethanol, SnO2 nanocatalyst was added, and the mixture was stirred at room temperature. The progress of the reaction was monitored continuously by TLC (petroleum ether-ethyl acetate; 8:2). When the initial reactants disappeared, phenylhydrazine (0.54 g, 5 mmol) was added, and the mixture was stirred until the reaction was complete (TLC). The mixture was poured into cold water and extracted with ethyl acetate (3×10 mL) in a separating funnel. The combined extracts were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated, and the residue was purified by recrystallization and column chromatography.",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A 100 mL round-bottom flask was charged with a mixture of substituted aromatic aldehyde 2a-2f (5 mmol) and substituted acetophenone 1a-1c (5 mmol) in 10 mL of ethanol, SnO2 nanocatalyst was added, and the mixture was stirred at room temperature. The progress of the reaction was monitored continuously by TLC (petroleum ether-ethyl acetate; 8:2). When the initial reactants disappeared, phenylhydrazine (0.54 g, 5 mmol) was added, and the mixture was stirred until the reaction was complete (TLC). The mixture was poured into cold water and extracted with ethyl acetate (3×10 mL) in a separating funnel. The combined extracts were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated, and the residue was purified by recrystallization and column chromatography. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 0.166667 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To 41-methoxyacetophenone (12 mmol) dissolved in MeOH (10 mL) a benzaldehyde derivative(12 mmol) dissolved in MeOH (10 mL) was added portionwise. The reaction mixture was stirredfor 10 min at room temperature and then KOH (1.44 g, 36 mmol) was added. The resulting mixturewas stirred for 14-18 h in the dark. Next the mixture was diluted with three volumes of distilledwater and acidified to pH 4-6 with concentrated HCl. The precipitate was filtered on a Schottfilter, washed with large amounts of distilled water, and dried under a vacuum for 5 h. The crudeproduct was purified by column chromatography on silica gel (eluent: 10%-20% v/v of acetone inhexane). A series of respective (E)-1,3-diphenylpropen-1-one derivatives was obtained in 60%-85%yield (see Supplementary Materials).",COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 0.166667 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To 41-methoxyacetophenone (12 mmol) dissolved in MeOH (10 mL) a benzaldehyde derivative(12 mmol) dissolved in MeOH (10 mL) was added portionwise. The reaction mixture was stirredfor 10 min at room temperature and then KOH (1.44 g, 36 mmol) was added. The resulting mixturewas stirred for 14-18 h in the dark. Next the mixture was diluted with three volumes of distilledwater and acidified to pH 4-6 with concentrated HCl. The precipitate was filtered on a Schottfilter, washed with large amounts of distilled water, and dried under a vacuum for 5 h. The crudeproduct was purified by column chromatography on silica gel (eluent: 10%-20% v/v of acetone inhexane). A series of respective (E)-1,3-diphenylpropen-1-one derivatives was obtained in 60%-85%yield (see Supplementary Materials). The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Claisen-Schmidt condensation. To a solution of substituted acetophenone (100 mg) and substituted benzaldehyde (1.2 eq) in a mixed solvent of EtOH and H2O (v/v, 2:1, 5 mL) at room temperature, NaOH aqueous solution (1 mol/L, 0.5 mL) was added dropwise. The result mixture was stirred overnight and the reaction process was monitored by TLC (5:1, PE/EA). Then, the reaction was quenched with 20 mL water, and extracted with DCM (2×10 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel to afford chalcone derivatives.",COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Claisen-Schmidt condensation. To a solution of substituted acetophenone (100 mg) and substituted benzaldehyde (1.2 eq) in a mixed solvent of EtOH and H2O (v/v, 2:1, 5 mL) at room temperature, NaOH aqueous solution (1 mol/L, 0.5 mL) was added dropwise. The result mixture was stirred overnight and the reaction process was monitored by TLC (5:1, PE/EA). Then, the reaction was quenched with 20 mL water, and extracted with DCM (2×10 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel to afford chalcone derivatives. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of substrate (1 mmol), aldehyde (1.2 mmol) and boric acid (0.2 mmol) was placed in a cylindrical quartz reactor ( θ = 4 cm). The reactor was introduced into an Explorer24 CEM apparatus. The stirred mixture was heated at 160 C (P = 300 W) for 40 min, except for 3c (180 C). After microwave dielectric heating, the crude reaction mixture was allowed to cool down at room temperature and ethanol (10 mL) or mixture of H2O/EtOH (10 mL) was directly added in the cylindrical quartz reactor. The resulting precipitated product was filtered off and was purified by recrystallization from ethanol if necessary.",CN(C)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 160°C, Time: 0.666667 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). The reactor was introduced into an Explorer24 CEM apparatus. The stirred mixture was heated at 160 C (P = 300 W) for 40 min, except for 3c (180 C). After microwave dielectric heating, the crude reaction mixture was allowed to cool down at room temperature and ethanol (10 mL) or mixture of H2O/EtOH (10 mL) was directly added in the cylindrical quartz reactor. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: As a therapeutic approach for type 2 diabetes, chalcones are renowned for their antidiabetic properties. To this end, 29 chalcones were designed, synthesized, and tested in-vitro for their ability to inhibit GP. An equimolar mixture of substituted acetophenone (1 mmol) and substituted benzaldehyde (1 mmol) in ethanol (20 mL) were stirred in ice bath, and then 10% of sodium hydroxide (1 mmol, 2.5 mL) was added dropwise. Stirring was continued for 30 min to 1 h. The mixture was kept for overnight in fridge; the solid substance was filtered off, and washed with ice cold water, followed by cold ethanol. The product was recrystallized from ethanol or methanol (Hannaford et al., 1978). For hydroxylated chalcones the amount of sodium hydroxide was doubled and stirring was continued for 24-48 h, the reaction mixture was quenched with 1% aqueous hydrochloric acid, the solid substance was filtered off and washed with ice cold water and purified by column chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate, 8:2). Details mentioned in supplementary information.",CN(C)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: As a therapeutic approach for type 2 diabetes, chalcones are renowned for their antidiabetic properties. To this end, 29 chalcones were designed, synthesized, and tested in-vitro for their ability to inhibit GP. An equimolar mixture of substituted acetophenone (1 mmol) and substituted benzaldehyde (1 mmol) in ethanol (20 mL) were stirred in ice bath, and then 10% of sodium hydroxide (1 mmol, 2.5 mL) was added dropwise. Stirring was continued for 30 min to 1 h. The mixture was kept for overnight in fridge; the solid substance was filtered off, and washed with ice cold water, followed by cold ethanol. The product was recrystallized from ethanol or methanol (Hannaford et al., 1978). For hydroxylated chalcones the amount of sodium hydroxide was doubled and stirring was continued for 24-48 h, the reaction mixture was quenched with 1% aqueous hydrochloric acid, the solid substance was filtered off and washed with ice cold water and purified by column chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate, 8:2). Details mentioned in supplementary information. The SMILES answer is : CN(C)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1

Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Chalcones (3a-j) were synthesized via Clasien-Schmidt condensation of substituted benzaldehyde and acetophenones. In dry DCM substituted benzaldehyde (1.0 mmol), acetophenone (1.0 mmol) in the presence of zirconium chloride (20 mol %) was taken. Reaction was stirred at room temperature for 2 h leading to generation of chalcone. Progress of reaction was monitored by TLC. After completion of reaction solvent was evaporated under the reduced pressure and residue was extracted with ethyl acetate and water. The organic layer was separated and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and filtered. The filtrate was evaporated under vacuum on a rotary evaporator.",O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 2 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dichloromethane. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Chalcones (3a-j) were synthesized via Clasien-Schmidt condensation of substituted benzaldehyde and acetophenones. In dry DCM substituted benzaldehyde (1.0 mmol), acetophenone (1.0 mmol) in the presence of zirconium chloride (20 mol %) was taken. Reaction was stirred at room temperature for 2 h leading to generation of chalcone. Progress of reaction was monitored by TLC. After completion of reaction solvent was evaporated under the reduced pressure and residue was extracted with ethyl acetate and water. The organic layer was separated and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and filtered. The filtrate was evaporated under vacuum on a rotary evaporator. The SMILES answer is : O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 3 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: NaOH (12g) was dissolved in water (98mL) in ice bath before the aqueous solution was mixed with ethanol (50mL). Acetophenone (26g) and benzaldehyde (23g) were added to the mixture under vigorous stirring and then stirred at room temperature for 3h. After the reaction was stopped, the resultant mixture was cooled in the refrigerator overnight and yellow precipitation was got and filtered. The residue was washed until the pH of the filtrate got to 7 and then with cold ethanol (10mL). The crude product was recrystallized with ethanol to yield light yellow unsaturated ketone . The unsaturatedketone (0.048mol) was dissolved in methanol (120mL) in ice bath. The mixture ofH2O2 aqueous solution (30%, 12mL) and NaOH aqueous solution (2mol/L, 12mL) was slowly added to the system under vigorous stirring and then stirred for 2h. White residue could be obtained after the resultant mixture was filtered and washed with water and cold methanol. α,β-Epoxy ketoneswas prepared after the residue was recrystallized with ethanol.",O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 3 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: NaOH (12g) was dissolved in water (98mL) in ice bath before the aqueous solution was mixed with ethanol (50mL). Acetophenone (26g) and benzaldehyde (23g) were added to the mixture under vigorous stirring and then stirred at room temperature for 3h. After the reaction was stopped, the resultant mixture was cooled in the refrigerator overnight and yellow precipitation was got and filtered. The residue was washed until the pH of the filtrate got to 7 and then with cold ethanol (10mL). The crude product was recrystallized with ethanol to yield light yellow unsaturated ketone . The unsaturatedketone (0.048mol) was dissolved in methanol (120mL) in ice bath. The mixture ofH2O2 aqueous solution (30%, 12mL) and NaOH aqueous solution (2mol/L, 12mL) was slowly added to the system under vigorous stirring and then stirred for 2h. White residue could be obtained after the resultant mixture was filtered and washed with water and cold methanol. α,β-Epoxy ketoneswas prepared after the residue was recrystallized with ethanol. The SMILES answer is : O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1, Temperature: 0 - 25°C, Time: 3 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a solution of benzaldehyde (1.06 g, 10 mmol) and acetophenone (1.20 g, 10 mmol) in ethanol (30 mL) was added 30 mL aqueous sodium hydroxide (0.80 g, 20 mmol) dropwise via addition funnel at 0 C and then stirred for another 3 h at 20-25 C. After completion of the reaction (detected by TLC), the reaction mixture was filtered, and the crude product washed with ethanol-water solution (1/1) and dried to obtain the desired chalcone 1a (1.77 g, 85%). 1a: 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.02 (d, J= 7.0 Hz, 2H), 7.82 (d, J = 15.5 Hz, 1H), 7.65 (d, J = 5.5 Hz, 2H), 7.58 (d, J = 15.5 Hz, 1H), 7.51 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 3H), 7.43 (d, J = 7.5 Hz, 3H); GC-MS [m/z] 208.9 ([M+1]+, 100%), 105.1 (25%).",O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1, Temperature: 0 - 25°C, Time: 3 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a solution of benzaldehyde (1.06 g, 10 mmol) and acetophenone (1.20 g, 10 mmol) in ethanol (30 mL) was added 30 mL aqueous sodium hydroxide (0.80 g, 20 mmol) dropwise via addition funnel at 0 C and then stirred for another 3 h at 20-25 C. After completion of the reaction (detected by TLC), the reaction mixture was filtered, and the crude product washed with ethanol-water solution (1/1) and dried to obtain the desired chalcone 1a (1.77 g, 85%). 1a: 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.02 (d, J= 7.0 Hz, 2H), 7.82 (d, J = 15.5 Hz, 1H), 7.65 (d, J = 5.5 Hz, 2H), 7.58 (d, J = 15.5 Hz, 1H), 7.51 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 3H), 7.43 (d, J = 7.5 Hz, 3H); GC-MS [m/z] 208.9 ([M+1]+, 100%), 105.1 (25%). The SMILES answer is : O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1

"

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1, Temperature: 0°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Compounds 3 were synthesized according to a literaturereport28 and some improvements were made. To a solution ofbenzaldehyde (1.06 g, 10 mmol) and acetophenone (1.20 g,10 mmol) in ethanol (30 mL) was added 2.5 M aqueoussodium hydroxide (0.8 g, 20 mmol) (30 mL) dropwise via anaddition funnel at 0 C. After completion of the reaction(detected by TLC), the solid product was filtered off, washedwith ethanol-water solution (V/V = 1/1), and dried. Thedesired chalcone 3 was obtained in 75%-85% isolated yield.",O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1, Temperature: 0°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Compounds 3 were synthesized according to a literaturereport28 and some improvements were made. To a solution ofbenzaldehyde (1.06 g, 10 mmol) and acetophenone (1.20 g,10 mmol) in ethanol (30 mL) was added 2.5 M aqueoussodium hydroxide (0.8 g, 20 mmol) (30 mL) dropwise via anaddition funnel at 0 C. After completion of the reaction(detected by TLC), the solid product was filtered off, washedwith ethanol-water solution (V/V = 1/1), and dried. Thedesired chalcone 3 was obtained in 75%-85% isolated yield. The SMILES answer is : O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An appropriate mixture of aryl methyl ketones(100mmol) and substituted benzaldehydes(100mmol) were mixed thoroughly with 1.5mL ofmethanol in a 50 mL corning beaker for attaininghomogeneity. Then, 0.05 g of BiOCl catalyst wereadded in the mixture and closed the beaker with lid.The reaction mixture was subjected to heat in amicrowave oven (Samsung, Grill GW73BD Model,100-750 W, 2450 MHz, 230 A/c) at 650W for 3-5 min the period of 30 second (Scheme1). Aftercomplete conversion of the ketones as monitored byTLC, the mixture was allowed to stand for 20minutes. The reaction product mixture was extractedwith 10 mL of dichloromethane and the catalyst wasremoved by simple filtration. Evaporation ofdichloromethane contributed to a crude product.Further this was recrystallized with ethanol. Thepurities of synthesized enones were examined bytheir physical constants. The catalyst was washedwith ethyl acetate (5 mL) and heated on an oven at110C for 5 h. Afterwards, this catalyst was reusedfor this reaction as second time. But unfortunately,this catalyst does not catalyze this condensation.Therefore, this catalyst was not reusable. Thissynthetic protocol was used for synthesis of some enones with their physical constants and reactiontimes are given in Scheme 1.",O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An appropriate mixture of aryl methyl ketones(100mmol) and substituted benzaldehydes(100mmol) were mixed thoroughly with 1.5mL ofmethanol in a 50 mL corning beaker for attaininghomogeneity. Then, 0.05 g of BiOCl catalyst wereadded in the mixture and closed the beaker with lid.The reaction mixture was subjected to heat in amicrowave oven (Samsung, Grill GW73BD Model,100-750 W, 2450 MHz, 230 A/c) at 650W for 3-5 min the period of 30 second (Scheme1). Aftercomplete conversion of the ketones as monitored byTLC, the mixture was allowed to stand for 20minutes. The reaction product mixture was extractedwith 10 mL of dichloromethane and the catalyst wasremoved by simple filtration. Evaporation ofdichloromethane contributed to a crude product.Further this was recrystallized with ethanol. Thepurities of synthesized enones were examined bytheir physical constants. The catalyst was washedwith ethyl acetate (5 mL) and heated on an oven at110C for 5 h. Afterwards, this catalyst was reusedfor this reaction as second time. But unfortunately,this catalyst does not catalyze this condensation.Therefore, this catalyst was not reusable. Thissynthetic protocol was used for synthesis of some enones with their physical constants and reactiontimes are given in Scheme 1. The SMILES answer is : O=C(C=CC1=CC=CC=C1)C1=CC2=C(C=CC=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: 4 - 20°C, Time: 16 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: A stirred mixture of 5.0 g (37 mmol) of p-aminoacetophenone, 140 mL of ethanol and 240 mL of aqueous NaOH 4 M solution was brought to 0 C. 5.05 g (37 mmol) of p-anisaldehyde was added and the mixture was stirred at room temperature for 4 h. The flask was kept at 4 C for 12 h, and then filtered off. The compound was dissolved in 300 mL of boiling methanol. The hot solution was filtered off and the solvent was evaporated to give compound (1). Yield: 4.8 g (51 %). M.p.: 120±1 C. 1H NMR δH (400 MHz, DMSO-d6, Me4Si): 7.95 (2H, d, J 8.7Hz, Ph); 7.83 (2H, d, J 8.8Hz, Ph); 7.77 (1H, d, J 15.5Hz, CH); 7.63 (1H, d, J 15.5Hz, CH); 7.03 (2H, d, J 8.8Hz, Ph); 6.65 (2H, d, J 8.8Hz, Ph); 6.14 (2H, s, NH2); 3.85 (3H, s, CH3). 13C NMR, δC (100.6 MHz, DMSO-d6, Me4Si): 186.80, 161.74, 154.61, 142.24, 131.87, 131.17, 128.71, 126.46, 120.84, 115.23, 113.62, 56.24. FT-IR [wavenumbers (cm-1)]: νNH2: 3350; νC=O: 1640.",COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(N)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: 4 - 20°C, Time: 16 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: A stirred mixture of 5.0 g (37 mmol) of p-aminoacetophenone, 140 mL of ethanol and 240 mL of aqueous NaOH 4 M solution was brought to 0 C. 5.05 g (37 mmol) of p-anisaldehyde was added and the mixture was stirred at room temperature for 4 h. The flask was kept at 4 C for 12 h, and then filtered off. The compound was dissolved in 300 mL of boiling methanol. The hot solution was filtered off and the solvent was evaporated to give compound (1). Yield: 4.8 g (51 %). M.p.: 120±1 C. 1H NMR δH (400 MHz, DMSO-d6, Me4Si): 7.95 (2H, d, J 8.7Hz, Ph); 7.83 (2H, d, J 8.8Hz, Ph); 7.77 (1H, d, J 15.5Hz, CH); 7.63 (1H, d, J 15.5Hz, CH); 7.03 (2H, d, J 8.8Hz, Ph); 6.65 (2H, d, J 8.8Hz, Ph); 6.14 (2H, s, NH2); 3.85 (3H, s, CH3). 13C NMR, δC (100.6 MHz, DMSO-d6, Me4Si): 186.80, 161.74, 154.61, 142.24, 131.87, 131.17, 128.71, 126.46, 120.84, 115.23, 113.62, 56.24. EI-LRMS m/z: 253.11 (M+, 100), 252.10 (35), 238.08 (38), 225.11 (18), 210.08 (22), 161.06 (18), 145.05 (15), 120.04 (73), 92.05 (22), 65.04 (18). HRMS calcd. for (C16H15NO2): 253.1103; Found: 253.1102. FT-IR [wavenumbers (cm-1)]: νNH2: 3350; νC=O: 1640. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(N)C=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=C(C=O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: CCOC(=O)CC#N, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 2 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; lithium hydroxide monohydrate. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Catalytic activity of Zn-MOFs for the Knoevenagel reaction wascarried out using benzaldehyde as the model substrate. Generally, amixture of the aldehyde, malononitrile or ethyl 2-cyanoacetate and a Zn-MOF catalyst at different proportion were added in a 25 mL roundbottom-flask at room temperature with mechanical stirring at a ratio of600 rpm/min. After completion of the reaction, the mixture was poured into water. The solid catalysts were filtered off and treated with aqueousalcohol in good purity without further recrystallization, dried undervacuum at 80 C for 6 h, and reused if necessary. The conversion of thisreaction was monitored by GC analysis (Shimadzu GC-2010 Plus) underthe following conditions: N2 was used as carrier gas at a flow rate of 3mLmin 1, the injector-port temperature was set at 270 C, the columntemperature and the detector temperature were set at 180 C and 300 Crespectively. Undecane was used as internal standard.",CCOC(=O)C(=C\C1=CC=CC=C1C)\C#N,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=C(C=O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: CCOC(=O)CC#N, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 2 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; lithium hydroxide monohydrate. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Catalytic activity of Zn-MOFs for the Knoevenagel reaction wascarried out using benzaldehyde as the model substrate. Generally, amixture of the aldehyde, malononitrile or ethyl 2-cyanoacetate and a Zn-MOF catalyst at different proportion were added in a 25 mL roundbottom-flask at room temperature with mechanical stirring at a ratio of600 rpm/min. After completion of the reaction, the mixture was poured into water. The solid catalysts were filtered off and treated with aqueousalcohol in good purity without further recrystallization, dried undervacuum at 80 C for 6 h, and reused if necessary. The conversion of thisreaction was monitored by GC analysis (Shimadzu GC-2010 Plus) underthe following conditions: N2 was used as carrier gas at a flow rate of 3mLmin 1, the injector-port temperature was set at 270 C, the columntemperature and the detector temperature were set at 180 C and 300 Crespectively. Undecane was used as internal standard. The SMILES answer is : CCOC(=O)C(=C\C1=CC=CC=C1C)\C#N

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCOC(=O)C(F)(F)F, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: tert-butyl methyl ether. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Step 1: Preparation of 4,4,4-trifluoro-1-[4-(chloro)phenyl]-butane-1,3-dione. Ethyl trifluoroacetate (23.52 g, 166 mmol) was dissolved in methyl tert-butyl ether (75 mL). To the stirred solution was added 25 weight % sodium methoxide (40 mL, 177 mmol). 4'-Chloroacetophenone (23.21 g, 150 mmol) was dissolved in methyl tert-butyl ether (20 mL) and added to the reaction dropwise. After stirring overnight (15.75 hours), 3N HCl (70 mL) was added. The organic layer was collected, washed with brine (75 mL), dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated in vacuo to give a yellow-orange solid. The solid was recrystallized from isooctane to give the dione (31.96 g, 85%): mp 66-67 C.",FC(F)(F)C(=O)CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCOC(=O)C(F)(F)F, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: tert-butyl methyl ether. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Step 1: Preparation of 4,4,4-trifluoro-1-[4-(chloro)phenyl]-butane-1,3-dione. Ethyl trifluoroacetate (23.52 g, 166 mmol) was dissolved in methyl tert-butyl ether (75 mL). To the stirred solution was added 25 weight % sodium methoxide (40 mL, 177 mmol). 4'-Chloroacetophenone (23.21 g, 150 mmol) was dissolved in methyl tert-butyl ether (20 mL) and added to the reaction dropwise. After stirring overnight (15.75 hours), 3N HCl (70 mL) was added. The organic layer was collected, washed with brine (75 mL), dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated in vacuo to give a yellow-orange solid. The solid was recrystallized from isooctane to give the dione (31.96 g, 85%): mp 66-67 C. The SMILES answer is : FC(F)(F)C(=O)CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCOC(=O)C=[N]#N, second reactant: CC1=C(C=O)C=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dichloromethane. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A stirred solution of aldehyde (1.0 mmol), acyldiazomethane (1.2 mmol), and DIPEA (2.0 mmol) in CH2Cl2 (10 mL) was added MgI2 etherate (1.0 mmol) at room temperature. The resulting homogeneous reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature for 15-45 min. Extractive workup with ethyl acetate. The combined organic layers were washed with brine, dried and purified by flash column chromatography on a silica gel to give the desired product.",CCOC(=O)C(=[N]#N)C(O)C1=CC=CC=C1C,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCOC(=O)C=[N]#N, second reactant: CC1=C(C=O)C=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dichloromethane. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A stirred solution of aldehyde (1.0 mmol), acyldiazomethane (1.2 mmol), and DIPEA (2.0 mmol) in CH2Cl2 (10 mL) was added MgI2 etherate (1.0 mmol) at room temperature. The resulting homogeneous reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature for 15-45 min. Extractive workup with ethyl acetate. The combined organic layers were washed with brine, dried and purified by flash column chromatography on a silica gel to give the desired product. The SMILES answer is : CCOC(=O)C(=[N]#N)C(O)C1=CC=CC=C1C

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: To a solution of 3 -methoxybenzaldehyde (200 mg, 1.47 mmol) and 4-chloroacetophenone (0.19 mL, 1.47 mmol) in EtOH (12 mL) at room temperature was added dropwise 2 M NaOH (3.7 mL, 7.4 mmol), and the reaction mixture was stirred for 3 h. After, the solution was cooled down to 0 C and the resulting precipitated solids were then collected by filtration, washed with water and dried in vacuo to afford (E)-l-(4-chlorophenyl)-3-(3-methoxyphenyl)prop-2- en-l-one as a colourless solid (345 mg), which was used directly in the next step without further purification.",COC1=CC=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Cl)C=C2)=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: To a solution of 3 -methoxybenzaldehyde (200 mg, 1.47 mmol) and 4-chloroacetophenone (0.19 mL, 1.47 mmol) in EtOH (12 mL) at room temperature was added dropwise 2 M NaOH (3.7 mL, 7.4 mmol), and the reaction mixture was stirred for 3 h. After, the solution was cooled down to 0 C and the resulting precipitated solids were then collected by filtration, washed with water and dried in vacuo to afford (E)-l-(4-chlorophenyl)-3-(3-methoxyphenyl)prop-2- en-l-one as a colourless solid (345 mg), which was used directly in the next step without further purification. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Cl)C=C2)=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Vanillin (0.1 mol, 15.2 g) and substituted acetophenones (0.1 mol) were dissolved in ethanol (95%). Dry HCl gas was passed into it for 40-45 min. The reaction mixture was left overnight at RT and then poured into crushed ice and neutralized with sodium bicarbonate if necessary. The solid so obtained was filtered and washed with water until excess acid is removed off. The chalcones were purified by recrystallization with aqueous alcohol (1:1). (E)-3-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)-1-phenylprop-2- en-1-one (1a) Dark brown powder; Yield 98%; m.p. 107-109C; Rf 0.30 n-Hexane: Ethyl acetate (5:1); λmax, 294 nm; IR cm-1 3432 (OH str), 3062 (Ar-CH str), 2935 (Ali-CH str), 1675 (C=O str), 1597 (C=C str), 1117 (C-O-C str)",COC1=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)=CC=C1O,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Vanillin (0.1 mol, 15.2 g) and substituted acetophenones (0.1 mol) were dissolved in ethanol (95%). Dry HCl gas was passed into it for 40-45 min. The reaction mixture was left overnight at RT and then poured into crushed ice and neutralized with sodium bicarbonate if necessary. The solid so obtained was filtered and washed with water until excess acid is removed off. The chalcones were purified by recrystallization with aqueous alcohol (1:1). (E)-3-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)-1-phenylprop-2- en-1-one (1a) Dark brown powder; Yield 98%; m.p. 107-109C; Rf 0.30 n-Hexane: Ethyl acetate (5:1); λmax, 294 nm; IR cm-1 3432 (OH str), 3062 (Ar-CH str), 2935 (Ali-CH str), 1675 (C=O str), 1597 (C=C str), 1117 (C-O-C str) The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)=CC=C1O

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Chemicals and solvents purchased from Sigma Aldrich were utilized without any additional purification. The Claisen-Schmidt condensation reaction, widely recognized in the scientific community for its simplicity, cost-effectiveness, and adaptability, served as the cornerstone for synthesizing chalcone derivatives in this investigation.All the chalcone derivatives in this study were created using the condensation process of corresponding substituted aldehyde substituted acetophenone as shown in scheme 1 in equimolar amounts while an aqueous NaOH catalyst was present. Once the combinations had been continuously stirred at room temperature for two to four hours, they were poured into 500 millilitres of ice-cold water. To obtain MLDCL, MLFC, and MLNC pure chalcones, the crudes obtained were sieved, rinsed with water, and dried repeatedly on their own. The resulting compounds were heated to remove any extra water after being dissolved in a 1:1 mixture of acetone and DMF solvent. After passing the solution through the Whatman filter paper again, it was set aside for 4-5 days at room temperature to slowly evaporate. Re-crystallization produced high-quality single crystals (Fig. 1 ).",CC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(C=C2)N(=O)=O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Chemicals and solvents purchased from Sigma Aldrich were utilized without any additional purification. The Claisen-Schmidt condensation reaction, widely recognized in the scientific community for its simplicity, cost-effectiveness, and adaptability, served as the cornerstone for synthesizing chalcone derivatives in this investigation.All the chalcone derivatives in this study were created using the condensation process of corresponding substituted aldehyde substituted acetophenone as shown in scheme 1 in equimolar amounts while an aqueous NaOH catalyst was present. Once the combinations had been continuously stirred at room temperature for two to four hours, they were poured into 500 millilitres of ice-cold water. To obtain MLDCL, MLFC, and MLNC pure chalcones, the crudes obtained were sieved, rinsed with water, and dried repeatedly on their own. The resulting compounds were heated to remove any extra water after being dissolved in a 1:1 mixture of acetone and DMF solvent. After passing the solution through the Whatman filter paper again, it was set aside for 4-5 days at room temperature to slowly evaporate. Re-crystallization produced high-quality single crystals (Fig. 1 ). The SMILES answer is : CC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(C=C2)N(=O)=O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CCCOCC1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CCC(=O)N1[C@H](CC2=CC=CC=C2)COC1=O, Temperature: 0; -78 - 20; 20°C, Time: 0.833333; 3.66667; 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dichloromethane; dichloromethane; methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: A solution of oxazolidinone 16 (40.8 g, 175 mmol, 1.00 equiv) in CH2Cl2 (700 mL) was cooled to 0 C and Bu2BOTf (210 mL, 1.0 M in CH2Cl2, 210 mmol, 1.20 equiv) was added over the course of 30 min. Subsequently, iPr2NEt (41.6 mL, 31.6 g, 245 mmol, 1.40 equiv) was added over the course of 10 min. The solution was stirred a further 10 min and then cooled to -78 C. A solution of 3-(benzyloxy)propanal(33.6 g, 205 mmol, 1.17 equiv) in CH2Cl2 (70 mL) was added over the course of 10 min and the reaction was stirred for 2 h at -78 C and 1.5 h at 0 C. Subsequently, the reaction was quenched by addition of aq pH 7 buffer (225 mL) and MeOH (325 mL). After stirring for 30 min, MeOH (450 mL) and H2O2 (30%, 225 mL) were added and stirring was continued for 30 min at r.t. The layers were separated and the aqueouslayer was extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 × 250 mL). The organic layers were combined, washed with sat. aq NaHCO3 solution (280 mL) andsat. aq NaCl solution (390 mL), and dried (Na2SO4). "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CO1, second reactant: CCOC(=O)C=[N]#N, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dimethyl sulfoxide. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Glycine ethyl ester hydrochloride (1.12 g, 8 mmol) was dissolved inH2O (2.5 mL) and 5% sulfuric acid (0.76 mL, w/w) was added and a 4-mL syringe was equipped with the mixture. Next, NaNO2 (664 mg, 10 mmol) was dissolved in H2O (3.9mL) and another 4-mL syringe was equipped with this solution. The two syringes were connected to a flow setup with a T-piece mixer and a 0.9-mL coil (PTFE, i.d. = 0.5mm). 1,8-Diazabicycloundec-7-ene (596 μL, 4 mmol) was dissolved in dimethylsulfoxide (3.4 mL) and charged into a 4-mL syringe. Aldehyde (4 mmol) was dissolved in the required amount of DMSO to have a solution of exactly 4mL volume. This mixture was charged into another 4-mL syringe. Both syringes were put to another syringe pump and connected with two T-pieces to the outlet of the first coil as well as to the inlet of the second coil. The second coil consisted of a 2-mL coil (PTFE, i.d. = 0.8 mm). The pumps were set to 4 mL/h and the entire setup ran for 28 min to reach the steady state. Afterwards, the product was collected for 20-30 min in NaHCO3 as quenching agent. Extraction was performed with CH2Cl2 (3 × 10 mL), the combined organic layers were washed with H2O thoroughly (3 × 10mL) and dried over anhyd MgSO4. After evaporating the solvent in vacuo, the diazoalcohol was purified by column chromatography (hexane-EtOAc gradient, 100% hexane to 85% hexane).",CCOC(=O)C(=[N]#N)C(O)C1=CC=CO1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CO1, second reactant: CCOC(=O)C=[N]#N, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dimethyl sulfoxide. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Glycine ethyl ester hydrochloride (1.12 g, 8 mmol) was dissolved inH2O (2.5 mL) and 5% sulfuric acid (0.76 mL, w/w) was added and a 4-mL syringe was equipped with the mixture. Next, NaNO2 (664 mg, 10 mmol) was dissolved in H2O (3.9mL) and another 4-mL syringe was equipped with this solution. The two syringes were connected to a flow setup with a T-piece mixer and a 0.9-mL coil (PTFE, i.d. = 0.5mm). 1,8-Diazabicycloundec-7-ene (596 μL, 4 mmol) was dissolved in dimethylsulfoxide (3.4 mL) and charged into a 4-mL syringe. Aldehyde (4 mmol) was dissolved in the required amount of DMSO to have a solution of exactly 4mL volume. This mixture was charged into another 4-mL syringe. Both syringes were put to another syringe pump and connected with two T-pieces to the outlet of the first coil as well as to the inlet of the second coil. The second coil consisted of a 2-mL coil (PTFE, i.d. = 0.8 mm). The pumps were set to 4 mL/h and the entire setup ran for 28 min to reach the steady state. Afterwards, the product was collected for 20-30 min in NaHCO3 as quenching agent. Extraction was performed with CH2Cl2 (3 × 10 mL), the combined organic layers were washed with H2O thoroughly (3 × 10mL) and dried over anhyd MgSO4. After evaporating the solvent in vacuo, the diazoalcohol was purified by column chromatography (hexane-EtOAc gradient, 100% hexane to 85% hexane). The SMILES answer is : CCOC(=O)C(=[N]#N)C(O)C1=CC=CO1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: 0.166667 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A total of 46 chalcones with different electron-donating and electron-withdrawing substituents (chalcones1-46, Table 1) were synthesisedby following a Claisen-Schmidt condensation reaction. All solvents and reagents were purchased from Merck and Sigma-Aldrich, MO, USA and used without further purification. Briefly, sodium hydroxide (3 eq) was added to a solution of substituted acetophenone (1.0eq) in ethanol followed by the addition of the substituted benzaldehydes (1.2 eq) after 10 minutes and stirred at room temperature overnight under nitrogen. The reaction mixture was then cooled in an ice bath and neutralisedwith 1M hydrochloric acid. The neutralised mixture was then extracted using ethyl acetate. The organic layer was washed with distilled water, dried with anhydrous sodium sulphate, concentrated and the resultant mixture was purified through a column of silica gel to obtain the pure compounds.Column chromatography was performed on silica gel (Merck, Kieselgel 60, 230-400mesh) with hexane:ethyl acetate as the mobile phase. The thin layer chromatography was performed on silica gel plates (Merck, Kieselgel 60, 0.25mm thickness) with F254 as the indicator. The plate was observed under UV light (254nm and 366nm). Melting points of the chalcones were determined using Mel-Temp II melting point instrument. NMR spectra were recorded using a Jeol ECA 400 (400MHz) and/or Lambda 400 (400MHz) spectrometers with trimethylsilane (TMS) esters as the internal standard. All chemical shifts are reported in ppm.",COC1=CC=C(C=C1OC)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: 0.166667 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; ethanol. All solvents and reagents were purchased from Merck and Sigma-Aldrich, MO, USA and used without further purification. Briefly, sodium hydroxide (3 eq) was added to a solution of substituted acetophenone (1.0eq) in ethanol followed by the addition of the substituted benzaldehydes (1.2 eq) after 10 minutes and stirred at room temperature overnight under nitrogen. The reaction mixture was then cooled in an ice bath and neutralisedwith 1M hydrochloric acid. The neutralised mixture was then extracted using ethyl acetate. The organic layer was washed with distilled water, dried with anhydrous sodium sulphate, concentrated and the resultant mixture was purified through a column of silica gel to obtain the pure compounds.Column chromatography was performed on silica gel (Merck, Kieselgel 60, 230-400mesh) with hexane:ethyl acetate as the mobile phase. The thin layer chromatography was performed on silica gel plates (Merck, Kieselgel 60, 0.25mm thickness) with F254 as the indicator. The plate was observed under UV light (254nm and 366nm). "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: BrC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(C)C=C1, Temperature: 150°C, Time: 1 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the suitable aldehyde (1.0 mmol), acetophenone (1.0 mmol) and clay catalyst(240 mg) was warmed at 150 C in a sealed tube under microwave irradiation, for 1 h. In the reactions involving solid starting materials, they were thoroughly mixed by grinding in a mortar before irradiation. The reaction mixture was diluted with hot ethanol (20 mL), the catalyst was filtered off, the solvent was evaporated and the residue was purified by crystallization (EtOH) for solid chalcones(compounds 3a-3d, 3f-3m, 3p-3ar) or by column chromatography (silica gel, ethyl acetate/hexanes) for oily chalcones (compounds 3e, 3o), to afford the pure final products. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CS1, second reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 3 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: The polymorphic chlorophenyl chalcone derivative 2AT4C was synthesized by following the Claisen-Schimidt condensation re- action method [25] . The 2-acetylthiophene, 4-chlorobenzaldehyde, and 5 ml (20% concentration) of NaOH non-aqueous solution is mixed in a methanol solvent subsequently the mixture was stirred for three hours in order to complete of the reaction. The synthe- sized crude product was further filtered. The synthesis scheme of the title compound (2AT4C) is shown in Fig. 1 . In order to se- lect a suitable solvent for single crystal growth, the extracted com- pound was examined under the solubility test in different solvents [26 , 27] . Acetone was identified as the solvent for single crystal growth because of the moderate solubility rate. The synthesized 2AT4C compound was dissolved in an acetone solution, and the non-aqueous solution was held in a dust free environment for sin- gle crystal growth by means of slow evaporation solution growth process by removing the dust particles through filtration [26 , 27] . After eight days, small nucleated crystals were observed and al- lowed for well sized crystals to develop. The harvested 2AT4C crystals ( Fig. 2 ) are further marked by both destructive and non- destructive processes.",ClC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CS2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CS1, second reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 3 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: The polymorphic chlorophenyl chalcone derivative 2AT4C was synthesized by following the Claisen-Schimidt condensation re- action method [25] . The 2-acetylthiophene, 4-chlorobenzaldehyde, and 5 ml (20% concentration) of NaOH non-aqueous solution is mixed in a methanol solvent subsequently the mixture was stirred for three hours in order to complete of the reaction. The synthe- sized crude product was further filtered. The synthesis scheme of the title compound (2AT4C) is shown in Fig. 1 . In order to se- lect a suitable solvent for single crystal growth, the extracted com- pound was examined under the solubility test in different solvents [26 , 27] . Acetone was identified as the solvent for single crystal growth because of the moderate solubility rate. The synthesized 2AT4C compound was dissolved in an acetone solution, and the non-aqueous solution was held in a dust free environment for sin- gle crystal growth by means of slow evaporation solution growth process by removing the dust particles through filtration [26 , 27] . After eight days, small nucleated crystals were observed and al- lowed for well sized crystals to develop. The harvested 2AT4C crystals ( Fig. 2 ) are further marked by both destructive and non- destructive processes. The SMILES answer is : ClC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CS2)C=C1

There after,5 mg of NaOH was added to it and was kept in microwave for 2 min. The reaction mixture was then diluted with water and acidified with conc. sulphuric acid. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CSC(=O)N1, second reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 75 - 80°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The appropriate aryl aldehyde (5mmol) and active methylene compound (malononitrile or 2,4-thiazolidinedione) (5mmol) were added to an emulsion of 10mol% SDS in 10ml water. The reaction was then allowed to proceed at 75-80C with stirring. The progress of the reaction was monitored by thin layer chromatography on silica gel using ethyl acetate:pet ether (2:8) as the solvent system. After half an hour the reaction mass was allowed to cool to room temperature and poured onto ice water. The crude productthus obtained was filtered, dried and crystallized from ethanol to obtain the pure product.All the products were known compounds, identified by matching their meltingpoints with the literature values in the references cited in Table 3. For the sake of completeness,representative spectral data are provided below, with original spectra in theSupplementary Materials.",ClC1=CC=C(C=C2SC(=O)NC2=O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CSC(=O)N1, second reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 75 - 80°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The appropriate aryl aldehyde (5mmol) and active methylene compound (malononitrile or 2,4-thiazolidinedione) (5mmol) were added to an emulsion of 10mol% SDS in 10ml water. The reaction was then allowed to proceed at 75-80C with stirring. The progress of the reaction was monitored by thin layer chromatography on silica gel using ethyl acetate:pet ether (2:8) as the solvent system. After half an hour the reaction mass was allowed to cool to room temperature and poured onto ice water. The crude productthus obtained was filtered, dried and crystallized from ethanol to obtain the pure product.All the products were known compounds, identified by matching their meltingpoints with the literature values in the references cited in Table 3. For the sake of completeness,representative spectral data are provided below, with original spectra in theSupplementary Materials. The SMILES answer is : ClC1=CC=C(C=C2SC(=O)NC2=O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)S1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Chalcones 2a-c and 3a-c were obtained by a classical Claisen-Schmidt condensation in basic ethanolic media. In a typical procedure,the corresponding aldehyde (1 mmol) and 2-acetyl-5-halothiophene(1 mmol) were suspended in EtOH (5 ml) at room temperature. To thismixture was added dropwise a 10% aq. KOH solution (2.5 ml) underconstant stirring, with an observed color change upon complete additionof base (typically orange-red). The reaction mixture was thenstirred at room temperature for 48 h, after which an intensely coloredorange/red precipitate had formed. To the suspension was added colddistilled water (ca. 5 ml) and the precipitate was filtered, washed withdistilled water (3 × 5 ml) and ice-cold MeOH (2 × 5 ml), then driedunder vacuum, affording pure compounds 2a-c. Compounds 3a-c wererecrystallized from an ethanol/CHCl3/water (3:3:1) mixture and driedunder vacuum.",CN(C)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)S2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)S1, second reactant: CN(C)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Chalcones 2a-c and 3a-c were obtained by a classical Claisen-Schmidt condensation in basic ethanolic media. In a typical procedure,the corresponding aldehyde (1 mmol) and 2-acetyl-5-halothiophene(1 mmol) were suspended in EtOH (5 ml) at room temperature. To thismixture was added dropwise a 10% aq. KOH solution (2.5 ml) underconstant stirring, with an observed color change upon complete additionof base (typically orange-red). The reaction mixture was thenstirred at room temperature for 48 h, after which an intensely coloredorange/red precipitate had formed. To the suspension was added colddistilled water (ca. 5 ml) and the precipitate was filtered, washed withdistilled water (3 × 5 ml) and ice-cold MeOH (2 × 5 ml), then driedunder vacuum, affording pure compounds 2a-c. Compounds 3a-c wererecrystallized from an ethanol/CHCl3/water (3:3:1) mixture and driedunder vacuum. The SMILES answer is : CN(C)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)S2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(O1)C=CC=C2, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 1 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dichloromethane. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Compound (2) (1 mmol) in DCM (5 mL) was treated with ZrCl4 (46.6 mg, 20 mol%) followed by addition vanillin (1 mmol). The solution stirred at room temperature under an air atmosphere for 1 hr. After the completion of the reaction monitored by TLC, the crude mixture was worked up in ice cold brine solution and then extracted with ethyl acetate solution (3×10 mL). The combined ethyl acetate extract was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and concentrated in vacuo, and the resulting product was purified by column chromatography using ethyl acetate/n-hexane as mobile phase (7:3) to afford the pure product (3) as a dark yellow solid. The product was recrystallized by methanol. m.p: 125-127 oC, Yield-70%, IR (KBr)νmax(cm-1): 1678 (C=O), 1455 (CH=CH), 1590 (C=C), 2955 (-CH); 1H NMR (DMSO-d6 400 MHz) δ ppm: 6.70-7.70 (m, 8H, Ar-Hs), 5.21 (s, 1H, OH), 3.80 (s, 3H, OCH3); 13C NMR (DMSO-d6 100 MHz) δ ppm: 177.8, 160.4, 155.2, 149.1, 147.8, 145.0, 127.8, 127.5, 124.7, 123.3, 122.9, 121.2, 120.9, 116.7, 111.9, 111.4, 56.1; MS (ESI) m/z: 294.09 (M+); Anal.calcd. for C18H14O4, C, 73.46; H, 4.79; O, 21.75; found: C, 73.44; H, 4.78; O, 21.73%.",COC1=C(O)C=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC3=C(O2)C=CC=C3)=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC2=C(O1)C=CC=C2, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC=C1O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 1 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dichloromethane. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Compound (2) (1 mmol) in DCM (5 mL) was treated with ZrCl4 (46.6 mg, 20 mol%) followed by addition vanillin (1 mmol). The solution stirred at room temperature under an air atmosphere for 1 hr. After the completion of the reaction monitored by TLC, the crude mixture was worked up in ice cold brine solution and then extracted with ethyl acetate solution (3×10 mL). The combined ethyl acetate extract was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and concentrated in vacuo, and the resulting product was purified by column chromatography using ethyl acetate/n-hexane as mobile phase (7:3) to afford the pure product (3) as a dark yellow solid. The product was recrystallized by methanol. m.p: 125-127 oC, Yield-70%, IR (KBr)νmax(cm-1): 1678 (C=O), 1455 (CH=CH), 1590 (C=C), 2955 (-CH); 1H NMR (DMSO-d6 400 MHz) δ ppm: 6.70-7.70 (m, 8H, Ar-Hs), 5.21 (s, 1H, OH), 3.80 (s, 3H, OCH3); 13C NMR (DMSO-d6 100 MHz) δ ppm: 177.8, 160.4, 155.2, 149.1, 147.8, 145.0, 127.8, 127.5, 124.7, 123.3, 122.9, 121.2, 120.9, 116.7, 111.9, 111.4, 56.1; MS (ESI) m/z: 294.09 (M+); Anal.calcd. for C18H14O4, C, 73.46; H, 4.79; O, 21.75; found: C, 73.44; H, 4.78; O, 21.73%. The SMILES answer is : COC1=C(O)C=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC3=C(O2)C=CC=C3)=C1

After completion of the reaction (monitored by TLC), the catalyst was filtered. After completion of the reaction (monitored by TLC), the catalyst was filtered. Yellowish crystals of the products were obtained by slow evaporation of an ethanol solution under room temperature. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of 4-Cl acetophenone 1.29 mL (0.01 mol) (1a) and 4-Cl benzaldehyde (2a) 1.40 g (0.01 mol) was stirred in ethanol (10-20 mL) (till both dissolve) then 30% NaOH (5 mL) was added, dropwise with vigorous stirring till the precipitation occurs. The precipitate obtained was neutralized with dilute HCl. It was filtered anddried in air and re-crystallized with the ethanol to get compound (3a). Similar procedures were also followed for the synthesis ofcompound (3b-l).",COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of 4-Cl acetophenone 1.29 mL (0.01 mol) (1a) and 4-Cl benzaldehyde (2a) 1.40 g (0.01 mol) was stirred in ethanol (10-20 mL) (till both dissolve) then 30% NaOH (5 mL) was added, dropwise with vigorous stirring till the precipitation occurs. The precipitate obtained was neutralized with dilute HCl. It was filtered anddried in air and re-crystallized with the ethanol to get compound (3a). Similar procedures were also followed for the synthesis ofcompound (3b-l). The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A 100 mL round-bottom flask was charged with a mixture of substituted aromatic aldehyde 2a-2f (5 mmol) and substituted acetophenone 1a-1c (5 mmol) in 10 mL of ethanol, SnO2 nanocatalyst was added, and the mixture was stirred at room temperature. The progress of the reaction was monitored continuously by TLC (petroleum ether-ethyl acetate; 8:2). When the initial reactants disappeared, phenylhydrazine (0.54 g, 5 mmol) was added, and the mixture was stirred until the reaction was complete (TLC). The mixture was poured into cold water and extracted with ethyl acetate (3×10 mL) in a separating funnel. The combined extracts were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated, and the residue was purified by recrystallization and column chromatography.",COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A 100 mL round-bottom flask was charged with a mixture of substituted aromatic aldehyde 2a-2f (5 mmol) and substituted acetophenone 1a-1c (5 mmol) in 10 mL of ethanol, SnO2 nanocatalyst was added, and the mixture was stirred at room temperature. The progress of the reaction was monitored continuously by TLC (petroleum ether-ethyl acetate; 8:2). When the initial reactants disappeared, phenylhydrazine (0.54 g, 5 mmol) was added, and the mixture was stirred until the reaction was complete (TLC). The mixture was poured into cold water and extracted with ethyl acetate (3×10 mL) in a separating funnel. The combined extracts were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated, and the residue was purified by recrystallization and column chromatography. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A 100 mL round-bottom flask was charged with a mixture of substituted aromatic aldehyde 2a-2f (5 mmol) and substituted acetophenone 1a-1c (5 mmol) in 10 mL of ethanol, SnO2 nanocatalyst was added, and the mixture was stirred at room temperature. The progress of the reaction was monitored continuously by TLC (petroleum ether-ethyl acetate; 8:2). When the initial reactants disappeared, phenylhydrazine (0.54 g, 5 mmol) was added, and the mixture was stirred until the reaction was complete (TLC). The mixture was poured into cold water and extracted with ethyl acetate (3×10 mL) in a separating funnel. The combined extracts were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated, and the residue was purified by recrystallization and column chromatography.",COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A 100 mL round-bottom flask was charged with a mixture of substituted aromatic aldehyde 2a-2f (5 mmol) and substituted acetophenone 1a-1c (5 mmol) in 10 mL of ethanol, SnO2 nanocatalyst was added, and the mixture was stirred at room temperature. The progress of the reaction was monitored continuously by TLC (petroleum ether-ethyl acetate; 8:2). When the initial reactants disappeared, phenylhydrazine (0.54 g, 5 mmol) was added, and the mixture was stirred until the reaction was complete (TLC). The mixture was poured into cold water and extracted with ethyl acetate (3×10 mL) in a separating funnel. The combined extracts were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated, and the residue was purified by recrystallization and column chromatography. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1

"
