"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water; methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the appropriate acetophenone (1 equiv., 6 mmol) and KOH (7.5 equiv.,45 mmol) in MeOH/H2O (2:1, 36 mL) was magnetically stirred at rt for 10 min. The resultingsolution was treated with the corresponding benzaldehyde (2.0 equiv., 6 mmol) andthen stirred 2-27 h at rt, until the total consumption of acetophenone, indicated by TLCanalysis. After completing the reaction, it was acidified to pH = 7 under an ice bath. Saturatedsodium bisulfite solution (200 mL) was added, and the mixture was stirred for 40 min.After, the mixture was diluted with EtOAc (50 mL), washed with H2O (3 × 50 mL) andbrine (1 × 50 mL), dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated under reducedpressure. The residue was purified by flash chromatography on a silica gel (EtOAc/hexane,5:95), yielding the pure product (see Supplementary Materials for NMR spectra).",BrC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water; methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the appropriate acetophenone (1 equiv., 6 mmol) and KOH (7.5 equiv.,45 mmol) in MeOH/H2O (2:1, 36 mL) was magnetically stirred at rt for 10 min. The resultingsolution was treated with the corresponding benzaldehyde (2.0 equiv., 6 mmol) andthen stirred 2-27 h at rt, until the total consumption of acetophenone, indicated by TLCanalysis. After completing the reaction, it was acidified to pH = 7 under an ice bath. Saturatedsodium bisulfite solution (200 mL) was added, and the mixture was stirred for 40 min.After, the mixture was diluted with EtOAc (50 mL), washed with H2O (3 × 50 mL) andbrine (1 × 50 mL), dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered, and concentrated under reducedpressure. The residue was purified by flash chromatography on a silica gel (EtOAc/hexane,5:95), yielding the pure product (see Supplementary Materials for NMR spectra). "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In an oven dried round bottom flask under nitrogen, substituted acetophenone (~10 mmol) is dissolved into 25 mL methanol. Next, a catalytic amount (20-30mg) of tetra-n-butylammonium bromide is added to the solution. Then, anisaldehyde (10 mmol) and potassium hydroxide (40 mmol) are added sequentially. A condenser is added onto the round bottom flask and the reaction is refluxed overnight. Following the completion of the reaction, it is then cooled to room temperature added onto 30 mL of ice- cold deionized water. The cool solution is acidified to a pH~2 with 12N HCl. If a precipitate forms, it is collected by vacuum filtration, and for those that do not have a lot of precipitate form, the organic product is extracted with 3x20 mL of diethyl ether, washed with 2x20 mL H2O, 1x20 mL brine, dried with magnesium sulfate, and concentrated.",COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In an oven dried round bottom flask under nitrogen, substituted acetophenone (~10 mmol) is dissolved into 25 mL methanol. Next, a catalytic amount (20-30mg) of tetra-n-butylammonium bromide is added to the solution. Then, anisaldehyde (10 mmol) and potassium hydroxide (40 mmol) are added sequentially. A condenser is added onto the round bottom flask and the reaction is refluxed overnight. Following the completion of the reaction, it is then cooled to room temperature added onto 30 mL of ice- cold deionized water. The cool solution is acidified to a pH~2 with 12N HCl. If a precipitate forms, it is collected by vacuum filtration, and for those that do not have a lot of precipitate form, the organic product is extracted with 3x20 mL of diethyl ether, washed with 2x20 mL H2O, 1x20 mL brine, dried with magnesium sulfate, and concentrated. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 12 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The chalcone derivatives, except for those containing the nitro groups, were synthesized by Claisen-Schmidt condensation between aldehydes and ketones in a base catalysed reaction (Scheme 1). 0.02 mol of aldehyde and 0.02 mol of ketone were added to round-bottom flask containing 40 ml of ethanol. 2.7 ml of 30% aqueous solution of NaOH was then added to the reaction mixture which was then stirred at room temperature for 12 h. The progress of the reaction was monitored by Thin Layer Chromatography. On the completion of the reaction, the contents were poured in ice cold water and the product was filtered. The solid obtained was washed with water till neutral to litmus. The crude chalcone was then dried and weighed and was recrystallized in chloroform-methanol.",COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 12 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The chalcone derivatives, except for those containing the nitro groups, were synthesized by Claisen-Schmidt condensation between aldehydes and ketones in a base catalysed reaction (Scheme 1). 0.02 mol of aldehyde and 0.02 mol of ketone were added to round-bottom flask containing 40 ml of ethanol. 2.7 ml of 30% aqueous solution of NaOH was then added to the reaction mixture which was then stirred at room temperature for 12 h. The progress of the reaction was monitored by Thin Layer Chromatography. On the completion of the reaction, the contents were poured in ice cold water and the product was filtered. The solid obtained was washed with water till neutral to litmus. The crude chalcone was then dried and weighed and was recrystallized in chloroform-methanol. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: As a therapeutic approach for type 2 diabetes, chalcones are renowned for their antidiabetic properties. To this end, 29 chalcones were designed, synthesized, and tested in-vitro for their ability to inhibit GP. An equimolar mixture of substituted acetophenone (1 mmol) and substituted benzaldehyde (1 mmol) in ethanol (20 mL) were stirred in ice bath, and then 10% of sodium hydroxide (1 mmol, 2.5 mL) was added dropwise. Stirring was continued for 30 min to 1 h. The mixture was kept for overnight in fridge; the solid substance was filtered off, and washed with ice cold water, followed by cold ethanol. The product was recrystallized from ethanol or methanol (Hannaford et al., 1978). For hydroxylated chalcones the amount of sodium hydroxide was doubled and stirring was continued for 24-48 h, the reaction mixture was quenched with 1% aqueous hydrochloric acid, the solid substance was filtered off and washed with ice cold water and purified by column chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate, 8:2). Details mentioned in supplementary information.",COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: As a therapeutic approach for type 2 diabetes, chalcones are renowned for their antidiabetic properties. To this end, 29 chalcones were designed, synthesized, and tested in-vitro for their ability to inhibit GP. An equimolar mixture of substituted acetophenone (1 mmol) and substituted benzaldehyde (1 mmol) in ethanol (20 mL) were stirred in ice bath, and then 10% of sodium hydroxide (1 mmol, 2.5 mL) was added dropwise. Stirring was continued for 30 min to 1 h. The mixture was kept for overnight in fridge; the solid substance was filtered off, and washed with ice cold water, followed by cold ethanol. The product was recrystallized from ethanol or methanol (Hannaford et al., 1978). For hydroxylated chalcones the amount of sodium hydroxide was doubled and stirring was continued for 24-48 h, the reaction mixture was quenched with 1% aqueous hydrochloric acid, the solid substance was filtered off and washed with ice cold water and purified by column chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate, 8:2). Details mentioned in supplementary information. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Br)C=C2)C=C1

This mixture was stirred at 0 C for 10 min, followed byaddition of the corresponding aldehyde (1.5 equiv.) at that temperature. The mixture was graduallywarmed up to room temperature until 5 was consumed by TLC detection. At the end of reaction time,the mixture was neutralized with 2N HCl, diluted with H2O, and extracted with CH2Cl2. The organiclayer was dried over MgSO4 and purified by flash column chromatography. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O, second reactant: O=C1CCCC1, Temperature: 80°C, Time: 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Cyclohexanone (0.115 g, 1.2 mmol), benzaldehyde (0.21g, 2 mmol) were mixed with PEG-SO3H (0.18 g, equal to 0.03 mmol of H+) and the obtained mixture was stirred magnetically at 80 C for 2 h. After completion of the reaction, warm water (5 ml) was added and the mixture stirred for 5 min. The insoluble crude product was filtered and recrystallized from EtOH. In order to recover the catalyst, H2O was evaporated under reduced pressure. The obtained solid was washed with diethyl ether (3-4 ml) and dried. The recovered PEG-SO3H was reused for another time without loss of its activity.",O=C1C(CCC1=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O)=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O, second reactant: O=C1CCCC1, Temperature: 80°C, Time: 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Cyclohexanone (0.115 g, 1.2 mmol), benzaldehyde (0.21g, 2 mmol) were mixed with PEG-SO3H (0.18 g, equal to 0.03 mmol of H+) and the obtained mixture was stirred magnetically at 80 C for 2 h. After completion of the reaction, warm water (5 ml) was added and the mixture stirred for 5 min. The insoluble crude product was filtered and recrystallized from EtOH. In order to recover the catalyst, H2O was evaporated under reduced pressure. The obtained solid was washed with diethyl ether (3-4 ml) and dried. The recovered PEG-SO3H was reused for another time without loss of its activity. The SMILES answer is : O=C1C(CCC1=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O)=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 3.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An equimolar amount of p-aminoacetophenone (13.51gm, 0.1mol) and the appropriate aldehyde 5a-d (0.1 mol), were dissolved in a minimum amount of ethanol, aqueous NaOH (0.25mol, 60%) was added dropwise. The reaction mixture was stirred in ice bath for 30min then at rt until the precipitate was formed within 3h. The precipitate was filtered off and washed thoroughly with cold distilled water and cold methanol (2×20mL). The product was recrystallized from absolute ethanol. The structure of the product was confirmed by mp. 4.1.4.1 1-(4-Aminophenyl)-3-phenyl prop-2-en-1-one (6a) [46] Buff solid (77.8% yield); mp 156-157 C (Reported mp = 157-158 C).",NC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 3.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An equimolar amount of p-aminoacetophenone (13.51gm, 0.1mol) and the appropriate aldehyde 5a-d (0.1 mol), were dissolved in a minimum amount of ethanol, aqueous NaOH (0.25mol, 60%) was added dropwise. The reaction mixture was stirred in ice bath for 30min then at rt until the precipitate was formed within 3h. The precipitate was filtered off and washed thoroughly with cold distilled water and cold methanol (2×20mL). The product was recrystallized from absolute ethanol. The structure of the product was confirmed by mp. 4.1.4.1 1-(4-Aminophenyl)-3-phenyl prop-2-en-1-one (6a) [46] Buff solid (77.8% yield); mp 156-157 C (Reported mp = 157-158 C). This mixture was stirred for 48 h at room temperature, and, after this time, a 5% HCl solution was added until pH= 7.0 to stop reaction. Finally, mixture was extracted with EtOAc (50 mL x 3) and separated. This mixture was stirred for 48 h at room temperature, and, after this time, a 5% HCl solution was added until pH= 7.0 to stop reaction. Finally, mixture was extracted with EtOAc (50 mL x 3) and separated. The organic layer was dried, concentrated and purified using column chromatography in order to obtain the corresponding chalcones. The mixture was placed in the centre of microwave oven besides a beaker with ice (50 g) and irradiated for successive periods of 10 s, 5-7 min in total, with cooling in between. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: BrC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A 50 mL round-bottomed flask was charged with the appropriate ketone (3.0 mmol), aldehyde (3.0 mmol) and 10 ml of 95% EtOH, to which a NaOH solution [3.5 mmol of NaOH in 10 mL of ethanol-water (1:1, v/v)] was added dropwise. The mixture was stirred at room temperature. In most cases, a precipitate produced after stirring for several hours. The solid was collected by filtration, washed with water and recrystallized from EtOH to get the products. In the cases that oily products were produced, the solvent of reaction mixture was removed by rotary evaporator, the residue was treated with water (20 mL) and extracted with CH2Cl2 (3×20 mL). The organic phase was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and solvent was removed by a rotary evaporator. The residue was purified by column chromatography with petroleum ether/ethyl acetate (15:1-5:1) as an eluent to give products.",BrC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: BrC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. The mixture was stirred at room temperature. In most cases, a precipitate produced after stirring for several hours. The solid was collected by filtration, washed with water and recrystallized from EtOH to get the products. In the cases that oily products were produced, the solvent of reaction mixture was removed by rotary evaporator, the residue was treated with water (20 mL) and extracted with CH2Cl2 (3×20 mL). The organic phase was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and solvent was removed by a rotary evaporator. The residue was purified by column chromatography with petroleum ether/ethyl acetate (15:1-5:1) as an eluent to give products. The SMILES answer is : BrC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1

To the stirredreaction mixture,10 ml NaOH solution (1 g in 10ml H2O)was addeddropwise while the reaction temperature was maintained between20 and 25 C. After vigorous stirring for 4 h, the reaction mixturewas neutralized by 0.2 N HCl whereby the precipitation occurred.On filtration, the solid obtained was recrystallized from aqueous ethanol to afford chalcone (3) as colorless crystals. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CSC(=O)N1, second reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 60°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: unknown. Upon completion of the reaction (monitored by TLC), the reaction mixture always solidified in the round bottomed flask. Then the solidified mixture was filtered and washed with cold water (5 mL) to remove the IL catalyst, and evaporated under reduced pressure to obtain the target products. The products of 3o, 3p, 3q, 3x, 3c’, 3d’ are colourless oil, and they were purified by column chromatography on silica gel using petroleum ether/ethyl acetate as the eluent after the solvent was removed under reduced pressure. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CSC(=O)N1, second reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 90°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The condensation of 2,4-thiazolidinedione/rhodaninediones (1 mmol), with arylaldehydes (1 mmol), in the presence of a catalytic amount of TS-1 (0.04 g) in aqueous medium at 90 C was carried out by refluxing the reaction mixture for30-60 min to obtain 5-arylidene-2,4-thiazolidinediones/Rhodaninediones derivatives, as shown in Table 2, which afforded the corresponding products in excellent yields up to 92% within 30 min. Active methylene thiazolidinedione was preparedby using a reported method [41]. The progress of the reaction was monitored by thinlayer chromatography using PET ether: ethyl acetate (8:2) as a solvent system. After completion of the reaction, the reaction mixture was filtered to recover the catalystTS-1. The filtrate was concentrated to obtain crude product, which was recrystalized from hot ethanol to obtain pure product (2a-i).",CC1=CC=C(C=C2SC(=O)NC2=O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CSC(=O)N1, second reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 90°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The condensation of 2,4-thiazolidinedione/rhodaninediones (1 mmol), with arylaldehydes (1 mmol), in the presence of a catalytic amount of TS-1 (0.04 g) in aqueous medium at 90 C was carried out by refluxing the reaction mixture for30-60 min to obtain 5-arylidene-2,4-thiazolidinediones/Rhodaninediones derivatives, as shown in Table 2, which afforded the corresponding products in excellent yields up to 92% within 30 min. Active methylene thiazolidinedione was preparedby using a reported method [41]. The progress of the reaction was monitored by thinlayer chromatography using PET ether: ethyl acetate (8:2) as a solvent system. After completion of the reaction, the reaction mixture was filtered to recover the catalystTS-1. The filtrate was concentrated to obtain crude product, which was recrystalized from hot ethanol to obtain pure product (2a-i). The SMILES answer is : CC1=CC=C(C=C2SC(=O)NC2=O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CSC(=O)N1, second reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 0.25 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of 2,4-thiazolidinedione 1 (1 mmol), corresponding arenealdehyde 2a-p (1 mmol) and 2 or 3 mmol KOH in ethanol (10 mL) were placed in a 25 mL beaker. The reaction mixture was then sonicated by an ultrasonic probe with a frequency of 24k Hz at room temperature from 10 to 30 min according to arenealdehyde. After reaction time, the solvent was evaporated, the resultant solid was neutralized with solution of HCl 1 mol/L and filtrated under reduced pressure. When necessary, the compounds were washed with a hot solution of hexane:ethyl acetate (9:1) to supply the pure products (3a, 3l, 3n and 3o).",CC1=CC=C(C=C2SC(=O)NC2=O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CSC(=O)N1, second reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 0.25 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of 2,4-thiazolidinedione 1 (1 mmol), corresponding arenealdehyde 2a-p (1 mmol) and 2 or 3 mmol KOH in ethanol (10 mL) were placed in a 25 mL beaker. The reaction mixture was then sonicated by an ultrasonic probe with a frequency of 24k Hz at room temperature from 10 to 30 min according to arenealdehyde. After reaction time, the solvent was evaporated, the resultant solid was neutralized with solution of HCl 1 mol/L and filtrated under reduced pressure. When necessary, the compounds were washed with a hot solution of hexane:ethyl acetate (9:1) to supply the pure products (3a, 3l, 3n and 3o). The SMILES answer is : CC1=CC=C(C=C2SC(=O)NC2=O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CSC(=O)N1, second reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: 2,4-Dioxothiazolidine acid derivatives were prepared in three steps following the reportedmethod [35,40]. A solution of previously prepared TZD 1 was treated with various appropriatealdehydes via refluxing in ethanol for 24 h in the presence of piperidine as a catalyst. The reactionmixture was poured into water, followed by acidification with acetic acid to aord compounds 2a-g.Then a mixture of 2a-g (1 mmol) and ethyl 2-bromoacetate (2 mmol) was refluxed for 24 h in acetonein the presence of potassium carbonate (2 mmol) to furnish the target product as a white solid afterevaporation of the solvent. The crude product was used directly in the next step for the preparation ofthe free carboxylic acid derivatives 3a-g, where the solid product was refluxed with glacial acetic acidand HCl at a ratio of 4:1 for 2 h to aord the pure (2,4-dioxothiazolidine-3-yl)-acetic acid derivatives3a-g after evaporation of the solvents and crystallization with ethanol. The spectral data for 3a,3f, and 3g are in good agreement with previously reported ones [7,13,15] and other spectra in theSupplementary Materials.",CC1=CC=C(C=C2SC(=O)NC2=O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=C1CSC(=O)N1, second reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: 2,4-Dioxothiazolidine acid derivatives were prepared in three steps following the reportedmethod [35,40]. A solution of previously prepared TZD 1 was treated with various appropriatealdehydes via refluxing in ethanol for 24 h in the presence of piperidine as a catalyst. The reactionmixture was poured into water, followed by acidification with acetic acid to aord compounds 2a-g.Then a mixture of 2a-g (1 mmol) and ethyl 2-bromoacetate (2 mmol) was refluxed for 24 h in acetonein the presence of potassium carbonate (2 mmol) to furnish the target product as a white solid afterevaporation of the solvent. The crude product was used directly in the next step for the preparation ofthe free carboxylic acid derivatives 3a-g, where the solid product was refluxed with glacial acetic acidand HCl at a ratio of 4:1 for 2 h to aord the pure (2,4-dioxothiazolidine-3-yl)-acetic acid derivatives3a-g after evaporation of the solvents and crystallization with ethanol. The spectral data for 3a,3f, and 3g are in good agreement with previously reported ones [7,13,15] and other spectra in theSupplementary Materials. The SMILES answer is : CC1=CC=C(C=C2SC(=O)NC2=O)C=C1

Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Dean-Stark apparatus was attached to a 3-necked roundbottom flask in which p-methylbenzaldehyde 8 (0.188 mol)and 2, 4-thiazolidinedione 3 (0.188 mol) were taken in equalmoles and suspended in dry toluene. A catalytic amount ofpiperidine (1ml) was added and the mixture was refluxedwith stirring. After complete removal of water, the reactionmixture was stirred for a further 1 hr. A catalytic amount ofpiperidine (1ml) was added and the mixture was refluxedwith stirring. After complete removal of water, the reactionmixture was stirred for a further 1 hr. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CN1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Pyrrole-2-carboxaldehyde (1.0 equiv.) and ketone (1.1 equiv.) were dissolved in EtOH (0.1M)and NaOH 10% w/v (2.5 equiv.) was added dropwise in an ice bath. Was then left at room temperatureand monitored through TLC until the reaction was completed. The precipitate was filtered, washedwith 20 ml cold ethanol and dried under vacuum to obtain the 1H-pyrrol-enones.Next, potassium tert-butoxide was added to a solution of 1H-pyrrol-enones (1equiv.) inacetonitrile (0.1 M) and stirred for 5 minutes. Then, benzyl bromide or 2-fluorobenzyl bromide (1.2equiv.) was added dropwise and reacted at room temperature until reaction complete by TLC. Water(10 mL) and ethyl acetate (5 mL) were added and the layers were separated. The aqueous phase wasextracted twice with 5 mL of ethyl acetate. The combined organic phases were washed with water(3*5 mL), dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated under vacuum. Finally, purification by flash columnchromatography Hexane:EtOAc 8:2 (v/v) gave the compounds 4a-g.",O=C(\C=C\C1=CC=CN1)C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CN1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Was then left at room temperatureand monitored through TLC until the reaction was completed. The precipitate was filtered, washedwith 20 ml cold ethanol and dried under vacuum to obtain the 1H-pyrrol-enones.Next, potassium tert-butoxide was added to a solution of 1H-pyrrol-enones (1equiv.) inacetonitrile (0.1 M) and stirred for 5 minutes. Then, benzyl bromide or 2-fluorobenzyl bromide (1.2equiv.) was added dropwise and reacted at room temperature until reaction complete by TLC. Water(10 mL) and ethyl acetate (5 mL) were added and the layers were separated. The aqueous phase wasextracted twice with 5 mL of ethyl acetate. The combined organic phases were washed with water(3*5 mL), dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated under vacuum. Finally, purification by flash columnchromatography Hexane:EtOAc 8:2 (v/v) gave the compounds 4a-g. The SMILES answer is : O=C(\C=C\C1=CC=CN1)C1=CC=CC=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=CS1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 0.333333 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In a 50 mL borosil beaker, 4-chloroacetophenone (1) (0.5 mmol) and a suitable aldehyde (2a-2k) (0.5 mmol) were mixed in ethanol (10 mL) and 40% of KOH cold solution was added dropwise to the reaction mixture with vigorous stirring until the solution became turbid. The ultrasound probe was immersed directly into the reaction mixture. The ultrasound probe emits a sonic vibration into the reaction mixture for the period indicated in Table 1. Sonication was achieved at frequencies of 20 kHz (amplitude of 50%). The reaction was carried out at room temperature. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: For a typical synthesis, 0.3g of activated resin, 10 mmolof aryl-benzaldehyde, 10 mmol of methyl aryl-ketone and 10mL of ethanol were charged in a 25 mL glass reactor.The ultrasound probe was immersed directly in the reactor.An ultrasonic generator (Bioblock Scientific 750 W)emitted the sound vibration into the reaction mixture. Sonificationwas achieved at low frequencies of 20 kHz (amplitudeof 30%) and the addition or removal of water was used tocontrol the water bath temperature at room temperature (25-30C). The reaction time was fixed at 2h. Afterwards, dichloromethane(10 mL) was incorporated, the reaction mixturewas filtered, and the catalyst was washed with hot ethanol(20mL). The filtrate was dried with Na2SO4 and thenconcentrated. The dried crude products crystallized fromabsolute ethanol, except for nitro-chalcone, which crystallizedfrom acetone, filtrated and finally dried under vacuumfor 48h.",O=C(\C=C\C1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O)C1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O, Temperature: 25 - 30°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Sonificationwas achieved at low frequencies of 20 kHz (amplitudeof 30%) and the addition or removal of water was used tocontrol the water bath temperature at room temperature (25-30C). The reaction time was fixed at 2h. Afterwards, dichloromethane(10 mL) was incorporated, the reaction mixturewas filtered, and the catalyst was washed with hot ethanol(20mL). The filtrate was dried with Na2SO4 and thenconcentrated. The dried crude products crystallized fromabsolute ethanol, except for nitro-chalcone, which crystallizedfrom acetone, filtrated and finally dried under vacuumfor 48h. The reaction progress was monitored by TLC and after 20 h, the solid was filtered off under vaccum and successivelly washed with a cold mixture of methanol and water (1:1,10 × 5 mL). The solid was dried at room temperature and recrystallizedwhen necessary, as specified for each compound. Chalcone 11 was purified by flash chromatography. The SMILES answer is : NC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 60°C, Time: 1 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: For a typical synthesis, 0.4 g of resin, 0.02 mol of aryl-benzaldehyde and 0.02 mol of methyl aryl-ketone were charged in a 10 mL glass reactor. The reaction mixture was heated in an oil bath at 60 ± 2 C. The ultrasound probe was immersed directly in the reactor. An ultrasonic generator (Bioblock Scientific 750 W) emits the sound vibration into the reaction mixture. Sonification was achieved at low frequencies of 20 kHz (amplitude of 30%). The reaction time was fixed at 1 h. After cooling to room temperature, dichloromethane (50 mL) was added, the reaction mixture was filtered, and the catalyst washed with hot ethanol (50 mL). Solvent was then evaporated and the dried crude products were crystallized from 95% ethanol, except for nitro-chalcones, which were crystallized from acetone, filtrated and finally dried under vacuum for 48 h. The melting points of the isolated products were measured on a Reichert-Heizbank apparatus. The yields of the reactions were determined by gas chromatography on a Shimadzu 2014-GC apparatus using chloroform as solvent. The capillary column was DB-5 and the carrier gas was nitrogen.",COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Cl)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 60°C, Time: 1 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: For a typical synthesis, 0.4 g of resin, 0.02 mol of aryl-benzaldehyde and 0.02 mol of methyl aryl-ketone were charged in a 10 mL glass reactor. The reaction mixture was heated in an oil bath at 60 ± 2 C. The ultrasound probe was immersed directly in the reactor. An ultrasonic generator (Bioblock Scientific 750 W) emits the sound vibration into the reaction mixture. Sonification was achieved at low frequencies of 20 kHz (amplitude of 30%). The reaction time was fixed at 1 h. After cooling to room temperature, dichloromethane (50 mL) was added, the reaction mixture was filtered, and the catalyst washed with hot ethanol (50 mL). Solvent was then evaporated and the dried crude products were crystallized from 95% ethanol, except for nitro-chalcones, which were crystallized from acetone, filtrated and finally dried under vacuum for 48 h. The melting points of the isolated products were measured on a Reichert-Heizbank apparatus. The yields of the reactions were determined by gas chromatography on a Shimadzu 2014-GC apparatus using chloroform as solvent. The capillary column was DB-5 and the carrier gas was nitrogen. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Cl)C=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 12 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The chalcone derivatives, except for those containing the nitro groups, were synthesized by Claisen-Schmidt condensation between aldehydes and ketones in a base catalysed reaction (Scheme 1). 0.02 mol of aldehyde and 0.02 mol of ketone were added to round-bottom flask containing 40 ml of ethanol. 2.7 ml of 30% aqueous solution of NaOH was then added to the reaction mixture which was then stirred at room temperature for 12 h. The solid obtained was washed with water till neutral to litmus. The progress of the reaction was monitored by Thin Layer Chromatography. On the completion of the reaction, the contents were poured in ice cold water and the product was filtered. The solid obtained was washed with water till neutral to litmus. The crude chalcone was then dried and weighed and was recrystallized in chloroform-methanol. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: As a therapeutic approach for type 2 diabetes, chalcones are renowned for their antidiabetic properties. To this end, 29 chalcones were designed, synthesized, and tested in-vitro for their ability to inhibit GP. An equimolar mixture of substituted acetophenone (1 mmol) and substituted benzaldehyde (1 mmol) in ethanol (20 mL) were stirred in ice bath, and then 10% of sodium hydroxide (1 mmol, 2.5 mL) was added dropwise. Stirring was continued for 30 min to 1 h. The mixture was kept for overnight in fridge; the solid substance was filtered off, and washed with ice cold water, followed by cold ethanol. The product was recrystallized from ethanol or methanol (Hannaford et al., 1978). For hydroxylated chalcones the amount of sodium hydroxide was doubled and stirring was continued for 24-48 h, the reaction mixture was quenched with 1% aqueous hydrochloric acid, the solid substance was filtered off and washed with ice cold water and purified by column chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate, 8:2). "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC(O[Si](C)(C)C)=C(C)C, second reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 99.84°C, Time: 6 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The catalytic reaction was performed in liquid-phase using a two-necked continuously stirred round bottom flask, equipped with a water condenser. The catalyst was preactivated at 393 K in a vacuum oven and the reactions were carried out under N2 atmosphere. In a typical procedure, the methyl trimethylsilyl dimethylketene acetal (10 mmol) was added to a pre-activated catalyst (0.1 g), followed by addition of p-NO2-benzaldehyde (10 mmol) to reaction vessel. The reaction mixture was stirred at 373 K for a period of 6 h. The progress of the reaction was monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC). After completion of the reaction, the catalyst was filtered out and the filtrate was diluted with DCM and then washed with 1 N HCl and finally washed with water. The organic layer was separated and dried with anhydrous Na2SO4. The solvent was removed by rotary evaporator and the product was purified through column chromatography using silica gel (100-200 mesh) as a stationary phase and petroleum ether + ethyl acetate (4:1) as eluent. The final products were identified with the help of 1H and 13C NMR and compared with literature data (Scheme 1) (see Supporting information).",COC(=O)C(C)(C)C(O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC(O[Si](C)(C)C)=C(C)C, second reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 99.84°C, Time: 6 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The catalytic reaction was performed in liquid-phase using a two-necked continuously stirred round bottom flask, equipped with a water condenser. The catalyst was preactivated at 393 K in a vacuum oven and the reactions were carried out under N2 atmosphere. In a typical procedure, the methyl trimethylsilyl dimethylketene acetal (10 mmol) was added to a pre-activated catalyst (0.1 g), followed by addition of p-NO2-benzaldehyde (10 mmol) to reaction vessel. The reaction mixture was stirred at 373 K for a period of 6 h. The progress of the reaction was monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC). After completion of the reaction, the catalyst was filtered out and the filtrate was diluted with DCM and then washed with 1 N HCl and finally washed with water. The organic layer was separated and dried with anhydrous Na2SO4. The solvent was removed by rotary evaporator and the product was purified through column chromatography using silica gel (100-200 mesh) as a stationary phase and petroleum ether + ethyl acetate (4:1) as eluent. The final products were identified with the help of 1H and 13C NMR and compared with literature data (Scheme 1) (see Supporting information). The SMILES answer is : COC(=O)C(C)(C)C(O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1

An ultrasonic generator (Bioblock Scientific 750 W) emits the sound vibration into the reaction mixture. Sonification was achieved at low frequencies of 20 kHz (amplitude of 30%). The reaction time was fixed at 1 h. After cooling to room temperature, dichloromethane (50 mL) was added, the reaction mixture was filtered, and the catalyst washed with hot ethanol (50 mL). Solvent was then evaporated and the dried crude products were crystallized from 95% ethanol, except for nitro-chalcones, which were crystallized from acetone, filtrated and finally dried under vacuum for 48 h. The melting points of the isolated products were measured on a Reichert-Heizbank apparatus. The yields of the reactions were determined by gas chromatography on a Shimadzu 2014-GC apparatus using chloroform as solvent. The capillary column was DB-5 and the carrier gas was nitrogen. The SMILES answer is : ClC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(Cl)C=C2)C=C1

"

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: C=O, second reactant: OC1=COC(COC2CCCCO2)=CC1=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: lithium hydroxide monohydrate. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: The aldol reaction of 5-hydroxy-2-[(tetrahydropyranyloxy)methyl]-4-pyrone (2) [14] with a formaldehyde was carried out referring to Farard's method [4]. Briefly, sodium hydroxide (550mg, 13.8mmol) was dissolved with distilled water (20mL). To the just prepared sodium hydroxide solution was added compound 2 (3.00g, 13.3mmol). The pH value of the solution thus obtained was adjusted to 10.5 using 1M NaOH and 1M HCl. A solution of 37% formaldehyde (1.1mL, 1.1 equiv) was then added slowly to the reaction solution, and the mixture thus obtained was stirred overnight at room temperature. The resulting mixture was neutralized with 1M HCl and then extracted with CH2Cl2. The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated under reduced pressure. To the organic layer was then added n-hexane, which prompted the precipitation of a crystalline solid, which was recrystallized from an EtOAc-n-hexane to afford 3 (1.97g, 58%) as a colorless solid; mp 71C; IR (KBr) 3383, 3251, 1658, 1620, 1584, 1231, 1143cm-1; 1H NMR (300MHz, CDCl3); δ 6.55 (s, 1H), 4.74 (t, J=3.4Hz, 1H), 4.71 (s, 2H), 4.57 (dd, J=0.57, 14.7Hz, 1H), 4.39 (d, J=0.57, 14.7Hz, 1H), 3.77-3.89 (m, 1H), 3.51-3.61 (m, 1H), 1.47-1.95 (m, 6H); HRMS (ESI) calcd for C12H16O6Na, [M+Na]+ 279.0845; found, 279.0852.",OCC1=C(O)C(=O)C=C(COC2CCCCO2)O1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: C=O, second reactant: OC1=COC(COC2CCCCO2)=CC1=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: lithium hydroxide monohydrate. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: The aldol reaction of 5-hydroxy-2-[(tetrahydropyranyloxy)methyl]-4-pyrone (2) [14] with a formaldehyde was carried out referring to Farard's method [4]. Briefly, sodium hydroxide (550mg, 13.8mmol) was dissolved with distilled water (20mL). To the just prepared sodium hydroxide solution was added compound 2 (3.00g, 13.3mmol). The pH value of the solution thus obtained was adjusted to 10.5 using 1M NaOH and 1M HCl. A solution of 37% formaldehyde (1.1mL, 1.1 equiv) was then added slowly to the reaction solution, and the mixture thus obtained was stirred overnight at room temperature. The resulting mixture was neutralized with 1M HCl and then extracted with CH2Cl2. The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated under reduced pressure. To the organic layer was then added n-hexane, which prompted the precipitation of a crystalline solid, which was recrystallized from an EtOAc-n-hexane to afford 3 (1.97g, 58%) as a colorless solid; mp 71C; IR (KBr) 3383, 3251, 1658, 1620, 1584, 1231, 1143cm-1; 1H NMR (300MHz, CDCl3); δ 6.55 (s, 1H), 4.74 (t, J=3.4Hz, 1H), 4.71 (s, 2H), 4.57 (dd, J=0.57, 14.7Hz, 1H), 4.39 (d, J=0.57, 14.7Hz, 1H), 3.77-3.89 (m, 1H), 3.51-3.61 (m, 1H), 1.47-1.95 (m, 6H); HRMS (ESI) calcd for C12H16O6Na, [M+Na]+ 279.0845; found, 279.0852. The SMILES answer is : OCC1=C(O)C(=O)C=C(COC2CCCCO2)O1

Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A continuous flow reactor set-up contains two pumps, a micromixer (T-shaped tee, OD 1/163) and stainless steel tubularreactor. The oil bath was used to control reaction temperature.The reaction mixture was heated to 100 C in the stainlesssteel tubular flow reactor and in a short stainless steel tubularreactor cooled to 25-30 C, 0-5.2 bar sustainable range ofpressures adjustable back pressure regulator (BPR) was placedat the outlet of the tubular reactor. The flow reaction set up isshown in Fig. 1.A solution of thioxothiazolidine acetic acid (3) (1.0 g,5.23 mmol), piperidine (0.44 g, 5.23 mmol) mixture in DMF(5 mL), (0.5 mL min-1, flow rate) and a solution of aldehydederivative (2) (1.0 eq, 5.23 mmol) in DMF (5 mL) (0.5 mLmin-1, flow rate) were sent into the micro mixer by a HPLCpump (PA, PB). "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(N)C=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Reagents and solvents were purchased from Merck. Series of 17 chalcones was synthesized by Claisen-Schmidt aldol condensation, according to protocol reported by Santos and coauthors with minor modifications [15]. Reactions were carried out at room temperature using 5.0mmol of respective benzaldehyde derivatives and 5.0mmol of respective aminoacetophenones, which were dissolved in ethanol (50mL). Sodium hydroxide in ethanol (1mol L-1) was added as catalyst solution. Reagents conversion was monitored by thin layer chromatography. Crude products were poured onto ice from distilled and deionized water and filtered. All compounds were purified over silica gel chromatography column eluted with mixtures of hexane and ethyl acetate. Melting point of chalcones was measured on open capillaries on Melt Temperature apparatus MS Tecnopon PFM-II. UV-Vis spectra and chromatograms were obtained in High Performance Liquid Chromatography with Diode Array Detector (HPLC-DAD) Agilent Technologies 1220 Infinity equipment, photodiode array system (Agilent Technologies Model 1260 Infinity) and Agilent Zorbax Eclipse Plus C-18 column (250mm×4.6mm, 5µL) using methanol:water (3:1) as mobile phase (1.0mL/min). NMR spectra were obtained in two spectrometers: Bruker Avance III (600MHz) and Bruker Avance III (400MHz), using deuterated dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO- d6) as internal reference. After completion of the reaction (TLC), the reaction mixturewas diluted with water, filtered and the collected precipitate was collected byfiltration and dried under reduced vacuum before purification of the obtainedcrude products using column chromatography (silica gel,hexanes/ethyl acetate =1.5:1). The reaction mixture was cooled on an ice bath and neutralized with dilute hydrochloric acid. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(F)C=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: As a therapeutic approach for type 2 diabetes, chalcones are renowned for their antidiabetic properties. To this end, 29 chalcones were designed, synthesized, and tested in-vitro for their ability to inhibit GP. An equimolar mixture of substituted acetophenone (1 mmol) and substituted benzaldehyde (1 mmol) in ethanol (20 mL) were stirred in ice bath, and then 10% of sodium hydroxide (1 mmol, 2.5 mL) was added dropwise. Stirring was continued for 30 min to 1 h. The mixture was kept for overnight in fridge; the solid substance was filtered off, and washed with ice cold water, followed by cold ethanol. The product was recrystallized from ethanol or methanol (Hannaford et al., 1978). For hydroxylated chalcones the amount of sodium hydroxide was doubled and stirring was continued for 24-48 h, the reaction mixture was quenched with 1% aqueous hydrochloric acid, the solid substance was filtered off and washed with ice cold water and purified by column chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate, 8:2). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: As a therapeutic approach for type 2 diabetes, chalcones are renowned for their antidiabetic properties. To this end, 29 chalcones were designed, synthesized, and tested in-vitro for their ability to inhibit GP. An equimolar mixture of substituted acetophenone (1 mmol) and substituted benzaldehyde (1 mmol) in ethanol (20 mL) were stirred in ice bath, and then 10% of sodium hydroxide (1 mmol, 2.5 mL) was added dropwise. Stirring was continued for 30 min to 1 h. The mixture was kept for overnight in fridge; the solid substance was filtered off, and washed with ice cold water, followed by cold ethanol. The product was recrystallized from ethanol or methanol (Hannaford et al., 1978). For hydroxylated chalcones the amount of sodium hydroxide was doubled and stirring was continued for 24-48 h, the reaction mixture was quenched with 1% aqueous hydrochloric acid, the solid substance was filtered off and washed with ice cold water and purified by column chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate, 8:2). "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 25°C, Time: 72 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: tetrahydrofuran; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Aldehyde (3 mmol), ketone (3 mmol) was dissolved in THF (22.5 mL) and water (22.5 mL), KOH(1.5 mmol) was added and the mixture was stirred at 25 C for 72 h. Then percarbonate (1.5 mmol) and catalyst (20 mol %) were added, the reaction mixture was stirred at 0 C until the enone disappeared (detected by TLC). The catalyst was recovered by rapid filtration and washed with ethyl acetate. The combined organic fractions were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and were then evaporated in vacuo and purified by silica gel column chromatography (AcOEt/petroleum 1:10-1:30) to afford the corresponding epoxide.",BrC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 25°C, Time: 72 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: tetrahydrofuran; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Aldehyde (3 mmol), ketone (3 mmol) was dissolved in THF (22.5 mL) and water (22.5 mL), KOH(1.5 mmol) was added and the mixture was stirred at 25 C for 72 h. Then percarbonate (1.5 mmol) and catalyst (20 mol %) were added, the reaction mixture was stirred at 0 C until the enone disappeared (detected by TLC). The catalyst was recovered by rapid filtration and washed with ethyl acetate. The combined organic fractions were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and were then evaporated in vacuo and purified by silica gel column chromatography (AcOEt/petroleum 1:10-1:30) to afford the corresponding epoxide. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Compound 1a and 1b were synthesized according to the previouslyreported literature. [31] To a 100 mL round-bottom flask was slowlyadded aqueous NaOH solution (0.44 g, 11 mmol, 9 mL water) to 4-bromo-acetophenone (2 g, 10 mmol) in ethanol (45 mL) under ice-coldconditions. Benzaldehyde (1.27 g, 12 mmol) was added afterwards.After stirring for 12 h at room temperature, the precipitated solid wasfiltered and rinsed with ethanol and water, affording 1a as an off-whitesolid (4.19 g, 73 % yield). The product was used without further purification.Compound 1b (2.04g, 58 % yield) was also obtained accordingto the above procedure.",BrC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Br)C=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Compound 1a and 1b were synthesized according to the previouslyreported literature. [31] To a 100 mL round-bottom flask was slowlyadded aqueous NaOH solution (0.44 g, 11 mmol, 9 mL water) to 4-bromo-acetophenone (2 g, 10 mmol) in ethanol (45 mL) under ice-coldconditions. Benzaldehyde (1.27 g, 12 mmol) was added afterwards.After stirring for 12 h at room temperature, the precipitated solid wasfiltered and rinsed with ethanol and water, affording 1a as an off-whitesolid (4.19 g, 73 % yield). The product was used without further purification.Compound 1b (2.04g, 58 % yield) was also obtained accordingto the above procedure. The SMILES answer is : BrC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=CC=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 15 - 20°C, Time: 4 - 5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In a round bottom flask, 2.2 g of sodium hydroxide was added in water & methanol. The flask was immersed in a bath of crushed ice & kept on mechanical stirrer. The stirrer was started, freshly distilled acetophenone (0.43 mol) & pure benzaldehyde (0.43 mol) was added in the flask. The mixture was stirred for 4-5 h at 15-200C. The thick mixture was removed & kept in a refrigerator for overnight. The product was filtered & washed with cold water until the washings were neutral to litmus. Further the product was washed with ice cold rectified spirit, dried & recrystallized from rectified spirit to afford the desired product.",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 15 - 20°C, Time: 4 - 5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In a round bottom flask, 2.2 g of sodium hydroxide was added in water & methanol. The flask was immersed in a bath of crushed ice & kept on mechanical stirrer. The stirrer was started, freshly distilled acetophenone (0.43 mol) & pure benzaldehyde (0.43 mol) was added in the flask. The mixture was stirred for 4-5 h at 15-200C. The thick mixture was removed & kept in a refrigerator for overnight. The product was filtered & washed with cold water until the washings were neutral to litmus. Further the product was washed with ice cold rectified spirit, dried & recrystallized from rectified spirit to afford the desired product. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the corresponding acetophenone (1 equiv) and benzaldehyde (1 equiv) in EtOH (5 mL/1 mmol of acetophenone) was stirred at room temperature for 30 min. Then, a solution of 50% w/w aqueous KOH (1 mL/1 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at rt until all benzaldehyde was consumed when monitored on TLC. Afterwards, the mixture was poured in toice-water acidified with 3 N HCl. In cases in which the chalcones precipitated, they were filtered, purified using column chromatography, and crystallised from ethanol (yields: 65%-90%).",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the corresponding acetophenone (1 equiv) and benzaldehyde (1 equiv) in EtOH (5 mL/1 mmol of acetophenone) was stirred at room temperature for 30 min. Then, a solution of 50% w/w aqueous KOH (1 mL/1 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at rt until all benzaldehyde was consumed when monitored on TLC. Afterwards, the mixture was poured in toice-water acidified with 3 N HCl. In cases in which the chalcones precipitated, they were filtered, purified using column chromatography, and crystallised from ethanol (yields: 65%-90%). The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 55°C, Time: 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a mixture of water (7 mL) and sodium hydroxide flakes (3.0 mmol) solution, add 2-hydroxy acetophenone (1.0 mmol) at room temperature (RT). To this reaction, mixtures add benzaldehyde (1.3 mmol) and stir for 15 min. The whole reaction mixture was stirred for 4 hrs at 55 C temperature. After completion of the reaction monitored by TLC, the product cooled to 15 C. Later, adjust the pH to below 1.0 by adding HCl (3 mL) at below 15 C and continued stirring for 2 hrs at the same temperature. Filtered the reaction mass and washed with water (10 mL) followed by methanol (3 mL), obtained crude product was purified in methanol to get the pure compound.",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 55°C, Time: 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a mixture of water (7 mL) and sodium hydroxide flakes (3.0 mmol) solution, add 2-hydroxy acetophenone (1.0 mmol) at room temperature (RT). To this reaction, mixtures add benzaldehyde (1.3 mmol) and stir for 15 min. The whole reaction mixture was stirred for 4 hrs at 55 C temperature. After completion of the reaction monitored by TLC, the product cooled to 15 C. Later, adjust the pH to below 1.0 by adding HCl (3 mL) at below 15 C and continued stirring for 2 hrs at the same temperature. Filtered the reaction mass and washed with water (10 mL) followed by methanol (3 mL), obtained crude product was purified in methanol to get the pure compound. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: 0.5; 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water; methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of o-hydroxyacetophenone (1.2mL, 10.0mmol) inaqueous 30% sodium hydroxide solution was stirred in methanol(20.0mL) for 30 min at ambient temperature followed bythe addition of substituted benzaldehyde (10.0mmol). Thisreaction mixture was allowed to stir for further 4.0 h at the sametemperature. The progress of the reaction was monitored bycomparative TLC. After the completion of the reaction (checkedby TLC), 20-Hydroxychalcone, formed in situ, was further oxidativelycyclized by adding 1.5mL of 35% H2O2 to the same reactionmixture which was then allowed to stir for additional 1.0 h.Afterward, 10% aqueous HCl was added to the reaction mixturein order to neutralize it, and as a result flavonols (3-hydroxyflavones)were precipitated out. These precipitates were then filtered,washed with water and subsequently with cold ethanol.Residue obtained was collected, dried, and finally recrystallizedby ethanol (Mughal et al., 2019).",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: 0.5; 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water; methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of o-hydroxyacetophenone (1.2mL, 10.0mmol) inaqueous 30% sodium hydroxide solution was stirred in methanol(20.0mL) for 30 min at ambient temperature followed bythe addition of substituted benzaldehyde (10.0mmol). Thisreaction mixture was allowed to stir for further 4.0 h at the sametemperature. The progress of the reaction was monitored bycomparative TLC. After the completion of the reaction (checkedby TLC), 20-Hydroxychalcone, formed in situ, was further oxidativelycyclized by adding 1.5mL of 35% H2O2 to the same reactionmixture which was then allowed to stir for additional 1.0 h.Afterward, 10% aqueous HCl was added to the reaction mixturein order to neutralize it, and as a result flavonols (3-hydroxyflavones)were precipitated out. These precipitates were then filtered,washed with water and subsequently with cold ethanol.Residue obtained was collected, dried, and finally recrystallizedby ethanol (Mughal et al., 2019). The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1

"

Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A hot solution of sodium hydroxide was added to a mixture of o-hydroxyacetophenone and substituted benzaldehyde in ethanol. The mixture was stirred at room temperature for 6-8 hours. The sodium salt of the chalcone was obtained as dark yellow thick mass. It was cooled in ice and neutralized with aqueous acetic acid (50%). The yellow solid separated was filtered and washed with water before drying. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A hot solution of sodium hydroxide was added to a mixture of o-hydroxyacetophenone and substituted benzaldehyde in ethanol. The mixture was stirred at room temperature for 6-8 hours. The sodium salt of the chalcone was obtained as dark yellow thick mass. It was cooled in ice and neutralized with aqueous acetic acid (50%). The yellow solid separated was filtered and washed with water before drying. Crystallization from ethanol yielded yellow needles. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In step-1, a mixture of substituted 20-hydroxyacetophenone(1.0 mmol) and aqueous sodium NaOH solution (30%, 5.0 mL)was dissolved in distilled MeOH (20.0 mL) and stirred for30 minutes at ambient temperature followed by the dropwiseaddition of substituted aromatic aldehyde (1.0 mmol).Consequently, the reaction mixture was stirred at the sametemperature for 3-4 hours. The progress of the substitutedchalcone formation was monitored by TLC using n-hexane:ethyl acetate (3:1) as a mobile-phase. After the reaction completion(checked by TLC), the mixture was then acidified bydil. HCl (10%) and poured onto the cold water. The separatedsolid was filtered, washed with water and dried productwas recrystallized from ethanol to obtain the purifiedcompounds 1-25.In step-II, to a solution of substituted chalcone 1-25(1.0 mmol) in pyridine (10 mL) was added mercuric acetate(Hg(OAc)2) (1.0 mmol) at room temperature and the reactionmixture was heated under reflux for 2-3 hours. The reactionprogress was monitored by TLC using n-hexane: ethyl acetate(3:1) as a mobile phase. After the reaction completionindicated by TLC, the cooled reaction mixture was pouredonto ice water (30 mL) and acidified with dilute HCl. to allowprecipitation. The precipitates obtained were filtered, washedwith cold water, and dried product was further recrystallizedfrom ethanol to obtain the purified aurone product 26-50.",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In step-1, a mixture of substituted 20-hydroxyacetophenone(1.0 mmol) and aqueous sodium NaOH solution (30%, 5.0 mL)was dissolved in distilled MeOH (20.0 mL) and stirred for30 minutes at ambient temperature followed by the dropwiseaddition of substituted aromatic aldehyde (1.0 mmol).Consequently, the reaction mixture was stirred at the sametemperature for 3-4 hours. The progress of the substitutedchalcone formation was monitored by TLC using n-hexane:ethyl acetate (3:1) as a mobile-phase. After the reaction completion(checked by TLC), the mixture was then acidified bydil. HCl (10%) and poured onto the cold water. The separatedsolid was filtered, washed with water and dried productwas recrystallized from ethanol to obtain the purifiedcompounds 1-25.In step-II, to a solution of substituted chalcone 1-25(1.0 mmol) in pyridine (10 mL) was added mercuric acetate(Hg(OAc)2) (1.0 mmol) at room temperature and the reactionmixture was heated under reflux for 2-3 hours. The reactionprogress was monitored by TLC using n-hexane: ethyl acetate(3:1) as a mobile phase. After the reaction completionindicated by TLC, the cooled reaction mixture was pouredonto ice water (30 mL) and acidified with dilute HCl. to allowprecipitation. The precipitates obtained were filtered, washedwith cold water, and dried product was further recrystallizedfrom ethanol to obtain the purified aurone product 26-50. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 0 - 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a reaction tube equipped with a magnetic stir bar wereadded substituted O-hydroxyacetophenones 1 (5.0 mmol),aldehydes 2 (5.0 mmol), and methanol (20 mL). The reactionmixture was cooled to 0 C and 30% NaOH aqueous solution(5.0 g, in 10 mL H2O)was added. After stirring at roomtemperature for 4 h, the reaction mixture was poured into icecold water and was subsequently neutralized with dropwiseaddition of Conc. HCl. The resulted solid was collected byfiltration, washed with petroleum ether (1.5 mL × 2), anddried to give chalcone intermediates 3. The characterization data have been attached to the supplementary material, forknown compounds, references with full characterization datahave been provided.",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 0 - 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a reaction tube equipped with a magnetic stir bar wereadded substituted O-hydroxyacetophenones 1 (5.0 mmol),aldehydes 2 (5.0 mmol), and methanol (20 mL). The reactionmixture was cooled to 0 C and 30% NaOH aqueous solution(5.0 g, in 10 mL H2O)was added. After stirring at roomtemperature for 4 h, the reaction mixture was poured into icecold water and was subsequently neutralized with dropwiseaddition of Conc. HCl. The resulted solid was collected byfiltration, washed with petroleum ether (1.5 mL × 2), anddried to give chalcone intermediates 3. The characterization data have been attached to the supplementary material, forknown compounds, references with full characterization datahave been provided. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Take 3.00g of o-hydroxyacetophenone (22.03mmol) and 3.30g of p-methoxybenzaldehyde (24.24mmol) in a 500mL round-bottom flask, add 300mL of ethanol until the compound is completely dissolved, slowly add 20-30mL of 10% sodium hydroxide solution, stir at room temperature for 4 days, and track the reaction by TLC (petroleum ether: ethyl acetate = 4:1, V/V). After stopping the reaction, pour the reaction into a 500mL beaker containing 400mL of ice water, and add 5% HCl solution dropwise with a rubber dropper until the pH value in the beaker is about 6 when measured by pH test paper. A large amount of yellow solid precipitates at the bottom of the beaker as Intermediate 3, which is filtered, dried, and set aside. Yield: 71%.",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Take 3.00g of o-hydroxyacetophenone (22.03mmol) and 3.30g of p-methoxybenzaldehyde (24.24mmol) in a 500mL round-bottom flask, add 300mL of ethanol until the compound is completely dissolved, slowly add 20-30mL of 10% sodium hydroxide solution, stir at room temperature for 4 days, and track the reaction by TLC (petroleum ether: ethyl acetate = 4:1, V/V). After stopping the reaction, pour the reaction into a 500mL beaker containing 400mL of ice water, and add 5% HCl solution dropwise with a rubber dropper until the pH value in the beaker is about 6 when measured by pH test paper. A large amount of yellow solid precipitates at the bottom of the beaker as Intermediate 3, which is filtered, dried, and set aside. Yield: 71%. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: OC1=C(C=O)C=CC=C1, Temperature: 20 - 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of 10 ml of 96% ethanol, 2-hydroxiacetophenone(0.012 mol), benzaldehyde derivatives (0.01 mol) was stirred continuouslyat 25 C. Immediately, 20 g of 30% NaOH solution was addedin small portions. After becoming homogeneous, mixture was left atroom temperature to stir overnight. The reaction mixture was left tostand in the refrigerator at 4-8 C for 24 h occasionally stirring byvigorous shaking. The precipitated solid was then filtered off, washedwith water and acidified with cold 1 mol/l HCl until the pH was about3. A precipitate of yellow colour was collected by vacuum system andwashed with ice water to neutral reaction (on litmus) and then pouredover with cooled 96% ethanol, and air-dry, in a dark place. The rawchalcone is left to. After drying, it was purified by TLC and column dryflash chromatographyand crystallized from ethanol. The pure transchalcone isomer was obtained in the form of a yellow crystallinepowder (confirmed 1H NMR; Jvinyl H = 15-16 Hz).",OC1=CC=CC=C1C(=O)\C=C\C1=C(O)C=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: OC1=C(C=O)C=CC=C1, Temperature: 20 - 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of 10 ml of 96% ethanol, 2-hydroxiacetophenone(0.012 mol), benzaldehyde derivatives (0.01 mol) was stirred continuouslyat 25 C. Immediately, 20 g of 30% NaOH solution was addedin small portions. After becoming homogeneous, mixture was left atroom temperature to stir overnight. The reaction mixture was left tostand in the refrigerator at 4-8 C for 24 h occasionally stirring byvigorous shaking. The precipitated solid was then filtered off, washedwith water and acidified with cold 1 mol/l HCl until the pH was about3. A precipitate of yellow colour was collected by vacuum system andwashed with ice water to neutral reaction (on litmus) and then pouredover with cooled 96% ethanol, and air-dry, in a dark place. The rawchalcone is left to. After drying, it was purified by TLC and column dryflash chromatographyand crystallized from ethanol. The pure transchalcone isomer was obtained in the form of a yellow crystallinepowder (confirmed 1H NMR; Jvinyl H = 15-16 Hz). The SMILES answer is : OC1=CC=CC=C1C(=O)\C=C\C1=C(O)C=CC=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 10 - 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a solution of 2’-hydroxyacetophenone (0.01M) in methanol (10mL) was added an equimolar concentration of appropriate benzaldehydes, which was maintained at less than 10 C. To this mixture was added an ice-cooled solution of sodium hydroxide (60%) with continuous stirring for a period of 30-45 min. The reaction mixture was then left at room temperature for about 72 h with occasional shaking. After 72 h, the reaction mixture was poured into ice-cold water, then adjusted to pH-2 using 6N hydrochloric acid. The obtained yellow precipitate was filtered. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The strategy for the synthesis 3-Benzylchroman-4-onederivatives involved the preparation of2'-hydroxychalcone intermediate by Claisen-Schmidt condensation. Substitutedbenzaldehyde (leq) was reacted with2'-hydroxyacetophenone (leq) in 40-50% of MeOH/KOH. The mixture was poured into crushed ice acidified withdilute hydrochloric acid and stirred well. The reaction mixture was kept in therefrigerator for overnight to precipitate 2'-Hydroxychalcone. 2'-hydroxychalcone, saturated ammonium formate solution [methanol:THF (1:1)] and 10% Pd/C were refluxed for90 minutes. The reaction mixture was filtered.The product which remained in the filtrate wasisolated in good yield by dispersing the residue in water, extracting itwith ethyl acetate, and drying over anhydrous Na2SO4 to obtain2'-Hydroxydihydrochalcone. 2'-Hydroxydihydrochalcone was dissolved in ethanol and refluxedwith paraformaldehyde and 50% aqueous diethylamine for 9 hrs. Ethanol wasdistilled off, and the residue was takenup in ethyl acetate. Ethyl acetate was distilled off, and the oily residue was column chromatographed over silicausing pet ether: ethyl acetate (7:3) as eluent to get the targetcompounds 3a-3o in 60-70% yield.",COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The strategy for the synthesis 3-Benzylchroman-4-onederivatives involved the preparation of2'-hydroxychalcone intermediate by Claisen-Schmidt condensation. Substitutedbenzaldehyde (leq) was reacted with2'-hydroxyacetophenone (leq) in 40-50% of MeOH/KOH. The mixture was poured into crushed ice acidified withdilute hydrochloric acid and stirred well. The reaction mixture was kept in therefrigerator for overnight to precipitate 2'-Hydroxychalcone. 2'-hydroxychalcone, saturated ammonium formate solution [methanol:THF (1:1)] and 10% Pd/C were refluxed for90 minutes. The reaction mixture was filtered.The product which remained in the filtrate wasisolated in good yield by dispersing the residue in water, extracting itwith ethyl acetate, and drying over anhydrous Na2SO4 to obtain2'-Hydroxydihydrochalcone. 2'-Hydroxydihydrochalcone was dissolved in ethanol and refluxedwith paraformaldehyde and 50% aqueous diethylamine for 9 hrs. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20; 20°C, Time: 0.5; 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water; methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A solution of 2 -hydroxyacetophenone (0.12 mL, 1.0 mmol), aq. sodium hydroxide solution (10 mL) (30%) was dissolved in MeOH (25.0 mL) and stirred for 30 min at room temperature with the subsequent addition of various aryl aldehyde (1.0 mmol) dropwise at the same temperature, the reaction mixture was stirred for fur- ther 4 h. ‘The reaction mixture progress was observed by TLC us- ing a mixture of ethyl acetate: n -hexane (1:3) as a mobile phase. After the completion of the reaction, the reaction mixture was acidified with dilute HCl (10%). The precipitated solid was filtered, washed with distilled H 2 O and ultimately recrystallized from EtOH to get the purified product. Subsequently, the substituted chalcone (1.0 mmol), was dissolved in DMSO (10 mL) and oxidatively cy- clized in the presence of a small amount of iodine I 2 (254 mg, 1.0 mmol). The reaction mixture was refluxed at 130-140 C on an oil bath for 4-5 hours. Afterwards, the reaction mixture was poured onto the crushed ice, the resulting solid was treated with a solution of 10% Na 2 S 2 O 3 to get rid of unreacted I 2 , finally with dis- tilled H 2 O and recrystallized from EtOH to get a purified product. The obtained substituted flavone and 2,4-dinitrophenylhydrazine (DNPH) were dissolved in EtOH (15 mL). To this mixture, 3-4 drops of concentrated sulfuric acid (H 2 SO 4 ) were added and allowed the mixture to reflux for 4 h. This reaction mixture was stirred for 20 h at room temperature. The mixture was poured into conc HCl (10 mL) and crash ice (about 150 g), then the mixture was stirred for 30 min. Most of substituted 2’-hydroxychalcone was displayed as precipitate, and it was filtered using suction filtration. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC(=CC=C1)N(=O)=O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In a typical experiment, aldehyde (1 mmol) was added to Ethanol (10 mL) in a round bottom flask (25 mL). Then acetophenone (1 mmol) was added to the reaction mixture followed by addition of 15 N ethanolic solution of sodium ethoxide (0.2 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred overnight (15-17 hours) at room temperature. Then the solvent was removed and the mixture was dissolved in ethyl acetate. The contents of the flask were then transferred to the separating funnel and washed with brine. Then the organic layer was dried over MgSO4 and the solvent was removed to obtain the product. Then acetophenone (1 mmol) was added to the reaction mixture followed by addition of 15 N ethanolic solution of sodium ethoxide (0.2 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred overnight (15-17 hours) at room temperature. Then the solvent was removed and the mixture was dissolved in ethyl acetate. The contents of the flask were then transferred to the separating funnel and washed with brine. Then the organic layer was dried over MgSO4 and the solvent was removed to obtain the product. In case the product was oil, it was purified by column chromatography in EtOAc:hexane and in case of the solid, it was purified by recrystallization from ethanol. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 0 - 5; 25°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: A mixture of acetophenone (1) (6 g, 0.05 mol) and 4-nitro-benzaldehyde (2)(7.5 g, 0.05 mol) was stirred in EtOH (120 ml) at 0-5 C, then 100 ml solution of NaOH (1 N) in water was added dropwise into the reaction mixture under stirring. After the mixture was allowed to stir for 24 h at 25 C, the ph value of the solution was adjusted to 7 by dilute hydrochloric acid (1 N), the yellow solid obtained was collected by filtration, washed with water, and dried under vacuum to produce 3(10.88 g, 86%) as a yellow solid.
