"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC1=CC=C(C=C1)N(=O)=O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 170°C, Time: 3 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: neat (no solvent). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the suitable aldehyde (1.0 mmol), acetophenone (1.0 mmol) and clay catalyst(240 mg) was warmed at 150 C in a sealed tube under microwave irradiation, for 1 h. In the reactions involving solid starting materials, they were thoroughly mixed by grinding in a mortar before irradiation. The reaction mixture was diluted with hot ethanol (20 mL), the catalyst was filtered off, the solvent was evaporated and the residue was purified by crystallization (EtOH) for solid chalcones(compounds 3a-3d, 3f-3m, 3p-3ar) or by column chromatography (silica gel, ethyl acetate/hexanes) for oily chalcones (compounds 3e, 3o), to afford the pure final products. All yields were calculated from isolated products. Characterization data for previously unknown compounds are given below. In the reactions involving solid starting materials, they were thoroughly mixed by grinding in a mortar before irradiation. All yields were calculated from isolated products. Characterization data for previously unknown compounds are given below. For full characterization data, see the Supporting Information. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C(C)=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC(OC)=C1OC, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the acetophenone (5-10mmol, 1equiv.) and the corresponding aldehyde (1equiv.) in EtOH (20-40mL) was stirred at room temperature and a 50% aqueous solution of NaOH (5-8mL) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature until all aldehyde had been consumed. HCl (10%) was then added until neutrality. Precipitated chalcones were generally filtered and crystallized from MeOH although in some cases the product was purified using column chromatography.",COC1=CC=C(C(=O)C=CC2=CC(OC)=C(OC)C(OC)=C2)C(O)=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C(C)=O)C(O)=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC(OC)=C1OC, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of the acetophenone (5-10mmol, 1equiv.) and the corresponding aldehyde (1equiv.) in EtOH (20-40mL) was stirred at room temperature and a 50% aqueous solution of NaOH (5-8mL) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature until all aldehyde had been consumed. HCl (10%) was then added until neutrality. Precipitated chalcones were generally filtered and crystallized from MeOH although in some cases the product was purified using column chromatography. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC(OC)=C1OC, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Selected acetophenone (10 mmol) and selected benzaldehyde (10 mmol) were added to 50 ml of 5% aqueous NaOH. The mixture was placed in the centre of microwave oven besides a beaker with ice (50 g) and irradiated for successive periods of 10 s, 5-7 min in total, with cooling in between. After irradiation, color of the mixture changed to crimson. The mixture was then poured into 200 ml of ice cold water and neutralized with cold HCl. The precipitate formed was filtered and recrystallized with ethanol to afford the chalcones namely (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (1), (E)-1-Phenyl-3-p-tolyl-propenone (2), (E)-3-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (3), (E)-3-(3,4,5-Trimethoxy-phenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (4), (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (5), (E)-1,3-Di-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (6), (E)-3-(3,4,5-Trimethoxyphenyl)-1-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (7), (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (8), (E)-3-Benzo[1,3]dioxol-5-yl-1-(4-nitrophenyl)-propenone (9), (E)-1-Benzo[1,3]dioxol-5-yl-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (10), (E)-1-(4-Chlorophenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (11), (E)-1-(3,4-Dichlorophenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (12), (E)-1-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (13), (E)-1-(4-Fluorophenyl)-3-(3-nitrophenyl)-propenone (14), (E)-1-(4-Fluorophenyl)-3-phenyl-propenone (15) and (E)-1,3-Diphenyl-propenone (16).",COC1=CC(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)=CC(OC)=C1OC,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC(C=O)=CC(OC)=C1OC, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Selected acetophenone (10 mmol) and selected benzaldehyde (10 mmol) were added to 50 ml of 5% aqueous NaOH. The mixture was placed in the centre of microwave oven besides a beaker with ice (50 g) and irradiated for successive periods of 10 s, 5-7 min in total, with cooling in between. After irradiation, color of the mixture changed to crimson. The mixture was then poured into 200 ml of ice cold water and neutralized with cold HCl. The precipitate formed was filtered and recrystallized with ethanol to afford the chalcones namely (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (1), (E)-1-Phenyl-3-p-tolyl-propenone (2), (E)-3-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (3), (E)-3-(3,4,5-Trimethoxy-phenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (4), (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (5), (E)-1,3-Di-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (6), (E)-3-(3,4,5-Trimethoxyphenyl)-1-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (7), (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (8), (E)-3-Benzo[1,3]dioxol-5-yl-1-(4-nitrophenyl)-propenone (9), (E)-1-Benzo[1,3]dioxol-5-yl-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (10), (E)-1-(4-Chlorophenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (11), (E)-1-(3,4-Dichlorophenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (12), (E)-1-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (13), (E)-1-(4-Fluorophenyl)-3-(3-nitrophenyl)-propenone (14), (E)-1-(4-Fluorophenyl)-3-phenyl-propenone (15) and (E)-1,3-Diphenyl-propenone (16). Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: DBU (0.11 mmol) was added to a stirred solution ofappropriate acetophenone 7a-e (1.06 mmol) and aromatic aldehyde 8ad(1.06 mmol) in DMF (2 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred withheating to 50 C for 24 h. After cooling of the reaction mixture to roomtemperature spirostanic azide 3 or 4 (0.53 mmol), CuSO45H2O (0.05mmol) and DMF (2 mL) were successively added and the reactionmixture was heated to 130 C, stirred for 48 h, then cooled and pouredonto a Petri dish for evaporation under ambient conditions. The residuewas treated with EtOAc (30 mL), washed with saturated aqueous NaClsolution (3×15 mL), the combined extract was dried over MgSO4,filtered and evaporated. The reaction mixture was stirred withheating to 50 C for 24 h. After cooling of the reaction mixture to roomtemperature spirostanic azide 3 or 4 (0.53 mmol), CuSO45H2O (0.05mmol) and DMF (2 mL) were successively added and the reactionmixture was heated to 130 C, stirred for 48 h, then cooled and pouredonto a Petri dish for evaporation under ambient conditions. The residuewas treated with EtOAc (30 mL), washed with saturated aqueous NaClsolution (3×15 mL), the combined extract was dried over MgSO4,filtered and evaporated. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=CC=C1C(C)=O, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All syntheses were carried out in the same fashion. Each reaction was monitored by TLC for 24 h to determine when the starting materials had been consumed. All TLC analyses were run on Selecto Scientific flexible silica gel-coated plates containing a fluorescent indicator and were developed using a hexanes-ethyl acetate (4:1) solution as the eluent. The following procedure is representative of the synthesis of all chalcones (see [Chart 1] and [Chart 2] for structures): A 25-mL round-bottomed flask was charged with the appropriate derivatives of both acetophenone (3 mmol) and benzaldehyde (3 mmol), and mixed with 10 mL of 95% EtOH. The mixture was then stirred magnetically while being gently heated (in a 30 C water bath) until both starting materials dissolved. In a separate flask, NaOH (3.5 mmol) was added to 10-mL of an ethanol-water (1:1) and the mixture was stirred magnetically until the solid dissolved. The NaOH solution was then added dropwise (using a Pasteur pipet) to the ethanolic solution of acetophenone and benzaldehyde described above. In most cases, the reaction mixture turned yellow and solidified within a few minutes. Ice water (2 mL) was added to the flask and the mixture was stirred vigorously. The solid was collected on a Hirsch funnel, washed with cold water, and air-dried overnight. The purity of the crude product was determined at this point using a combination of TLC analysis, melting point measurement, and 1H NMR spectroscopy. In case of an oily product, the reaction mixture was extracted with two 10-mL portions of CH2Cl2 and the organic phase was collected, dried over Na2SO4, and removed using a rotary evaporator. The purity of the oily product was then determined as described above. All impure products (solid or oil) were purified by column chromatography using Merck Silica gel (grade 60, 230-400 mesh) and 4:1 hexanes-ethyl acetate as eluent. In case of a solid, chromatographic separation was followed by recrystallization from either methanol or ethanol-water mixture. In all cases, the purity of the final product was checked again as described above; the spectral characteristics were found to be in good general agreement with those found in the literature.4 The organic chalcones prepared for this study were either pale-yellow solids or oils of the same color (as specified); the ferrocenyl analogs were reddish-orange solids or oils. For each of the reported compounds below, the 1H NMR data is presented as δ (multiplicity, integral ratio), and the IR data as νCO, νCC. The following % yield and physical data are for new chalcones prepared for this study. Data for other chalcones (not given below) have been reported elsewhere[4], [5] and [6] and are also available online as Supplementary data.",COC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=CC=C1C(C)=O, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All syntheses were carried out in the same fashion. Each reaction was monitored by TLC for 24 h to determine when the starting materials had been consumed. All TLC analyses were run on Selecto Scientific flexible silica gel-coated plates containing a fluorescent indicator and were developed using a hexanes-ethyl acetate (4:1) solution as the eluent. The following procedure is representative of the synthesis of all chalcones (see [Chart 1] and [Chart 2] for structures): A 25-mL round-bottomed flask was charged with the appropriate derivatives of both acetophenone (3 mmol) and benzaldehyde (3 mmol), and mixed with 10 mL of 95% EtOH. The mixture was then stirred magnetically while being gently heated (in a 30 C water bath) until both starting materials dissolved. In a separate flask, NaOH (3.5 mmol) was added to 10-mL of an ethanol-water (1:1) and the mixture was stirred magnetically until the solid dissolved. The NaOH solution was then added dropwise (using a Pasteur pipet) to the ethanolic solution of acetophenone and benzaldehyde described above. In most cases, the reaction mixture turned yellow and solidified within a few minutes. Ice water (2 mL) was added to the flask and the mixture was stirred vigorously. The solid was collected on a Hirsch funnel, washed with cold water, and air-dried overnight. The purity of the crude product was determined at this point using a combination of TLC analysis, melting point measurement, and 1H NMR spectroscopy. In case of an oily product, the reaction mixture was extracted with two 10-mL portions of CH2Cl2 and the organic phase was collected, dried over Na2SO4, and removed using a rotary evaporator. The purity of the oily product was then determined as described above. All impure products (solid or oil) were purified by column chromatography using Merck Silica gel (grade 60, 230-400 mesh) and 4:1 hexanes-ethyl acetate as eluent. In case of a solid, chromatographic separation was followed by recrystallization from either methanol or ethanol-water mixture. In all cases, the purity of the final product was checked again as described above; the spectral characteristics were found to be in good general agreement with those found in the literature.4 The organic chalcones prepared for this study were either pale-yellow solids or oils of the same color (as specified); the ferrocenyl analogs were reddish-orange solids or oils. For each of the reported compounds below, the 1H NMR data is presented as δ (multiplicity, integral ratio), and the IR data as νCO, νCC. The following % yield and physical data are for new chalcones prepared for this study. Data for other chalcones (not given below) have been reported elsewhere[4], [5] and [6] and are also available online as Supplementary data. The SMILES answer is : COC1=C(C=CC=C1)C(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=CC=C1C(C)=O, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 2 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: In a 14-mL vial, the substituted acetophenone (1.25 mmol) and lithium hydroxide monohydrate (0.251 mmol) were dissolved in ethanol (5 mL) and the mixture was stirred at room temperature (RT) for 10 min followed by addition of substituted benzaldehyde (1.272 mmol). The reaction mixture was then stirred at RT and monitored by TLC using 25% ethyl acetate/hexanes as the solvent system. The reaction was quenched after 2 hrs by pouring into 50 mL of stirring ice cold water. If the product precipitated out after quenching with cold water, it was filtered off and crystallized with hot ethanol. In some examples, a sticky mass was observed in the aqueous solution after quenching. In those cases, the product was extracted by ethyl acetate (3 x 50 mL), dried over sodium sulfate, and concentrated under vacuum. The crude product was purified by flash chromatography using ethyl acetate/hexanes as the solvent system in increasing order of polarity. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC(Cl)=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a solution of 2-methoxybenzaldehyde (25 mg, 0.18 mmol) and 2'-hydroxy-5'-methoxyacetophenone (30 mg, 0.18 mmol) in EtOH (0.2 mL) was added 40% aqueous KOH (0.2 mL), and the mixture was stirred at room temperature. After the reaction was complete, ice-water was added to the reaction mixture, which was then neutralized with 1 N HCl. The mixture was extracted with EtOAc and the resultant organic layer was washed with brine, dried over MgSO4 and concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel, eluting with hexane-EtOAc (15:1) to give 2'-hydroxy-2,5'-dimethoxychalcone (13) (44 mg, 0.15 mmol) in 85% yield as an yellow solid. After the reaction was complete, ice-water was added to the reaction mixture, which was then neutralized with 1 N HCl. The mixture was extracted with EtOAc and the resultant organic layer was washed with brine, dried over MgSO4 and concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel, eluting with hexane-EtOAc (15:1) to give 2'-hydroxy-2,5'-dimethoxychalcone (13) (44 mg, 0.15 mmol) in 85% yield as an yellow solid. Chalcones 16, 17, 20, 26-29, and 32 were produced by the same procedure. The SMILES answer is : OC1=C(C=C(Cl)C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=CC=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC(Cl)=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 80°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a microwave reactor test tube containing ethanol (5 mL), an equimolar mixture of 2’-hydroxyacetophenone 1 (1 mmol) and the appropriate benzaldehyde 2 (1 mmol) were added. Then, 4 mmol of NaOH (from 40% aqueous NaOH solution) was added to the mixture, and it was homogenized by vortex mixing. The resulting reaction mixture was placed inside the microwave reactor (Milestone RotoSYNTH Microwave Reactor) usingthe single reaction vessel accessory and heated to 80 C for 5 minutes. After the firstirradiation, 1mL of 3-6% aqueous H2O2 stock solution (corresponds to approximately1.8 mmol) was added portion-wise and reheated to 80 C by another round of microwave irradiation. The resulting crude mixture was added into crushed ice and acidified(pH 3-5) by adding dilute HCl solution to form pale yellow to brown solids. The formed solids were collected by vacuum filtration, washed with ice-cold water, anddried in vacuum. The dried crude product was then recrystallized from ethanol/water toafford pure 3-hydroxyflavone 3. Performing the reaction at 80 C gave the best yieldand no improvement in the yields was observed at higher temperatures. Decompositionof peroxide does not appear to be an issue, since similar yields were obtained at elevatedtemperatures. All of the compounds of this study were known materials, identified onthe basis of matching their melting points with literature values from the referencescited in Table 2. Further characterization data are provided below. In each case, theanalytical data matched the literature in the cited references",OC1=C(C=C(Cl)C=C1)C(=O)C=CC1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=C(O)C=CC(Cl)=C1, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 80°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1Cl, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All syntheses were carried out in the same fashion. Each reaction was monitored by TLC for 24 h to determine when the starting materials had been consumed. All TLC analyses were run on Selecto Scientific flexible silica gel-coated plates containing a fluorescent indicator and were developed using a hexanes-ethyl acetate (4:1) solution as the eluent. The following procedure is representative of the synthesis of all chalcones (see [Chart 1] and [Chart 2] for structures): A 25-mL round-bottomed flask was charged with the appropriate derivatives of both acetophenone (3 mmol) and benzaldehyde (3 mmol), and mixed with 10 mL of 95% EtOH. The mixture was then stirred magnetically while being gently heated (in a 30 C water bath) until both starting materials dissolved. In a separate flask, NaOH (3.5 mmol) was added to 10-mL of an ethanol-water (1:1) and the mixture was stirred magnetically until the solid dissolved. The NaOH solution was then added dropwise (using a Pasteur pipet) to the ethanolic solution of acetophenone and benzaldehyde described above. In most cases, the reaction mixture turned yellow and solidified within a few minutes. Ice water (2 mL) was added to the flask and the mixture was stirred vigorously. The solid was collected on a Hirsch funnel, washed with cold water, and air-dried overnight. The purity of the crude product was determined at this point using a combination of TLC analysis, melting point measurement, and 1H NMR spectroscopy. In case of an oily product, the reaction mixture was extracted with two 10-mL portions of CH2Cl2 and the organic phase was collected, dried over Na2SO4, and removed using a rotary evaporator. The purity of the oily product was then determined as described above. All impure products (solid or oil) were purified by column chromatography using Merck Silica gel (grade 60, 230-400 mesh) and 4:1 hexanes-ethyl acetate as eluent. In case of a solid, chromatographic separation was followed by recrystallization from either methanol or ethanol-water mixture. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H][C@@]12CC[C@H](C(C)=O)[C@@]1(C)CC[C@@]1([H])[C@@]2([H])CC=C2C[C@@H](O)CC[C@]12C, second reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 1 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General Procedure: To a solution of pregnenolone 1 (0.316 g, 1 mmol, 1 eq.) in ethanol (10 ml) was added a conc. aq. solution of KOH (2 eq.). Then aldehyde 2 (1.2 eq.) was charged into the reaction mixture to get the corresponding benzylidine derivative 3 (Scheme 1). After completion as revealed by thin layer chromatography (TLC) in an average span of around 1 h, the reaction mixture was precipitated using water because of the limited solubility. The precipitate was filtered, dried and monitored through TLC for the purity. Thin layer chromatography revealed just a single spot which proved the presence of a single product. For further purification, the product was recrystallized from EtOAc:Hexane to give product as solid white powder. It is to be mentioned that when non-aromatic aldehydes were used, the product was formed in a very minor quantity and that too not stable enough at ambient conditions. Thus the study was restricted to the use of aromatic aldehydes only. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CCOC(C)=O, Temperature: 0 - 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dichloromethane. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a mixture of an aldehyde (0.1 mol) and alkyl acetate (0.1 mol) in dichloromethane (15 mL) was added Et3N (0.3 mol). The resulting reaction mixture was cooled to 0 C under nitrogen atmosphere. To this was added TiCl4 (0.12 mol) dropwise over a period of 15 min and the mixture was stirred for further 2-4 h at room temperature. When the reaction was complete as confirmed by TLC, the mixture was diluted with water (25 mL) and the dichloromethane layer was separated. The organic phase was washed with 0.5 M aqueous HCl, water and brine. It was then dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated under reduced pressure to afford the corresponding alkyl (E)-α,β-unsaturated carboxylate (2) in excellent yield and purity.",CCOC(=O)\C=C\C1=CC=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: [H]C(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CCOC(C)=O, Temperature: 0 - 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: dichloromethane. The resulting reaction mixture was cooled to 0 C under nitrogen atmosphere. To this was added TiCl4 (0.12 mol) dropwise over a period of 15 min and the mixture was stirred for further 2-4 h at room temperature. When the reaction was complete as confirmed by TLC, the mixture was diluted with water (25 mL) and the dichloromethane layer was separated. The organic phase was washed with 0.5 M aqueous HCl, water and brine. It was then dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated under reduced pressure to afford the corresponding alkyl (E)-α,β-unsaturated carboxylate (2) in excellent yield and purity. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 0 - 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In an ice bath, concentrated sulfuric acid (30mmol) was added dropwise to a stirring mixture of acetophenone 1 (15mmol), 4-hydroxybenzaldehyde (2) (15mmol) and ethanol (15mL). After, the ice bath was removed and the reactional mixture was maintained under stirring at room temperature for 24h, which was monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC) in hexane:ethyl acetate 1:1 mixture. Then, the precipitate formed was filtered and washed with ice-distilled water. The products were purified by crystallization from an ethanol:water 8:2 mixture. After, the ice bath was removed and the reactional mixture was maintained under stirring at room temperature for 24h, which was monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC) in hexane:ethyl acetate 1:1 mixture. Then, the precipitate formed was filtered and washed with ice-distilled water. The products were purified by crystallization from an ethanol:water 8:2 mixture. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: acetone. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: 4-hydroxybenzaldehyde (6.1 g) was added to 60 mL of acetone, after stirring for about 15 minutes, the reaction system was ice-bathed for about 30 minutes. Add about 100 mL of 5% NaOH solution to the system, after the addition is complete, remove the ice bath and stir at room temperature for about 24 hours. After the reaction is completed, transfer the system to a 500mL beaker and add an appropriate amount of ice water. After adjusting the pH of the system to about 5-6 with a 5% dilute hydrochloric acid solution, a large amount of yellow solid precipitated out. And finally recrystallized with ethanol/water system, a yellow solid was obtained with a yield of 65%.",CC(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: acetone. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: 4-hydroxybenzaldehyde (6.1 g) was added to 60 mL of acetone, after stirring for about 15 minutes, the reaction system was ice-bathed for about 30 minutes. Add about 100 mL of 5% NaOH solution to the system, after the addition is complete, remove the ice bath and stir at room temperature for about 24 hours. After the reaction is completed, transfer the system to a 500mL beaker and add an appropriate amount of ice water. After adjusting the pH of the system to about 5-6 with a 5% dilute hydrochloric acid solution, a large amount of yellow solid precipitated out. And finally recrystallized with ethanol/water system, a yellow solid was obtained with a yield of 65%. The SMILES answer is : CC(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(O)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The ketones were prepared following the previous report from ourgroup [17,47]. Briefly, 1 mmol of 4-hydroxybenzaldehyde, and 1 mL ofthe corresponding ketone were dissolved in ethanol, and then 1 mL of40% sodium hydroxide solution was added. The reaction proceeded for24 h and after neutralization, ethanol was evaporated. The pure productwas obtained by recrystallization from water.1-(4-Hydroxyphenyl)but-1-en-3-one (1h). Yellowish solid (m.p.109-112 C); Yield 62%. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 7.55 - 7.36 (m, 3H), 6.87(d, J = 8.7 Hz, 2H), 6.61 (d, J = 16.1 Hz, 1H), 5.55 (br. s, 1H), 2.37 (s,3H).",CC(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: 24 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The ketones were prepared following the previous report from ourgroup [17,47]. Briefly, 1 mmol of 4-hydroxybenzaldehyde, and 1 mL ofthe corresponding ketone were dissolved in ethanol, and then 1 mL of40% sodium hydroxide solution was added. The reaction proceeded for24 h and after neutralization, ethanol was evaporated. The pure productwas obtained by recrystallization from water.1-(4-Hydroxyphenyl)but-1-en-3-one (1h). Yellowish solid (m.p.109-112 C); Yield 62%. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 7.55 - 7.36 (m, 3H), 6.87(d, J = 8.7 Hz, 2H), 6.61 (d, J = 16.1 Hz, 1H), 5.55 (br. s, 1H), 2.37 (s,3H). The SMILES answer is : CC(=O)C=CC1=CC=C(O)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An equimolar amount of p-aminoacetophenone (0.1 mol, 13.51 g)and the appropriate aldehyde 5a-d (0.1 mol), were dissolved in aminimum amount of ethanol, and aqueous NaOH (0.25 mol, 60%) wasthen added dropwise. The reaction mixture was stirred in ice bath for30 min then at rt, until the precipitate was formed within 3 h. Theprecipitate was filtered off and washed thoroughly with cold distilledwater and cold methanol (2×20 mL). The product was recrystallizedfrom absolute ethanol. The structure of the product was confirmed by mp",COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=C(N)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(N)C=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An equimolar amount of p-aminoacetophenone (0.1 mol, 13.51 g)and the appropriate aldehyde 5a-d (0.1 mol), were dissolved in aminimum amount of ethanol, and aqueous NaOH (0.25 mol, 60%) wasthen added dropwise. The reaction mixture was stirred in ice bath for30 min then at rt, until the precipitate was formed within 3 h. Theprecipitate was filtered off and washed thoroughly with cold distilledwater and cold methanol (2×20 mL). The product was recrystallizedfrom absolute ethanol. The structure of the product was confirmed by mp The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=C(N)C=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: OC(=O)CC#N, Temperature: 90°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: N,N-dimethyl-formamide. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The corresponding phenolic aldehydes (8mmol) and malonic acid (24mmol, 2.5g) or 2-cyanoacetic acid (24mmol, 2.04g) were mixed together into DMF (5ml) in a tube until complete dissolution. Piperidine (4mmol, 400µl) was added to the mixture. The tube was sealed and placed into a microwave reactor at a constant power (50W) until reaching a temperature of 90C which was then maintained for another 30min. The reaction mixture was then evaporated under vacuum and the desired product precipitated by addition of 50ml of cold diluted aqueous NH4Cl solution. All the precipitates were collected and washed with cold water, then were purified by recrystallization.",COC1=CC=C(\C=C(/C#N)C(O)=O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: OC(=O)CC#N, Temperature: 90°C, Time: 0.5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: N,N-dimethyl-formamide. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The corresponding phenolic aldehydes (8mmol) and malonic acid (24mmol, 2.5g) or 2-cyanoacetic acid (24mmol, 2.04g) were mixed together into DMF (5ml) in a tube until complete dissolution. Piperidine (4mmol, 400µl) was added to the mixture. The tube was sealed and placed into a microwave reactor at a constant power (50W) until reaching a temperature of 90C which was then maintained for another 30min. The reaction mixture was then evaporated under vacuum and the desired product precipitated by addition of 50ml of cold diluted aqueous NH4Cl solution. All the precipitates were collected and washed with cold water, then were purified by recrystallization. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C(/C#N)C(O)=O)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: OC(=O)CC#N, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of aldehyde (1 mmol), cyanoacetic acid(1mmol), KOH (20 mol%, 0.7 M) and water (5 mL) wasput in the MW reactor (50 W) for 20 min and stirred at75 C. The reaction progress was monitored by TLC ina mixture of EtOAc-hexane 8:2. After completion of thereaction, it was added 1 mL of HCl (3 M) and the solutionwas stirred for 30 min. At the end of the reaction, extractionwith ethyl acetate (3 × 25 mL) was carried out. Thecombined organic phases were concentrated under reducedpressure until total evaporation of the solvent. The obtainedproduct was puried by column chromatography (silicagel 230400mesh) using the same mixture used in TLC.All products were characterized by 1HNMR, 13CNMR,FTIR and melting point. The spectral and analytical dataof the compounds 6a-6m can be viewed in the SI section.",COC1=CC=C(\C=C(/C#N)C(O)=O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: OC(=O)CC#N, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A mixture of aldehyde (1 mmol), cyanoacetic acid(1mmol), KOH (20 mol%, 0.7 M) and water (5 mL) wasput in the MW reactor (50 W) for 20 min and stirred at75 C. The reaction progress was monitored by TLC ina mixture of EtOAc-hexane 8:2. After completion of thereaction, it was added 1 mL of HCl (3 M) and the solutionwas stirred for 30 min. At the end of the reaction, extractionwith ethyl acetate (3 × 25 mL) was carried out. Thecombined organic phases were concentrated under reducedpressure until total evaporation of the solvent. The obtainedproduct was puried by column chromatography (silicagel 230400mesh) using the same mixture used in TLC.All products were characterized by 1HNMR, 13CNMR,FTIR and melting point. The spectral and analytical dataof the compounds 6a-6m can be viewed in the SI section. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C(/C#N)C(O)=O)C=C1

Inmost cases, a cream to dark yellow solid was formed withina few minutes but the reaction was allowed to proceed for 5h. The solid product (8a-d) was collected on a filter, washedwith cold methanol, and the product was recrystallized inmethanol (Yields: 56-94%).",COC1=CC=C(\C=C2/CC3=C(C=CC=C3)C2=O)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: O=C1CCC2=C1C=CC=C2, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 5 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C(C)=O)C(OC)=C1, Temperature: 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: To a stirred solution of anisaldehyde 13a (1.4 g, 10.2 mmol) and 2,4-dimethoxy acetophenone 11 (1.8 g, 10.2 mmol) in methanol (20 mL) potassium hydroxide (5 mL, 50 % w/v aqueous solution) was added at 25 C. After 12 h of stirring, the completion of the reaction was confirmed by TLC analysis. The mixture was then acidified to pH 1 with 1 N hydrochloric acid. After acidification the organic layer was extracted with dichloromethane (2 x 20 mL), washed with water, brine solution, dried over Na2SO4, filtered and concentrated under reduced vacuum. The crude product was purified by column chromatography (Silica gel, hexane/ethyl acetate) to obtain the compound 10a (2.5 g, 83 %) as a light yellow solid. MP = 55.3-57.1 C; 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3 + CCl4) δ 7.74 (d, J = 8.6 Hz, 1H), 7.65 (d, J = 15.7 Hz, 1H), 7.55 (d, J = 8.6 Hz, 2H), 7.39 (d, J = 15.7 Hz, 1H), 6.92 (t, J = 6.9 Hz, 2H), 6.56 (dd, J = 8.6, 2.0 Hz, 1H), 6.50 (d, J = 1.8 Hz, 1H), 3.90 (s, 3H), 3.86 (s, 3H), 3.84 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (126 MHz, CDCl3 + CCl4) δ 190.7, 163.9, 161.2, 160.3, 142.1, 132.7, 130.0, 128.2, 125.1, 122.5, 114.3, 105.1, 98.7, 55.7, 55.5, 55.4. IR (neat, cm- 1): 3356, 3308, 1608, 1518, 1219; HRMS (ESI-quadrupole) m/z: [M+H]+ Calcd for C18H19O4 299.1283; Found 299.1271.",COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(OC)C=C2OC)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C(C)=O)C(OC)=C1, Temperature: 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: To a stirred solution of anisaldehyde 13a (1.4 g, 10.2 mmol) and 2,4-dimethoxy acetophenone 11 (1.8 g, 10.2 mmol) in methanol (20 mL) potassium hydroxide (5 mL, 50 % w/v aqueous solution) was added at 25 C. After 12 h of stirring, the completion of the reaction was confirmed by TLC analysis. The mixture was then acidified to pH 1 with 1 N hydrochloric acid. After acidification the organic layer was extracted with dichloromethane (2 x 20 mL), washed with water, brine solution, dried over Na2SO4, filtered and concentrated under reduced vacuum. The crude product was purified by column chromatography (Silica gel, hexane/ethyl acetate) to obtain the compound 10a (2.5 g, 83 %) as a light yellow solid. MP = 55.3-57.1 C; 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3 + CCl4) δ 7.74 (d, J = 8.6 Hz, 1H), 7.65 (d, J = 15.7 Hz, 1H), 7.55 (d, J = 8.6 Hz, 2H), 7.39 (d, J = 15.7 Hz, 1H), 6.92 (t, J = 6.9 Hz, 2H), 6.56 (dd, J = 8.6, 2.0 Hz, 1H), 6.50 (d, J = 1.8 Hz, 1H), 3.90 (s, 3H), 3.86 (s, 3H), 3.84 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (126 MHz, CDCl3 + CCl4) δ 190.7, 163.9, 161.2, 160.3, 142.1, 132.7, 130.0, 128.2, 125.1, 122.5, 114.3, 105.1, 98.7, 55.7, 55.5, 55.4. IR (neat, cm- 1): 3356, 3308, 1608, 1518, 1219; HRMS (ESI-quadrupole) m/z: [M+H]+ Calcd for C18H19O4 299.1283; Found 299.1271. The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=C(OC)C=C2OC)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Selected acetophenone (10 mmol) and selected benzaldehyde (10 mmol) were added to 50 ml of 5% aqueous NaOH. The mixture was placed in the centre of microwave oven besides a beaker with ice (50 g) and irradiated for successive periods of 10 s, 5-7 min in total, with cooling in between. After irradiation, color of the mixture changed to crimson. The mixture was then poured into 200 ml of ice cold water and neutralized with cold HCl. The precipitate formed was filtered and recrystallized with ethanol to afford the chalcones namely (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (1), (E)-1-Phenyl-3-p-tolyl-propenone (2), (E)-3-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (3), (E)-3-(3,4,5-Trimethoxy-phenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (4), (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (5), (E)-1,3-Di-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (6), (E)-3-(3,4,5-Trimethoxyphenyl)-1-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (7), (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (8), (E)-3-Benzo[1,3]dioxol-5-yl-1-(4-nitrophenyl)-propenone (9), (E)-1-Benzo[1,3]dioxol-5-yl-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (10), (E)-1-(4-Chlorophenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (11), (E)-1-(3,4-Dichlorophenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (12), (E)-1-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (13), (E)-1-(4-Fluorophenyl)-3-(3-nitrophenyl)-propenone (14), (E)-1-(4-Fluorophenyl)-3-phenyl-propenone (15) and (E)-1,3-Diphenyl-propenone (16).",COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC(OC)=C(OC)C=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: COC1=C(OC)C=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Selected acetophenone (10 mmol) and selected benzaldehyde (10 mmol) were added to 50 ml of 5% aqueous NaOH. The mixture was placed in the centre of microwave oven besides a beaker with ice (50 g) and irradiated for successive periods of 10 s, 5-7 min in total, with cooling in between. After irradiation, color of the mixture changed to crimson. The mixture was then poured into 200 ml of ice cold water and neutralized with cold HCl. The precipitate formed was filtered and recrystallized with ethanol to afford the chalcones namely (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (1), (E)-1-Phenyl-3-p-tolyl-propenone (2), (E)-3-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (3), (E)-3-(3,4,5-Trimethoxy-phenyl)-1-phenyl-propenone (4), (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (5), (E)-1,3-Di-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (6), (E)-3-(3,4,5-Trimethoxyphenyl)-1-p-tolylprop-2-en-1-one (7), (E)-3-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-1-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (8), (E)-3-Benzo[1,3]dioxol-5-yl-1-(4-nitrophenyl)-propenone (9), (E)-1-Benzo[1,3]dioxol-5-yl-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (10), (E)-1-(4-Chlorophenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (11), (E)-1-(3,4-Dichlorophenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (12), (E)-1-(3,4-Dimethoxyphenyl)-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)-propenone (13), (E)-1-(4-Fluorophenyl)-3-(3-nitrophenyl)-propenone (14), (E)-1-(4-Fluorophenyl)-3-phenyl-propenone (15) and (E)-1,3-Diphenyl-propenone (16). The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC(OC)=C(OC)C=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC(=O)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Step 1: 4-(3-oxo-3-Phenylpropenyl)-benzoic Acid (43) Sodium methoxide (1.8 g, 33.3 mmol) was added to a stirred suspension of 4-carboxybenzaldehyde (2.5 g, 16.6 mmol) and acetophenone (2.0 g uL, 16.6 mmol) in methanol (50 mL) at room temperature. The mixture was stirred at room temperature for 16 hours, and half of the volume of methanol was removed under reduced pressure. The mixture was poured into HCl 1M (50 mL) (until pH=2) and ethyl acetate was added. The separated aqueous layer was extracted with ethyl acetate (3*30 mL) dried (MgSO4 anh.), filtered and evaporated. The residue was triturated with dichloromethane-hexanes (1:1) to afford 3 g of 43 (72% yield). 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3); δ 7.50-7.87 (m, 7H), 8.04 (d, 2H, J=8 Hz), 8.16 (d, 2H, J=8 Hz).",OC(=O)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC(=O)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Step 1: 4-(3-oxo-3-Phenylpropenyl)-benzoic Acid (43) Sodium methoxide (1.8 g, 33.3 mmol) was added to a stirred suspension of 4-carboxybenzaldehyde (2.5 g, 16.6 mmol) and acetophenone (2.0 g uL, 16.6 mmol) in methanol (50 mL) at room temperature. The mixture was stirred at room temperature for 16 hours, and half of the volume of methanol was removed under reduced pressure. The mixture was poured into HCl 1M (50 mL) (until pH=2) and ethyl acetate was added. The separated aqueous layer was extracted with ethyl acetate (3*30 mL) dried (MgSO4 anh.), filtered and evaporated. The residue was triturated with dichloromethane-hexanes (1:1) to afford 3 g of 43 (72% yield). 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3); δ 7.50-7.87 (m, 7H), 8.04 (d, 2H, J=8 Hz), 8.16 (d, 2H, J=8 Hz). The SMILES answer is : OC(=O)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC(=O)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 12 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Chalcones 1-6 were synthesized, adopting a literature reported method [19] and described as follows: Formylbenzoic acid (10 mmol, 1.5 g, 1 eq.) and the appropriate aryl ketone (10.3 mmol,1.03 eq.) were successively added to MeOH (60 ml) upon stirring at room temperature. Sodium hydroxide solution, NaOH (1 M, 20 ml) was added and stirring was continued for 12 h [Scheme 1, step (i)].The progress of the reaction was followed by TLC. After completion, the pH of the solution was adjusted to 2 with HCl solution (1 M), upon which an off-white to yellow precipitate formed. The precipitate was subsequently collected by suction filtration and washed with water, then with a 10% MeOH solution and dried to yield the desired pure compound in high yields.",OC(=O)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC(=O)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 12 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Chalcones 1-6 were synthesized, adopting a literature reported method [19] and described as follows: Formylbenzoic acid (10 mmol, 1.5 g, 1 eq.) and the appropriate aryl ketone (10.3 mmol,1.03 eq.) were successively added to MeOH (60 ml) upon stirring at room temperature. Sodium hydroxide solution, NaOH (1 M, 20 ml) was added and stirring was continued for 12 h [Scheme 1, step (i)].The progress of the reaction was followed by TLC. After completion, the pH of the solution was adjusted to 2 with HCl solution (1 M), upon which an off-white to yellow precipitate formed. The precipitate was subsequently collected by suction filtration and washed with water, then with a 10% MeOH solution and dried to yield the desired pure compound in high yields. The SMILES answer is : OC(=O)C1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: OC(=O)C1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 6 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Sodium hydroxide (128.0 g, 3.2 mol) is dissolved in water (1400 mL) and ethanol (675 mL). The mixture is cooled to 20 C and acetophenone (120 g, 0.5 mol) is added with mechanical stirring. 4-Carboxybenzaldehyde (75 g, 0.5 mol) and the reaction stirred at room temperature for 6 h. The reaction is acidified with concentrated HCl (300 mL) and extracted with ethyl acetate (3x). The combined organic portions are washed with water, staturated brine, dried, and evaporated in vacuo. After completion of the reaction,(monitored by TLC) catalyst GE-ZnO NRs were completely separated bya simple filtration process. The product obtained by diluting the hydrotropicmedium with water was filtered and washed with water (10mL) to escape completely from the hydrotrope. Obtained product wasrecrystallized by ethanol. The recrystallized products were well identifiedby 1H NMR as well as 13C NMR. The SMILES answer is : BrC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: O=CC=CC1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, Temperature: 20 - 25°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A solution of 0.01 mol of the aryl aldehydes and 0.01 mol of the acetophenone in 10 mL of 95% ethanol was taken in a 25-mL Erlenmeyer flask equipped with a magnetic stirring bar. To this solution 3.5 mL of 6M NaOH solution was then added with the help of a Pasteur pipette. The reaction temperature was maintained between 20-25 C by keeping the flask in cold water bath. The reaction mixture was stirred for 4-5 h and was subsequently neutralized by 0.1-0.2 N HCl providing the crude product which was recrystallized from rectified spirit. To this solution 3.5 mL of 6M NaOH solution was then added with the help of a Pasteur pipette. The reaction temperature was maintained between 20-25 C by keeping the flask in cold water bath. The reaction mixture was stirred for 4-5 h and was subsequently neutralized by 0.1-0.2 N HCl providing the crude product which was recrystallized from rectified spirit. The residue was purified further by column chromatography using hexane-ethyl acetate in ratio the 9:1 as eluent to afford the pure chalcones (Scheme 1). "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=CC=C1C=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All chalcone derivatives (3a-w) were obtained according to proceedings reported by our research group previously,(Mellado et al. 2020, Mellado, Madrid, Martinez, et al. 2018a, Mellado, Madrid, Reyna, et al. 2018a, Mellado et al. 2021) Briefly,250 mg of acetophenone (2.08 mmol) and appropriate benzaldehyde (1.2 equivalents) were solubilized in ethanol (5 mL) and added 10 mL of a saturated NaOH solution. This mixture was stirred for 48 h at room temperature, and, after this time, a 5% HCl solution was added until pH= 7.0 to stop reaction. Finally, mixture was extracted with EtOAc (50 mL x 3) and separated. The organic layer was dried, concentrated and purified using column chromatography in order to obtain the corresponding chalcones.",COC1=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=CC=C1C=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 48 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All chalcone derivatives (3a-w) were obtained according to proceedings reported by our research group previously,(Mellado et al. 2020, Mellado, Madrid, Martinez, et al. 2018a, Mellado, Madrid, Reyna, et al. 2018a, Mellado et al. 2021) Briefly,250 mg of acetophenone (2.08 mmol) and appropriate benzaldehyde (1.2 equivalents) were solubilized in ethanol (5 mL) and added 10 mL of a saturated NaOH solution. This mixture was stirred for 48 h at room temperature, and, after this time, a 5% HCl solution was added until pH= 7.0 to stop reaction. Finally, mixture was extracted with EtOAc (50 mL x 3) and separated. The organic layer was dried, concentrated and purified using column chromatography in order to obtain the corresponding chalcones. The SMILES answer is : COC1=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=CC=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=CC=C1C=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All syntheses were carried out in the same fashion. Each reaction was monitored by TLC for 24 h to determine when the starting materials had been consumed. All TLC analyses were run on Selecto Scientific flexible silica gel-coated plates containing a fluorescent indicator and were developed using a hexanes-ethyl acetate (4:1) solution as the eluent. The following procedure is representative of the synthesis of all chalcones (see [Chart 1] and [Chart 2] for structures): A 25-mL round-bottomed flask was charged with the appropriate derivatives of both acetophenone (3 mmol) and benzaldehyde (3 mmol), and mixed with 10 mL of 95% EtOH. The mixture was then stirred magnetically while being gently heated (in a 30 C water bath) until both starting materials dissolved. In a separate flask, NaOH (3.5 mmol) was added to 10-mL of an ethanol-water (1:1) and the mixture was stirred magnetically until the solid dissolved. The NaOH solution was then added dropwise (using a Pasteur pipet) to the ethanolic solution of acetophenone and benzaldehyde described above. In most cases, the reaction mixture turned yellow and solidified within a few minutes. Ice water (2 mL) was added to the flask and the mixture was stirred vigorously. The solid was collected on a Hirsch funnel, washed with cold water, and air-dried overnight. The purity of the crude product was determined at this point using a combination of TLC analysis, melting point measurement, and 1H NMR spectroscopy. In case of an oily product, the reaction mixture was extracted with two 10-mL portions of CH2Cl2 and the organic phase was collected, dried over Na2SO4, and removed using a rotary evaporator. The purity of the oily product was then determined as described above. All impure products (solid or oil) were purified by column chromatography using Merck Silica gel (grade 60, 230-400 mesh) and 4:1 hexanes-ethyl acetate as eluent. In case of a solid, chromatographic separation was followed by recrystallization from either methanol or ethanol-water mixture. In all cases, the purity of the final product was checked again as described above; the spectral characteristics were found to be in good general agreement with those found in the literature.4 The organic chalcones prepared for this study were either pale-yellow solids or oils of the same color (as specified); the ferrocenyl analogs were reddish-orange solids or oils. For each of the reported compounds below, the 1H NMR data is presented as δ (multiplicity, integral ratio), and the IR data as νCO, νCC. The following % yield and physical data are for new chalcones prepared for this study. Data for other chalcones (not given below) have been reported elsewhere[4], [5] and [6] and are also available online as Supplementary data.",COC1=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=CC=C1C=O, Temperature: unknown°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: All syntheses were carried out in the same fashion. Each reaction was monitored by TLC for 24 h to determine when the starting materials had been consumed. All TLC analyses were run on Selecto Scientific flexible silica gel-coated plates containing a fluorescent indicator and were developed using a hexanes-ethyl acetate (4:1) solution as the eluent. The following procedure is representative of the synthesis of all chalcones (see [Chart 1] and [Chart 2] for structures): A 25-mL round-bottomed flask was charged with the appropriate derivatives of both acetophenone (3 mmol) and benzaldehyde (3 mmol), and mixed with 10 mL of 95% EtOH. The mixture was then stirred magnetically while being gently heated (in a 30 C water bath) until both starting materials dissolved. In a separate flask, NaOH (3.5 mmol) was added to 10-mL of an ethanol-water (1:1) and the mixture was stirred magnetically until the solid dissolved. The NaOH solution was then added dropwise (using a Pasteur pipet) to the ethanolic solution of acetophenone and benzaldehyde described above. In most cases, the reaction mixture turned yellow and solidified within a few minutes. Ice water (2 mL) was added to the flask and the mixture was stirred vigorously. The solid was collected on a Hirsch funnel, washed with cold water, and air-dried overnight. The purity of the crude product was determined at this point using a combination of TLC analysis, melting point measurement, and 1H NMR spectroscopy. In case of an oily product, the reaction mixture was extracted with two 10-mL portions of CH2Cl2 and the organic phase was collected, dried over Na2SO4, and removed using a rotary evaporator. The purity of the oily product was then determined as described above. All impure products (solid or oil) were purified by column chromatography using Merck Silica gel (grade 60, 230-400 mesh) and 4:1 hexanes-ethyl acetate as eluent. In case of a solid, chromatographic separation was followed by recrystallization from either methanol or ethanol-water mixture. In all cases, the purity of the final product was checked again as described above; the spectral characteristics were found to be in good general agreement with those found in the literature.4 The organic chalcones prepared for this study were either pale-yellow solids or oils of the same color (as specified); the ferrocenyl analogs were reddish-orange solids or oils. For each of the reported compounds below, the 1H NMR data is presented as δ (multiplicity, integral ratio), and the IR data as νCO, νCC. The following % yield and physical data are for new chalcones prepared for this study. Data for other chalcones (not given below) have been reported elsewhere[4], [5] and [6] and are also available online as Supplementary data. The SMILES answer is : COC1=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=CC=C1

"
"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=CC=C1C=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: A 50 mL round-bottomed flask was charged with the appropriate ketone (3.0 mmol), aldehyde (3.0 mmol) and 10 ml of 95% EtOH, to which a NaOH solution [3.5 mmol of NaOH in 10 mL of ethanol-water (1:1, v/v)] was added dropwise. The mixture was stirred at room temperature. In most cases, a precipitate produced after stirring for several hours. The solid was collected by filtration, washed with water and recrystallized from EtOH to get the products. In the cases that oily products were produced, the solvent of reaction mixture was removed by rotary evaporator, the residue was treated with water (20 mL) and extracted with CH2Cl2 (3×20 mL). The organic phase was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and solvent was removed by a rotary evaporator. The mixture was stirred at room temperature. In most cases, a precipitate produced after stirring for several hours. The solid was collected by filtration, washed with water and recrystallized from EtOH to get the products. In the cases that oily products were produced, the solvent of reaction mixture was removed by rotary evaporator, the residue was treated with water (20 mL) and extracted with CH2Cl2 (3×20 mL). The organic phase was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and solvent was removed by a rotary evaporator. The residue was purified by column chromatography with petroleum ether/ethyl acetate (15:1-5:1) as an eluent to give products. The SMILES answer is : COC1=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=CC=C1

Filtration yielded a solid precipitate, which was then recrystallized from ethanol.",COC1=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=CC=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=CC=C1C=O, Temperature: 0 - 20°C, Time: 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Aromatic aldehydes (10 mmol, 1.0 equiv) and aromatic ketones (10 mmol, 1.0 equiv) were dissolved in 15 mL of ethanol at 0 C. The solution was stirred for about 15 minutes. A 10 mL aliquot of a 40 % aqueous potassium hydroxide solution was then slowly added dropwise to the reaction flask. After the addition is complete, the reaction solution was allowed to stir at room temperature for approximately 4 h. Filtration yielded a solid precipitate, which was then recrystallized from ethanol. The SMILES answer is : COC1=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=CC=CC=C2)C=CC=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCOC(=O)C(=O)OCC, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Na (25.3 g, 1.1 mol) was added to anhydrous EtOH (600 mL) within 30 min, and the mixture was stirred at room temparature for 2 h. Then, a mixture of diethyl oxalate (146 g, 1.0 mol) and dry acetone (58 g, 1.0 mol) was added slowly dropwise within 3 h. The reaction mixture was stirred at room temprature for additional 1 h, and then was filtered. The obtained filter cake was added into a mixture of ice (500 g) and water (1 L), and then concentrated sulfuric acid was added to adjust the pH to 1, extracted with EtOAc. The EtOAc layer was washed with brine, dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate, and concentrated under vacuum to give the title compound (95 g, 60%). 1H NMR (CDCl3):δ6.37 (1H, s), 4.35 (2H, q, J=7.2 Hz), 2.26 (3H, s), 1.38 (3H, t, J=7.2 Hz).",CCOC(=O)C(=O)CC(C)=O,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CCOC(=O)C(=O)OCC, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 4 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Then, diethyloxalate (1, 125 mmol of) was added dropwise to the in situprepared sodium ethoxide, and the mixture was stirred for 1h in an ice bath, followed by dropwise addition of theethanol solution of desired acetophenone (2, 50 mmol). Themixture was stirred for 24-48 h at room temperature, andthen the pH was adjusted to 2 using sulfuric acid solution(5%) when the completion of the reaction was checked byTLC (ethyl acetate/n-hexane:1/10). Subsequently, the crude was extracted withchloroform, water, and saturated solution of sodiumbicarbonate and brine, respectively. The organic phase wasdried over anhydrous sodium sulfate, and the solvent wasevaporated under vacuum. Compound 3 was obtained as anoily product, which was used for the next step withoutfurther purification (yield: 70%) [26, 27]. The SMILES answer is : CCOC(=O)C(=O)CC(=O)C1=CC(OC)=C(OC)C=C1

"

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C(OC)=C1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=C1)C(C)=O, Temperature: 20°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Claisen-Schmidt condensation. To a solution of substituted acetophenone (100 mg) and substituted benzaldehyde (1.2 eq) in a mixed solvent of EtOH and H2O (v/v, 2:1, 5 mL) at room temperature, NaOH aqueous solution (1 mol/L, 0.5 mL) was added dropwise. The result mixture was stirred overnight and the reaction process was monitored by TLC (5:1, PE/EA). Then, the reaction was quenched with 20 mL water, and extracted with DCM (2×10 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated in vacuo. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: Claisen-Schmidt condensation. To a solution of substituted acetophenone (100 mg) and substituted benzaldehyde (1.2 eq) in a mixed solvent of EtOH and H2O (v/v, 2:1, 5 mL) at room temperature, NaOH aqueous solution (1 mol/L, 0.5 mL) was added dropwise. The result mixture was stirred overnight and the reaction process was monitored by TLC (5:1, PE/EA). Then, the reaction was quenched with 20 mL water, and extracted with DCM (2×10 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel to afford chalcone derivatives. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: COC(=O)C(=O)OC, second reactant: CC(C)=O, Temperature: 0 - 5°C, Time: 8 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. The reaction mixture was stirred for 8 hours at 0-5 C. The reaction mixture was poured into 200 mL water and extracted with ethyl acetate (150 mL) to remove organic impurity. After the completion of the dropwise addition, the reaction was continued at 30-40 for 6 hours. The reaction was completely followed by GC (crotonaldehyde ≤2%) and the reaction solution was cooled to room temperature (20-25 ), 500ml of water and 1000ml of toluene was added and stirred for 30 minutes, allowed to stand for 30 minutes, separated into layers, and then 500ml of water was added to the organic layer and stirred for 30 minutes, allowed to stand for 30 minutes, The organic layer was depressurized and desolvented. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: To a solution of lithium bis(trimethylsilyl)amide (1M in THF) (100 mL, 100 mmol) in THF (100 mL) under N2 and cooled to -78 C was added ethyl acetate (9.74 mL, 100 mmol). The reaction mixture was stirred for 30 minutes, and then acetone (8.81 mL, 120 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred for 10 minutes, and then quenched with HCl (2M aqueous, 70 mL, 140 mmol) and allowed to warm to ambient temperature. The reaction mixture was extracted with EtOAc (2 x 150 mL). The organic phases were combined and washed with saturated aqueous NaHC03 (2 x 50 mL), dried (MgS04), filtered and concentrated to afford the product as a yellow oil (12.8 g, 88% yield). 1H NMR (CDC13) δ 4.18 (q, 3H), 2.49 (s, 2H), 1.29 (m, 9H). The SMILES answer is : CCOC(=O)CC(C)(C)O

"

The mixture was magnetically stirred in an ice bath for 15 minutes. Fulfilled the cooling time 5 ml containing 0.5 mmol of NaOH solution in 50:50 MeOH/H2O was added dropwise. The reaction mixture was left with magnetic stirring in an ice bath for 2 hours or until its precipitation if there is no precipitation. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(O1)C=O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, Temperature: 0 - 5°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In accordance with Scheme 1, selected 4-substituted acetophenone (10 mmol) was dissolved in anhydrous ethanol (10 mL). NaOH anhydrous ethanol solution (10%, 5 mL) was added to the solution. The mixture of selected aldehyde (10 mmol) and anhydrous ethanol (10 mL) was slowly added to the above solution in an ice box under stirring. The reaction was kept at 0-5 C for 3-5 h and monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC). After completion, the reaction mixture was poured into ice water and neutralized by HCl (10%) till the solution became neutral. The solid that precipitated was filtered and washed with distilled water. The crude products were recrystallized from anhydrous ethanol/dichloromethane (v/v = 1:1) to give intermediate 1 in the yield exceeding 90%. In order to obtain enough intermediate 1 (from 10 mmol to 30 mmol) for the subsequent synthesis of compounds 2 and 3, the synthesis of intermediate 1 was repeated several times.",CC1=CC=C(O1)C=CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC1=CC=C(O1)C=O, second reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1, Temperature: 0 - 5°C, Time: unknown hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: ethanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: In accordance with Scheme 1, selected 4-substituted acetophenone (10 mmol) was dissolved in anhydrous ethanol (10 mL). NaOH anhydrous ethanol solution (10%, 5 mL) was added to the solution. The mixture of selected aldehyde (10 mmol) and anhydrous ethanol (10 mL) was slowly added to the above solution in an ice box under stirring. The reaction was kept at 0-5 C for 3-5 h and monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC). After completion, the reaction mixture was poured into ice water and neutralized by HCl (10%) till the solution became neutral. The solid that precipitated was filtered and washed with distilled water. The crude products were recrystallized from anhydrous ethanol/dichloromethane (v/v = 1:1) to give intermediate 1 in the yield exceeding 90%. In order to obtain enough intermediate 1 (from 10 mmol to 30 mmol) for the subsequent synthesis of compounds 2 and 3, the synthesis of intermediate 1 was repeated several times. The SMILES answer is : CC1=CC=C(O1)C=CC(=O)C1=CC=C(Cl)C=C1

Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a stirred solution of 2-acetylpyridine (0.100mL, 0.108g, 0.890mmol), for example, in EtOH (2.5mL) was added aqueous 8M KOH (1-6 equivalent). This mixture was stirred at 0C for 10 min, followed by addition of the corresponding aldehyde (1.5 equivalent) dropwise at the same temperature. The mixture was gradually warmed up to room temperature until 2-acetylpyridine was completely consumed according to TLC analysis. At the end of the reaction time, the mixture was quenched by 2N HCl, diluted with H2O and extracted with CH2Cl2. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: To a stirred solution of 2-acetylpyridine (0.100mL, 0.108g, 0.890mmol), for example, in EtOH (2.5mL) was added aqueous 8M KOH (1-6 equivalent). This mixture was stirred at 0C for 10 min, followed by addition of the corresponding aldehyde (1.5 equivalent) dropwise at the same temperature. The mixture was gradually warmed up to room temperature until 2-acetylpyridine was completely consumed according to TLC analysis. At the end of the reaction time, the mixture was quenched by 2N HCl, diluted with H2O and extracted with CH2Cl2. "Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=N1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 12 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Referring to the literature 9b by a modified method, to a solutionof 2-acetyl pyridine (20 mmol) and aldehyde (20 mmol) in methanol (60 mL) was added to KOH (20 mmol) and H2O (2 mL) at ambient temperature. The resulting solution was stirred at room temperature for 12 h. Then H2O (1000 mL) was added,filtered under reduced the pressure, dried to obtain the crude product. The crude product was purified by column chromatography over silicagel with EtOAc/n-Hexane (1:10) as eluant, affording the chalcones containing pyridine (1a~1m).",COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=NC=CC=C2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CC=N1, second reactant: COC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 12 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: Referring to the literature 9b by a modified method, to a solutionof 2-acetyl pyridine (20 mmol) and aldehyde (20 mmol) in methanol (60 mL) was added to KOH (20 mmol) and H2O (2 mL) at ambient temperature. The resulting solution was stirred at room temperature for 12 h. Then H2O (1000 mL) was added,filtered under reduced the pressure, dried to obtain the crude product. The crude product was purified by column chromatography over silicagel with EtOAc/n-Hexane (1:10) as eluant, affording the chalcones containing pyridine (1a~1m). The SMILES answer is : COC1=CC=C(\C=C\C(=O)C2=NC=CC=C2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CO1, second reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 0.333333 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The condensation reaction was carried out by reactingan equimolar mixture of aromatic benzaldehydeand acetophenone or 2-acetylfuran in methanol inthe presence of KF-modifi ed clay (30 mg) at roomtemperature (Scheme 1). The progress of the reactionis monitored by thin-layer chromatography everyfi ve minutes. At the end of the reaction, the productprecipitates. It is then taken up in dichloromethane (2 ×10 mL). The organic phase is dried over Na2SO4 andthe solvent is evaporated using a rotary evaporator. Theproduct is then purifi ed by recrystallization from ethanoland characterized by FTIR, 1H NMR, and 13C NMR.",CC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CO2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CO1, second reactant: CC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20°C, Time: 0.333333 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: The condensation reaction was carried out by reactingan equimolar mixture of aromatic benzaldehydeand acetophenone or 2-acetylfuran in methanol inthe presence of KF-modifi ed clay (30 mg) at roomtemperature (Scheme 1). The progress of the reactionis monitored by thin-layer chromatography everyfi ve minutes. At the end of the reaction, the productprecipitates. It is then taken up in dichloromethane (2 ×10 mL). The organic phase is dried over Na2SO4 andthe solvent is evaporated using a rotary evaporator. Theproduct is then purifi ed by recrystallization from ethanoland characterized by FTIR, 1H NMR, and 13C NMR. The SMILES answer is : CC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CO2)C=C1

"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CO1, second reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20 - 25°C, Time: 6 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An aqueous solution of sodium hydroxide (20%, 10 mL) was added slowly to the stirring solution of the appropriate aryl aldehyde (1 mmol) and appropriate acetophenone (1 mmol) in methanol (20 mL) in 100 mL conical flask. The stirring was continued for 6 h, keeping the temperature of reaction mixture between 20 and 25 C. The reaction mixture was then poured into ice cold water (100 mL). It was then neutralized with hydrochloric acid (5%). A yellow solid was obtained after filtration which was recrystallized from ethanol and was used further for the next step.",ClC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CO2)C=C1,"Predict the product for the following reaction: First reactant: CC(=O)C1=CC=CO1, second reactant: ClC1=CC=C(C=O)C=C1, Temperature: 20 - 25°C, Time: 6 hours, Catalyst: unknown, Solvent: methanol; water. Also the procedure of the reaction was the following: General procedure: An aqueous solution of sodium hydroxide (20%, 10 mL) was added slowly to the stirring solution of the appropriate aryl aldehyde (1 mmol) and appropriate acetophenone (1 mmol) in methanol (20 mL) in 100 mL conical flask. The stirring was continued for 6 h, keeping the temperature of reaction mixture between 20 and 25 C. The reaction mixture was then poured into ice cold water (100 mL). It was then neutralized with hydrochloric acid (5%). A yellow solid was obtained after filtration which was recrystallized from ethanol and was used further for the next step. The SMILES answer is : ClC1=CC=C(C=CC(=O)C2=CC=CO2)C=C1
